loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.fr: Alphonsine N. a 50 ans, elle est veuve, et elle a 6 enfants entre 16 ans et 15 ans.  Son niveau d’éducation est 4 ans d’école primaire, et 3 de ses enfants vont a l’école.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour renouveler sa maison en nouveau charpente, sable, et ciment.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de valoriser de plus sa maison pour élever les revenus qui viennent de la location.  Elle voudrait continuer sa carrière jusqu'à l’âge qui lui obligera de se reposer (elle est agent d’IMF).  Elle voudrait aussi payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants jusqu’au niveau, et assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en: Alphonsine N. is 50 years old and is a widow with 6 children between the ages of 16 and 15 years. She completed 4 years of primary school, and 3 of her children go to school. She is going to use her loan to repair her house with a new frame, sand and cement. Her strategy for the growth of the business is to make her house attractive in order to increase the revenue that comes from renting it out. She would like to continue her career until the age at which she will be obliged to retire (she is an IMF official). Alphonsine would also like to pay the educational expenses of her children and assure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: Repairing her house with a new frame, sand and cement.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more peanuts, pepper, oil, onions, tomatoes, etc. for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy meat for sale

loans.name: Mubaro

texts.en:
Mubaro owns a small cafeteria. She offers quality services and delicious meals to her clients. Mubaro has been in the trade for 7 years. Her perseverance, confidence, experience, and consistency in work have guaranteed the growth of her business. She is constantly increasing the assortment of dishes she serves in her cafeteria, which helps her increase her income. 

Mubaro is presently renting the facility which serves as her cafeteria. She is hoping to generate enough income and eventually to purchase these premises, which would give her more flexibility and income as a result. 

Mubaro is very focused. She is a typical high-achiever and knows how to set goals and achieve them. This time, she is requesting a loan of $3000 USD to purchase additional grocery items to diversify her cafeteria menu.      

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy food items for cafeteria

loans.name: Malik

texts.fr:
Monsieur Malik M’BÔ âgé de 37 ans marié et père de quatre  enfants habitant avec sa famille à Sanoubougou I-Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du mali) .
Il exerce l’activité d’achat et vente de Prêt à Porter depuis environ quatorze ans après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès. Vu l’augmentation de sa clientèle et que ses ressources propres ne pouvant satisfaire les attentes de cette clientèle, il  jugea utile de venir auprès de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour lui solliciter un deuxième prêt individuel, après avoir remboursé sans difficulté le premier. 
Ce deuxième lui permettra d’acheter 15 chemises différentes, 17 pantalons de qualité différentes, 15 paires de chaussure différentes (Soulier, Ferardine, etc.), 5 complets de veste, 10 Tee-Shirt, 5 complets de sous-vêtement, etc.
 Il s’approvisionne à Bamako afin de les revendre dans sa boutique située en pleine cœur de la gare routière de Sikasso à une clientèle composée essentiellement des voyageurs et transporteurs.
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 140 000 FCFA qui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce mais également d’honorer ses engagements à l’égard de Soro Yiriwaso et couvrir d’autres dépenses familles.
texts.en:
Mr. Malik M'Bô, 37 years old, married and the father of four, lives with his family in Sanoubougou I-Sikasso (the third administrative district in the Republic of Mali).

He has been practicing the purchase and sale of ready-to-wear clothing for about fourteen years, after having led several businesses without success. Given the growth of his customer base and the fact that his own resources cannot satisfy the demand from his customers, he believed it would be useful to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to seek a second individual loan, having properly repaid the first without difficulty.

This second loan will allow Mr. M'Bô to buy 15 assorted shirts, 17 pairs of pants of various quality, 15 assorted pairs of shoes (dress shoes, Ferardine shoes, etc.), 5 suits, 10 t-shirts, 5 sets of underwear, etc.

Mr. M'Bô purchases his stock in Bamako in order to re-sell it in his shop located at the very center of the bus station in Sikasso, to a customer base made up largely of travelers and freight operators.

Mr. M'Bô hopes to make a monthly profit of 140,000 CFA francs, which will allow him to expand his business, but also to honor his responsibilities to Soro Yiriwaso and to cover other family expenses.

loans.use: Buying clothing.

loans.name: Irongul

texts.en:
K. Irongul has been a farmer for 5 years.  He is dedicated to the production of potatoes and onions. He is married and has 6 children. His wife is a housekeeper and Irongul's business is the sole source of income for his family. His onion harvest is about to come in and that is why he is requesting a loan of 6500 Somoni to acquire agricultural products to apply them to his harvest. With part of the loan, he will also buy young cattle to raise and sell. Irongul wishes to improve his living conditions and hopes to do so from the income that his business will bring.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, mineral fertilizer, and young cattle

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr:
Maïmouna K. est une femme mariée de plus 40 ans et mère de quatre enfants qui vit avec son époux et leurs enfants à Sanoubougou I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.
Madame Maïmouna mène des activités  de préparation de jus de fruits, d’achat et de vente de l’eau minérale, de céréales, de bois de chauffe et de  poissons fumé il y a dix années. Elle jouit d’une forte réputation dans ses activités et reçoit beaucoup de commandes, mais ses ressources ne peuvent pas lui permettre de les satisfaire. Ainsi, elle a besoin de ce septième prêt individuel pour acheter un nouveau réfrigérateur, de l’eau minérale, des céréales et des ingrédients pour la préparation de jus de fruits.
Elle vend les jus de fruits et de l’eau minérale à la gare routière de Sikasso, les céréales sont stockées et vendues à son domicile.
Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ ans, elle a bénéficié  de plusieurs prêts solidaires avec une association des femmes de son quartier et est maintenant à son  septième prêt individuel, tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  réaliser l’essentielle de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Maïmouna K. is a married woman over the age of 40 and a mother of four who lives with her husband and their children in Sanoubougou I, a working-class neighborhood in the city of Sikasso.

Maïmouna has been leading businesses in the preparation of fruit juice, buying and selling mineral water, grains, firewood and smoked fish for ten years. She enjoys a great reputation in her business dealings and receives many orders, but her resources don't allow her to fulfill them all. So she needs this seventh individual loan in order to buy a new refrigerator, mineral water, grains and ingredients for the preparation of fruit juice.

She sells the fruit juice and the mineral water at the bus station in Sikasso, the grains are stored and sold at her home.

She has been working with Soro Yiriwaso for several years, has benefited from several group loans with a women's association in her neighborhood and is now on her seventh individual loan, all the previous loans having been properly repaid.

With this loan, she hopes to make a monthly profit of 200,000 CFA francs, which will be used to cover the bulk of her expenses, contribute to the family expenses, pay the interest on her loan and invest the remainder in her business.

loans.use: Buying miscellaneous goods.

loans.name: Sitan

texts.fr:
Sitan D. est une femme mariée de plus 40 ans et mère de quatre  enfants dont 3 garçons et 1 fille qui vit avec son époux et leurs enfants à Sanoubougou I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.
Sitan D. mène cette activité d’achat et vente de bois de chauffe et de poissons fumé il y a dix années. Elle jouit d’une forte réputation dans cette activité et reçoit beaucoup de commandes surtout en saison hivernale, mais ses ressources ne peuvent pas lui permettre de les satisfaire. Ainsi, elle a besoin de ce septième prêt individuel pour acheter, 8 chargements de charrette en bois de chauffe dans les localités environnantes de la ville de Sikasso  et 10 cartons de poissons fumés à Gao (7ème région administrative du Mali) afin de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’accroitre.
Ses marchandises respectivement le bois de chauffe et les poissons fumés sont vendus à domicile et au marché du quartier.  
Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus cinq ans, a déjà bénéficié de quatre prêts solidaires avec une association des femmes de son quartier et est maintenant à son  septième prêt individuel, tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
 Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 130 000 FCFA qui sera utiliser pour  réaliser l’essentielle de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Sitan D. is a woman over 40 years old, married and the mother of four children, three boys and one girl. She lives with her husband and their children in Sanoubougou I, one of the working-class neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso.

Sitan D. has been buying and selling firewood and smoked fish for ten years. She enjoys a good reputation in this business and receives a lot of orders especially during the winter season. However her resources do not allow her to meet her customers’ demand. Thus she needs this 7th individual loan to buy 8 truckloads of firewood in the locality surroundings the town of Sikasso, 10 boxes of smoked fish in Gao (7th administrative region of Mali) to satisfy the demand of her ever-increasing customers.

Her merchandise, firewood and smoked fish, are sold from home and at the local market.

She has had a five-year relationship with Soro Yiriwaso, and has already received four group loans with a neighborhood woman’s association. She is now on her seventh individual loan, all her previous loans have been fully reimbursed.

With this loan she is planning on making a monthly benefit of 130,000 Francs CFA that will be used to cover the bulk of her family’s expenses, pay her loan and invest in her activity.

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.en:
K. Gavhar is 45 years old. She and her husband have 3 children. For more than 14 years, Gavhar has been running her own business. Gavhar has a small shop where she sells and rents traditional and national wedding dresses. Traditionally, families in Tajikistan are large, consequently there are lots of marriages and Gavhar has many clients. 

The stability of her business allows her to make a considerable contribution to the family’s income. Today Gavhar requests $1500, which she will use to purchase new wedding dresses. Gavhar expresses her gratitude to everyone for supporting her and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: To purchase new wedding dresses to increase offering

loans.name: Yamoussa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yamoussa D. est âgé de 27 ans, marié sans enfant  et résidant avec son épouse à Sanoubougou I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Yamoussa D. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initié à cette activité de couture depuis l’année 2002. Son atelier de couture se trouve devant son domicile à Sanoubougou I où il dispose déjà  de 4 machines dont une machine de broderie et trois machines  de couture simples. Monsieur D. est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses services. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son deuxième prêt., qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter une machine de broderie afin de mieux répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle. 
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mr. Yamoussa D. is 27 years old, married, and without any children.  He resides with his wife in Sanoubougou I, one of the working-class districts in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  After having operated many businesses unsuccessfully, he got introduced to sewing as a business in 2002.  His tailoring shop is found in front of his home in Sanoubougou I, where he already has four machines, including an embroidering machine and three simple sewing machines.  

Mr. D. is in high demand by his customers for the quality of his services. Concerned about further satisfying his burgeoning customer base, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his second loan.   He plans on using this loan for buying an embroidering machine in order to respond to his customers better. 

With this loan, he envisions making a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to increase his business capital, to help with family expenses, and to pay the loan interest.

loans.use: Buy a new embroidering machine

loans.name: Providence

texts.en:
Providence is 35 years old and is married with five children between 9 and 18 years old. She has a general store that sells many products including water, jus, and milk.  She has been in this business for 23 years and employs one other person to help her.

Providence has requested a loan to purchase a large stock of items that she can then wholesale to other vendors and store owners.  In particular, she would like to start with sugar, as it is in much need in her village.  Through access to this loan, Providence has hope for the future.

loans.use: To purchase sugar and other items to wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for clothes kiosk

loans.name: Mukaramkhon

texts.en:
Mukaramkhon is a skilled seamstress. She lives and works in Kurgantyube, Tajikistan, and offers tailoring services.  Mukaramkhon is married and her husband is very supportive of her business endeavors, which is also her greatest hobby. All her products are very well sewn and are relatively affordable, which is why Mukaramkhon's services are always in good demand. 

Mukaramkhon has been in this business for 25 years and has learned some valuable lessons, overcoming challenges and hard times. Her business has another big advantage in that it provides jobs for other people, helping fight the high unemployment rate which has always been a problem in Tajikistan. 

Mukaramkhon is seeking a loan of $1700 USD to purchase sewing machines and accessories to improve the quality of items she offers for sale, and to facilitate some working procedures for her employees.

loans.use: To purchase sewing machines and accessories

loans.name: Candida

texts.en:
Candida is 41 years old and is married with three children between 8 and 19 years old. Candida’s husband works in the government.  Candida is a young entrepreneur who has a business selling African tea and other items in her restaurant.

Candida has requested a loan to purchase more products for her shop. With any extra profits, Candida hopes to pay school fees for her children and save money for the future.

loans.use: To improve and expand the business

loans.name: Anvar

texts.en:
Anvar is married with 4 children. He lives in Kurgantyube, Tajikistan, and sells children’s and women’s clothing in the market. Anvar’s discipline and orderliness have helped his business grow steadily over the past 6 years. Anvar is very good with people. He has a unique gift of understanding people and building relationships with them. These characteristics have helped him become successful in the competitive clothing market. 

Anvar’s biggest dream is to have financial independence and provide a decent livelihood for his family. He hopes the current loan will promote further growth in his business and help him see his dream come true.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new clothing to increase range of offering

loans.name: Bonaventure

texts.en:
Bonaventure is 28 years old.  He is married and has one child who is two years old. Bonaventure sells clothes, mainly women's clothing, and has had this business for a long time.  Currently he employs two people.

Bonaventure has requested a loan to expand his business by adding a variety of styles such as men and children's clothing. With this loan, Bonaventure has a vision of purchasing large bales of clothing to wholesale and retail at the same time to increase his revenue.  If successful, he hopes to continue building a secure future for his family.

loans.use: To buy men and children's clothing to resell

loans.name: Tuzamurane Group

texts.fr: Consieu K. est commercant de cabaret (bar), et il est un membre du groupe Tuzamurane.  Il a 63 ans, il est marie, et il a 3 enfants entre 32 ans et 36 ans.  Son niveau d’éducation est 3 ans d’école secondaire.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour son commerce de cabaret.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de bien attire les clients.  Il voudrait arrive a un niveau ou il peut demander même plus qu’un million RWF.  Il voudrait aussi la progression de la famille et de sa cote financière.
texts.en: Consieu K. is a ‘cabaret’ (bar) owner and a member of the group Tuzamurane.  He is 63 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 32 and 36.  He has three years of middle school education.  He is going to use his loan for his cabaret.  His strategy for business growth is do a good job attracting customers.  He would like to reach a level at which he can ask for more than even 1 million RWF.  He would also like his family to progress, as well as his finances.

loans.use: A 'cabaret' business (snack bar)

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 39 years old and is single. He manages a clothing store for women and children in Kigali city center that is open from 8am until 7pm every day. This is his twelfth year in business. His business is well-known and organized. 

Emmanuel has requested a loan to purchase additional products to sell, such as clothes and shoes. Emmanuel will be able to attract more customers and earn more profit. With this profit, Emmanuel will be able to build his own house.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of tea, milk and bread.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 34 years old and she is a widow. She looks after an orphan who is now 15 years old. She is well-known as a young entrepreneur selling mostly women's clothing. She runs a clean and well-organized store and has been in this business for eight years.

Fatuma has requested a loan to purchase more men's and children's clothing to sell. Fatuma will save a portion of any profits for her future, as she now has a fiance; the other portion will be used for further reinvestment in her business.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more eggs and dried fish.

loans.name: Porvenir Group

texts.es:
El comité Porvenir nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Este comité es de la Ciudad de Capiatá,  fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
La Sra. Benicia N., presidenta del grupo tiene 41años, ella esta domiciliada en Capiatá, allí también tiene su  puesto de costura y venta en su domicilio, y es una mujer emprendedora e innovadora.
 Ella trabaja sobre pedido de muchas clientes, y actualmente por las fiesta de tiene mucho trabajo y se encuentra muy contenta.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales para la confección y  para algunas reparaciones en su casa.
texts.en:
The 'Porvenir' (Future) committee was created with the help and support of another committee which was already working in their area.

This committee is located in the city of Capiatá.  The group's members set as their main goal the growth of each and every one of them.  They are known in their area as very hard-working women.

Mrs Benicia N. is the group's president.  She is 41 years old and lives in Capiatá.  There she has a place in her home where she makes clothes and sells them.  She is an enterprising and innovative woman.

Benicia works on orders which she receives from her many customers.  Currently, with the holiday period, she has a lot of work and is very happy.  She is requesting a loan to buy materials for making clothes and also to make some repairs to her home.

loans.use: To buy dressmaking materials and to cover some household expenses

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 27 years old and single. This is her 3rd successful year in her business and she works from 7 in the morning to 6 in the evening every day.  Chantal owns a small business selling wedding clothes which is well-organized and known in her area.

Chantal has requested a loan to purchase more wedding clothes to sell. She will make use of the profits to reinvest in her business and ensure it continues to do well.

loans.use: To purchase more wedding clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Green Group

texts.en:
Fatuma H. is in her early twenties and is married with one child. She has been running a small food shop for the past year, from which she sells ready-made food and drinks. The shop is open between 09:00 am and 05:00 pm and earns Fatuma a small monthly profit. 

This will be Fatuma's fourth loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Fatuma used her previous loans to increase the supplies in her store, mostly things such as cups, plates, and buckets. These loans have all been successfully repaid. With her fourth loan, Fatuma is looking to take the first main step towards her dream which is to buy a small piece of land where she will start building herself a house. 

Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group Green, which has 17 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying their loans. Fatuma is wearing green, sitting second from right.

loans.use: To buy land.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 26 years old and is single, but cares for two adopted orphans. Paul owns a small business where he sells different items in a shop, such as soap, beans, phone vouchers, salt and other kinds of domestic items. He employs three people in his business, which is well-known and organized, and this is his fifth year in operation. He works from 6 in the morning until 6 in the evening every day.
 
Paul has requested a loan to purchase more products for his store. This purchasing of soap, cosmetics, sugar, etc will allow him to improve his profits.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 43-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife, who stays at home and takes care of their child. He has owned shoe shop in his town for the past 15 years. He sells women's and childre's shoes, in addition to selling women's bags. His work is an important source of income for his family.

 His shop is located in a busy area so he was able to gain a good number of clients during this period. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to expand his store’s inventory especially with kids’ shoes for the winter season where the students returns to school and the families buy new shoes for their kids. It is the right time to take advantage of that and earn extra profit. In the future, he hopes to open a men's shoe shop in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to expand his store’s inventory

loans.name: Analia Dolores

texts.es:
Analia es una joven de 27 años es soltera vive con sus padres, son una familia de escasos recursos económicos, ella ha logrado estudiar una carrera profesional Abogada, con la ayuda de sus padres y del hermano mayor que también es Abogado termino la carrera pero le falta defender sus tesis para de esa manera poder ejercer su profesión, hace poco el padre enfermo de parálisis facial  entonces dejo de trabajar y ya no había ingresos para cubrir los gastos de la casa y de la construcción de la casa que en ese entonces se estaba realizando , dicha construcción también se suspendió por ese problema , entonces Analia tuvo que empezar a trabajar prestando sus servicios, y de esa manera ayudar a la madre con los gastos básicos de la casa.

Analia vive en el municipio de Sacaba en la comunidad de Chacacollo, trabaja en Bufete de su hermano.
El préstamo será destinado para la construcción de una pequeña casa que ella esa empezando a construir en un terreno que la madre le heredo y de esa manera vivir de manera independiente, pero seguir ayudando a su madre con los gastos de la casa.

Entre sus sueños y metas de Analia es defender sus tesis y de esa manera tener su título provisión nacional y poder tener su propio Bufete y terminar de construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Analia is a young woman of 27.  She is single and lives with her parents.  They are a family of few economic means.  Analia has managed to study a law degree with the help of her parents and her older brother who is a lawyer.  She has finished her degree but she still needs to defend her thesis in order to be able to practice her profession.  A little while ago her father suffered a facial paralysis.  He had to stop working and they no longer had money to cover their household expenses or to finish building a home which they were doing at that point.  The house building had to be suspended.  Analia had to start working so that she could help her mother cover their basic household expenses.

Analia lives in the town of Sacaba, in Chacacollo community.  She works in her brother's law office.  She will use this loan to build a small house that she is starting to build on a plot of land that her mother gave her as an inheritance so that she can live independently but at the same time keep helping her mother with the household expenses.

Analia's dreams and goals are to defend her thesis and thereby gain her official state-approved degree that will authorize her to work in her profession, to own her own lawyer's office and to finish building her home.

loans.use: To build a house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To grow her hairdressing salon business.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El Sr. Daniel se dedica a la compra y ventas de artículos de despensa como azúcar , aceite , huevo, etc.
  Esta casado con la Sra. María tienen un hijo en edad escolar , ella se dedica a la compra y ventas de ropas , calzado deportivos.
 Con un poco de su ahorro pudo montar su negocio.
Su forma de trabajo es la de recorrer barrios de la ciudad para vender sus mercaderias y quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad de las fiesta para aumentar la ventas y al mismo tiempo las ganancias.
 El  necesita de este crédito para la compra de mas mercadería ya que tiene varios pedidos , ya que llega las fiesta de fin de año.
En el futuro  desea abrir un local propio , y seguir distribuyendo.
texts.en:
Daniel earns his living buying and selling pantry items like sugar, oil, eggs, etc.  He is married to María and thy have one school-aged child.  María buys and sells sports clothing and shoes.  

Daniel was able to launch his business with a bit of his savings. He goes around to neighborhoods in the city selling his merchandise, and he would like to take advantage of the holidays to grow his sales and thus his earnings.

Daniel needs this loan to buy more merchandise because he has some orders for the coming new year's parties.  In the future he would like to open his own shop and continue distributing merchandise.

loans.use: To buy cider, sweet bread, and other consumer goods for the holidays.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.es:
La  Sra. Eleuteria  tiene 66 años ,tiene 4 hijos todos mayores de edad, ella posee una despensa  con una antigüedad de 20 años con una  buena clientela formada en el barrio donde vive y sus alrededores. 
Es un verdadero sacrificio para ella  porque tiene que madrugar para surtir su negocio y así cumplir con sus clientes .
Eleuteria necesita de este crédito para la compra de mercaderías en cantidad por las fiestas que se aproximan  y así lograr  mejores ganancias . 
En el futuro desea ampliar su negocio y comprar un vehículo para realizar mejor su trabajo
texts.en: Mrs. Eleuteria  is 66 and has 4 children, all grown. She has a 20-year-old store with a good customer base from her neighbourhood and the surrounding area. It is a true sacrifice for her because she has to get up early to stock her business and thus serve her customers. Eleuteria needs this loan for the purchase of merchandise for the upcoming holidays in order to obtain better income. In the future she wants to expand her business and purchase a vehicle to better do her job.

loans.use: The purchase of sugar, rice, noodles, oil, meat, yerba, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more timber.

loans.name: Xaverine

texts.en:
Xaverine is 55 years old.  She is married and has four children between the ages of 15 and 29.  She also cares for two orphans.  

Xaverine has worked very hard in her restaurant and has grown her business over the last ten years.  She now employs 5 staff members.  Xaverine sells a variety of typical Rwandan food in her restaurant. 

Xaverine has requested a loan to buy more foodstuffs for her restaurant and more supplies such as plates, spoons, and other items to help expand her business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs and supplies for restaurant

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
Alita is from the village of Dicayas. She is 56 years old and is single. Alita operates a family member's business in the agriculture sector  raising pigs in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Alita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials and labor needed to build her pig fence. Alita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional piglets and feeds for her business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Alita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feeds

loans.name: Babken

texts.en:
Babken H. is 23 years old. He lives in the village of Ddmashen, near the town of Sevan, with his parents and his two sisters. Babken’s mother teaches biology in a Ddmashen school.  His father helps him in the business.  One of Babken's sister is school-aged, and the other is a teacher like their mother. 

Babken is taking the Correspondence Courses at the Teachers Training College in Yerevan.  Parallel to his studies, he has his own business, which consists of lavash (Armenian bread) production and sale. The bakery is in the family’s private house. Babken and his father have been running this business for 6 years. 

Thanks to his first Kiva loan, Babken was able to purchase flour wholesale, as well as buy a mini lorry which he uses to deliver his products to Sevan area shops.

Babken needs a 1,000,000 AMD loan to purchase more flour at wholesale and to construct a new stove for his bread production.

loans.use: To purchase flour, and construct new stove

loans.name: Ramatoulaye

texts.fr: Madame Ramatoulaye D. est une commerçante qui exerce une activité d'aviculture ; elle est âgée de 49 ans. Elle a une grande expérience dans le secteur depuis prés de 12 ans. Ce prêt entre dans le cadre de la préparation des festivités de Noël et de fin année . La commercialisation de ses poulets lui servira de satisfaire les besoins de sa famille et aider son mari sur l'éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ramatoulaye D. is a shopkeeper who raises poultry. She is 49 years old. She has a vast experience in this area, being in it for 12 years. This loan is in preparation of the Christmas and the year-end festivities. 

The sale of her chickens will help her to meet the needs of her family and to help her husband with the children’s school fees.

loans.use: Sale of chickens

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy ladies jeans/trousers to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 54-year-old married man and the father of five children. His three oldest children are working and his younger two children both attend secondary school. He is from Lebanon. He has made his living as a house painter for over fifteen years. He works on a freelance basis upon request of the clients. 

Over the years, he has been able to meet his family's needs, especially raising such a big family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renew his tools and purchase scaffolding for his newest project.

loans.use: renew his tools and purchase scaffolding

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is 34 years old and is married with 3 children aged between 1 and 5 years old.  Jonathan is known in the business of selling art and craft. He has been in this business for about 2 years. 

Jonathan has requested a loan for the purpose of purchasing more art to sell, such as handicrafts, carvings, and other items.  If successful, Jonathan hopes to continue building a secure future for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more arts and handicrafts to sell

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité La Esperanza nace hace de dos años mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Este comité es del Barrio San Miguel  de Guarambare, en estos dos años de intenso trabajo han crecido tanto social como económicamente, son muy activas nunca se atrasaron y siempre cancelan por adelantado es un grupo muy unido con muchas creatividad y ganas de salir adelante. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Emilia quien se dedica a la venta de ropas desde un puesto de venta quien  posee un puesto de venta.
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y realiza varias actividades para ayudar a su comité.
Solicita el prestamo para la compra de ropas como remeras, shorts, vestidos, y otros.
texts.en: The La Esperanza ['Hope'] Committee was born two years ago from the action and support of another committee working in the same location. This Committee is from the San Miguel de Guarambare Neighbourhood. In these two years of intensive work it has grown socially and economically. They are very active-they are never late and always repay ahead of time. This is a very united group with much creativity and desire to succeed. One of the members is Mrs. Emilia, who sells clothing from a sales stall. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of clothing such as t-shirts, shorts, dresses and others.

loans.use: The purchase of clothing-t-shirts, shorts, dresses and others.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 26-year-old single man from Lebanon. He has inherited his cement business from his father. He has been involved in this business for the past six years. He obtained a first Kiva loan to invest in a second-hand cement machine. From the numerous cement blocks at his production facility, it seems that he is able to produce a significant quantity of cement on a daily basis. 

He buys cement bags in bulk from a local factory and then uses his machine to make cement blocks. He generally sells the blocks to individual customers upon request. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase tools and supplies needed. In the future, he would like to expand his business and purchase 2 or 3 more machines.

loans.use: to purchase tools and supplies needed

loans.name: Dame

texts.fr: Monsieur Dame D. est un menuisier ébéniste qui vit avec sa famille et ses parents à Mbour; il est âgé de 29 ans. Il est dans ce secteur d'activité depuis prés de 15 ans. Le but du prêt est l'acquisition de bois et autres matériaux pour prendre en devant certaines commandes de ses clients. Ainsi, il pourra bénéficier du gain de temps et de profit qui lui permettra d'anticiper sur ses dépenses quotidiennes et autres charges assimilées
texts.en: Mr. Dame D., aged 29, is a woodworker specializing in ebony.  He lives with his family and his parents in Mbour.  He has been working in this sector for almost fifteen years.  The goal of his loan is to acquire wood and other supplies and equipment to get ready for certain customer orders.  He would therefore be able to benefit from the time and the profit gained.  This will enable him to think ahead for his day-to-day expenses and other similar expenses.

loans.use: Equipment

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Achat du riz, sucre, farine de maiz, manioc

loans.name: Asufati

texts.en:
Asufati is 22 years old and she is married with two children who are 3 and 7 years old. She is well known as a young entrepreneur selling a variety of clothes, mainly women’s clothes. This is her tenth year in business.

Asufati has requested a loan to purchase more clothing styles for men and children. She hopes this will increase her profits, which she plans to use to continue to grow her business.

loans.use: To expand the business's variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 35-year-old single woman living with her parents. She is from Lebanon. She started her business selling accessories out of her home. Today, she is the proud owner of an accessories shop. She has been working hard in her store for the past five years. She cooperates with her brother who works as a farmer to pay the family expenses. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her store’s inventory of accessories and perfumes.  She notes that the diversity of her merchandise selection will attract more customers and therefore increase her sales. In the future, she is planning to add women's bags and clothes to her shop.

loans.use: to increase her store’s inventory of accessories and perfumes

loans.name: Vania

texts.es:
La señora Vania D. R.,  tiene 23  años de edad, viven en la comunidad de Tin Tin  de la  provincia de Mizque del departamento de Cochabamba,   tiene tres  hijos, el padre de su primer hijo les dejo a causa de un accidente y a su segundo esposo se dedica a beber en demacia descuidando a su esposa y a sus hijos.
Esta época por el desastre natural de la sequía que afecto su pequeña parcela de zanahoria no maduro bien, este desastre le hizo fracasar en sus ingresos económicos que ella esperaba.
 
Vania es una persona  muy querida y respetada en el lugar donde vive, por lo dedicada a sus hijos  y su trabajo, que a veces hasta tiene que trabajar en jornal en la agricultura para ganar algunos pesos y así mantener a sus dos hijos, la actividad de la panadería le ayuda en estas época.

Vania está solicitando el crédito para  atender su negocio de tienda de panadería en el lugar donde vive  para mejorar sus ingresos económicos y  darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y puedan asistir a la escuela  en mejores condiciones.  El crédito ayudara mucho a sus hijos y a ella en el duro trabajo que realiza.
texts.en: Mrs. Vania D. R.,  age 23, lives in the Tin Tin community in the Mizque province in the department of Cochabamba. She has three children. The father of her first child left them due to an accident, and her second husband drinks too much and neglects his wife and children. At the moment, her small carrot crop is not growing well due to the natural disaster-drought- that is affecting it. This disaster has caused her expected income to fail. Vania is a very well-liked and respected person in her neighbourhood, as she is dedicated to her children and to her work. At times she works as a day labourer in agriculture in order to earn a few pesos and thus maintain her two children. Her bakery is helping her in this time. Vania is requesting this loan for her bakery, which is located in her neighbourhood, to improve her income and provide a better quality of life for her children so that they can attend school in better conditions. This loan will help her children, and help her greatly in the hard work that she does.

loans.use: Working capital for bakery

loans.name: Anne Marie

texts.fr: Madame Anne Marie S. est une commerçante qui a ses activités dans un marché de la place à Mbour. Elle est veuve et s'occupe de la survie de sa famille avec son commerce. Elle évolue dans se secteur depuis plusieurs années et vend des tissus,des produits aleo vera dans ses temps libre ; elle fait aussi de la teinture. En quelque elle est dans tout ce qui peut lui procurer de l'argent. Ainsi, pour asseoir ses besoins elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer sa boutique
texts.en: Ms. Anne Marie S. is a merchant who operates at a local market in Mbour. She is a widow who is busy supporting her family with her business.  She has been advancing in this sector for several years selling cloth, and she sells aloe vera products in her spare time.  She also dyes cloth.  In a manner of speaking, she is into anything that can bring in money. Thus, to meet her needs, she is requesting this loan to bolster her shop.

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Paula Julia

texts.es: Paula Julia tiene 47 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de semilla de jícaro y trigo. Estos productos son muy tradicionales por medio de ellos se realizan bebidas típicas nicaragüenses. Ella dio inicio hace 11 años, por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y proporcionarles a sus hijos las necesidades básicas como vestimenta, alimentación y educación. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de semilla, cereal, semilla de trigo entre otros.
texts.en: Paula Julia is 47. She buys and sells gourd and wheat seeds. These products are very traditional and are used to make typical Nicaraguan drinks. She started this business 11 years ago, and she has always enjoyed working and providing her children with the basic necessities such as clothes, food and education. The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of seeds, grains and wheat seeds, among other items.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro Acuña Ramírez  es una persona muy joven él vive solo en la  comunidad de Cazorla  provincia Mizque del departamento  de Cochabamba, Alejandro  con  26 años de edad   desde muy pequeño quedo huérfano su madre y su pequeña hermanita fallecieron en un accidente de movilidad y muy pronto su padre de pena y una enfermedad también murió Alejandro desde muy pequeño  empezó a trabajar en la agricultura con sus vecinos en el  lugar donde vive  ahí fue aprendiendo a cultivar papa  zanahoria y frijol  en el tiempo que creció.

En el lugar donde vive solo cosechan dos veces al año con el esfuerzo de su trabajo y con el  crédito que está solicitando el desea invertir más en sus cultivos comprando y  abono orgánico y semillas para recuperar algo de lo perdido de su anterior  cosecha y de esa manera mejorar su  calidad de vida y ayudarles a sus hermanos menores.
texts.en: Alejandro Acuña Ramírez  is a very young person and lives alone in the Cazorla community, in the Mizque province in the department of Cochabamba. Alejandro is 26. He has been an orphan since he was very young. His mother and little sister passed away in a transportation accident, and soon after his father died of pain and illness. Alejandro started working in agriculture at a very young age with his neighbours in the area where he lives. He learned to cultivate potatoes, carrots and beans as he grew up. In the area where he lives they only harvest twice per year. With his hard work and the loan that he is requesting, he wants to invest more in his crops, purchasing organic fertilizer and seeds to recuperate what was lost in his previous harvest. This way he wants to improve his quality of life and help his younger siblings.

loans.use: Investment in working capital in agricultural work; the purchase of fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Isidra Engracia

texts.es: Isidra se dedica a la actividad del destace de cerdo. Ella es una persona muy responsable, inicio hace 19 años, que tiene a cargo este negocio. Ella ha demostrado que puede sacar adelante su negocio.  La venta la desarrolla en su casa de habitación, la compra de los cerdos la hace en la comarca aledaña, los cuales son compras de contado y al crédito. Ella solicita este crédito con el fin de invertir en la compra de cerdo. Sueña con mejorar su vivienda, con las ganancias que obtenga.
texts.en: Isidra's business is slaughtering pigs.  She is a very responsible person who started in this business 19 years ago.  She has shown that she can get ahead in her business.  She makes her sales from her home.  She buys her pigs in a neighboring district and she buys them for cash or takes them on credit.  She is requesting a loan to invest in buying pigs.  She dreams of improving her home with the profits that she makes.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: Felipe tiene 53 años, su actividad es el comercio de ganado. Hace más de 25 años que tiene este negocio. Pues siempre le ha gustado ser muy independiente y encontrar una forma de generar ingresos a su hogar. El siempre está pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan pues es una persona muy trabajadora. Por sus Padres fue el que el inicio su negocio, ya que ellos decidieron enseñarle como ganarse la vida de una forma honesta. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de ganado. Ya que en esta temporada es que tiene ciertos pedidos.
texts.en: Felipe is 53 years old and is in the livestock business.  He has been in this business for more than 25 years. He has always liked to be very independent and to find ways of making income for his household.  He has always been aware of what his customers are requesting as he is a very hard-working person.  He started his business because his parents decided to teach him how to earn a living in an honest manner.  He would like this loan to buy livestock as he has a certain number of orders to fill during this season.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Edwing Mercedes

texts.es: Edwing brinda los servicios de carpintería. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que con el paso del tiempo es que ha ido obteniendo nuevos clientes.  Siempre le ha gustado ser un Padre responsable tiene cinco hijos, que están a su cargo. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de madera, pega, maque, junco, herramientas entre otras cosas necesarias para la elaboración de los diferentes muebles que elabora.
texts.en: Edwing offers carpentry services.  He has had this business for more than 3 years, and with the passage of time he has obtained new customers.  He has always liked being a responsible father.  He has five children under his care.  The loan that he is applying for  is to purchase wood, glue, shellac, reeds and hardware, among other things necessary for crafting the different types of furniture that he makes.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raul   solicito 400 $us; trabaja  en una fábrica de ladrillos como empleado. Vive en la zona Mercurio de la ciudad de El Alto. Es soltero.

El crédito que solicita lo destinara en la compra de computadora para la continuación de sus estudios. Es el primer  crédito en impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Raul is requesting a loan for $400 USD.  He works as an employee in a brick-making factory and lives in Mercurio neighborhood of the city of El Alto.  He is single.

Raul will use his loan to buy a computer so that he can continue his studies.  This is his first loan with Impro and his first Kiva loan.

loans.use: To buy a computer to continue with his studies

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar   solicito 1000 $us; se dedica  al transporte de pasajeros en su movilidad como taxista, su esposa es artesana confecciona guantes de lana, tiene  tres hijos. Vive en la zona de San Roque de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito que solicita es para la compra de material de construcción para iniciar la refacción de su casa.
 Es el primer  crédito en impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en: Edgar requests $ 1000.  He works in passenger transport as a taxi driver.  His wife is an artisan who manufactures woolen gloves and has three children. He lives in the San Roque zone in the city of La Paz. The loan will be used to purchase construction materials to begin the renovation of his house.  It is his first loan with IMPRO  and the first via Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to renovate his house

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
Jhonny   solicito 1000 $us, se dedica a la  crianza de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la vende a Pil Andina, planta procesadora de leche.
El credito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca y así aumentar su producción de leche y a la vez incrementar sus ingresos.
Vive en la comunidad Nina Chiri, a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz. 
Es el primer  crédito en impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Jhonny is requesting a loan for $1,000 USD.  His business is raising cattle whose milk he sells to Pil Andina, a milk processing plant.

Jhonny will use his loan to buy a cow to increase his milk production and, at the same time, increase his income.  He lives in Nina Chiri community, three hours from the city of La Paz.  This is his first loan with Impro and his first Kiva loan.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to increase his milk production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Santa Isabel Group

texts.es:
El comité Santa Isabel es un comité muy antiguo ya dela Fundación. 
Tuvieron algunos inconvenientes internos pero todo solucionable. 
Trabajan bien en grupo y se ayudan mutuamente para salir adelante.
La señora Lorenza es la presidenta del grupo, una mujer muy trabajadora que lucha por el bienestar de su familia.
Ella trabaja en el venta de ropas desde un puesto que posee en su casa.
Actualmente la venta de sus  mercaderias ha aumentado mucho por lo que solicita el prestamo para contat con mercaderias nuevos y variados, como remeras, shorts, vestidos, y otros.
texts.en:
The Santa Isabel committee is a very long-standing committee working with Fundación Paraguaya.  They have had some internal problems but nothing which couldn't be solved.  The members work well as a group and they help each other to get ahead.

Lorenza is the group's president.  She is a very hard-working woman who works hard for the well-being of her family.  She sells clothes from her home.  Currently, sales of her merchandise have increased a lot so she is requesting a loan so that she can offer new and varied merchandise such as t-shirts, shorts, dresses, etc.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, shorts, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use:
Comprar mercadería en ropa de vestir. 
To buy merchandise, ie., clothing.

loans.name: Guido Daniel

texts.es: Guido Daniel S. C. es un hombre de 46 años de edad que vive en el municipio de Soledad, con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos de 8 y 12 años. Allí tiene un negocio llamado “Bobinas Guido” dedicado a la producción de Bobinas que vende en el centro de Barranquilla, Ciénaga y Fundación, otros municipios costeros; también ofrece el servicio de mantenimiento y reparación de  abanicos  en su propio barrio y vende sus repuestos. Guido inició su negocio  en el año 1990 por la necesidad de buscar ingresos para sostener su familia, y lo ha logrado, pero siempre con la intención y la decisión de crecer y sostenerse en el mercado. Los activos fijos vinculados a la microempresa son sus  cajas de herramientas y una mesa. Su negocio ha sido exitoso por su  servicio calificado, porque ha logrado construir una buena clientela tanto en su comunidad como en el centro de Barranquilla y en los municipios de Ciénaga y Fundación; sus  ventas promedias  son  $3.170.000 COP y genera utilidades del 23 % Desde hace tres años está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la que ha recibido 3 financiamientos que ha aplicado efectivamente a su negocio, razón por la cual ha crecido y sus utilidades se han incrementado,  logrando adquirir su vivienda y pagar la educación de sus hijos, con quienes sueña verlos educarse con calidad y  prosperar  en el futuro, por eso dedicará todos sus esfuerzos a perfeccionar su negocio, adecuándolo en una habitación principal donde se exhiba como un gran taller. Con su credikiva, cuarto financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo comprará: alambre de cobre, carretes, alambre desoldadura repuestos de abanicos,preparandose para el fin de año momento en que hay mucho dinero circulante y su venta se incrementa.
texts.en:
Guido Daniel S. C. is a 46 year old man who lives in the municipality of Soledad, with his spouse and their two children, who are 8 and 12 years old. There he has a business called "Bobinas Guido", (Guido's Coils) where he produces coils that he sells in the center of Barranquilla, Ciénaga, Fundación, and other coastal towns. He also offers maintenance and repair services for fans in his own neighborhood, and sells spare parts for them.

Guido started his business in the year 1990 due to the need to search for income to support his family, which he has attained, always with the intention and the decision to grow and support himself in the market. The fixed assets linked to his micro-business are his tool boxes and a table. His business has been successful due to his skilled service, and he has been able to build a good customer base not only in his community, but also in the center of Barranquilla and the towns of Ciénaga and Fundación.

His average sales are 3,170,000 Colombian pesos, and he generates profits of 23%. For three years he has been linked to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization which has given him three loans which he has applied specifically to his business, which has been the reason it has grown and his profits have increased. This has allowed his to buy his home and pay for the education of his children. He dreams to give them a high-quality education so that they can prosper in the future. For this reason, he will dedicate all of his efforts to improve his business, adapting it to a main room where he displays a grand workshop.

With this "credikiva" (Kiva loan), his fourth loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, he will buy: copper wire, coils, soldering wires, spare parts for fans, preparing himself for the end of the year when there is a lot of money in circulation and his sales increase.

loans.use: copper wire, coils, soldering wire, spare parts for fans, and preparing himself for year-end when there is a lot of money in circulation and his sales increase.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina, confecciona chamarras juntamente con su esposo y tiene dos hijos; vive en  casa propia en la zona Villa Ingavi de la ciudad de El Alto. La mercadería la comercializa en la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito que solicita será utilizado para la compra de materiales , telas, cueros, forros, hilo, etc., para cubrir el incremente de la demanda por sus productos.

Es el primer con IMPRO y el primer via Kiva.
texts.en:
Catalina makes jackets together with her husband. She has two children and lives in her own house in the Villa Ingavi area in the city of El Alto. The merchandise is sold in the city of La Paz. The requested loan will be used to buy materials like fabric, leather, linings, thread etc. to cover the increase in demand for her products. 

This is her first loan with IMPRO and her first with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy materials like fabric, leather, and thread to continue with her jacket business

loans.name: Policarpio

texts.es:
Policarpio es albañil, trabaja como constructor de vivienda y la esposa es comerciante de ropa; tienen cuatro hijos dos de ellos son independientes; tiene su casa propia. Viven en la zona Alto Chijini de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito que solicita es para cubrir el costo de compra de motor para la mezcladora de cemento que posee para su negocio de construcción de viviendas.
Es el quinto crédito con IMPRO y el segundo via Kiva. Excelente cliente.
texts.en:
Policarpio is a construction worker. He builds houses and his wife sells clothing. They have four children. Two of them are independent. He has his own house and lives in the Alto Chijini area in the city of La Paz.
This loan is requested to cover the costs of buying an engine for a cement mixer for his home construction company. 
This is his fifth loan with IMPRO and this is his second loan with Kiva. He is an excellent client.

loans.use: To buy an engine for a cement mixer used for his construction work

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es: Paulino A. necesita comprar celulares de gama baja ya que tiene mayor solicitud y quiere responder oportunamente a su exclusiva clientela, para no dejarla esperando mientras logra las ventas de contado y recupera su cartera.  Él con sus 26 años de experiencia,  sabe que si tiene un capital en efectivo para comprar permanentemente,  su dinero rota rápidamente y sus utilidades se incrementan. Eso es justamente lo que quiere hacer  con su credikiva: manejar un nuevo capital para comprar celulares de gama baja al por mayor y actualizar los accesorios, porque en navidades sus ventas se incrementan y necesita estar preparado. Este es  su financiamiento número 26 con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización que lo ha apoyado durante 14 años , desde cuando inició su  primer negocio que fue la venta de gafas y monturas para lentes,  en un sector muy comercial  donde ubicó  su  primer punto de ventas; él es un hombre satisfecho porque con el fruto de su trabajo en el negocio, pudo ahorrar para comprar su vivienda y ampliarlo y en estos últimos años con los cambios tecnológicos, ha agregado celulares, y adecuados accesorios hasta convertirlo en un sitio muy conocido llamado el "Primer Elemental", ubicado en un nuevo local, donde interactúa con la competencia y todos están en pequeños espacios, que cada uno ha logrado como producto de sus esfuerzos. Paulino es un hombre casado y ejemplar, tiene 62 años y 4 hijos en las edades de 28 a 34 años y es muy participativo en todos los eventos estructurados por la Fundación cuyo objetivo es su crecimiento empresarial. Con sus créditos anteriores ha logrado adquirir su nuevo local, ampliar su negocio, tener un inventario mayor y moderno que mostrar, adquirir vitrinas y enseres, lo que  hace que cada día su microempresa luzca mas armoniosa y capte la atención de nuevos clientes y conserve los actuales.
texts.en:
Paulino A. needs to buy low-range cellular phones, since he has increased requests for them and wants to respond in a timely way to his exclusive customers, so that he doesn't leave them waiting while he sells his current stock and recovers his investment. With his 26 years of experience, he knows that if he has permanent capital in cash for making purchases, his money revolves rapidly and his profits grow. This is exactly what he wants to do with his Kiva loan: manage new capital to buy low-range cellular phones wholesale and update the accessories, because at Christmas his sales increase and he needs to be prepared. 

This is his 26th loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, an organization that has supported him for 14 years, since he began his first business, which was the sale of eyeglasses and frames. His first sales location was in a very commercial sector. He is a very satisfied man, since with the fruit of his business labors, he was able to save to buy his home and enlarge it. In recent years, with all the technological changes, he has added cellular phones and suitable accessories, and he has converted his shop into a very well known place called "Primer Elemental. It is in a new location, where he interacts with the competition and all the merchants are in small spaces, which each one has achieved through his efforts.

Paulino is a married and exemplary man. He is 62 years old and has 4 children with ages between 28 and 34, and he is very involved in all the foundation's structured events whose objective is his growth as an entrepreneur. With his past loans, he has been able to acquire his new location, increase his business, have a greater and more modern inventory to show, and acquire showcases and equipment, which every day give his business a more pleasing appearance, capture the attention of new customers, and keep the present ones.

loans.use: Buy low-range cellular phones wholesale and update accessories.

loans.name: Daysi Georgina

texts.es: La señora Daysi Georgina se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos con Fundación ya que ha sido de gran ayuda. Inicio este medio de vida con la idea de sufragar los gastos del hogar, pues es una persona muy responsable. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de calzado, perfumes, ropa y otras cosas ya que se acerca una buena temporada y quiere tiene que cumplir.
texts.en: Mrs Daysi Georgina sells general merchandise.  She has been in this business for more than five years.  This is not the first time that she has requested a loan from Fundación Leon 2000 and they have been a great help.  She started out in this business to help with her household expenses since she is a very responsible person.  She is requesting this loan to buy footwear, perfume, clothes and other items since a good season is approaching and she would like to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Los Capullitos Group

texts.es: Fabiola tiene 37 años, es conviviente y lleva dos años trabajando con Edaprospo en el grupo “Los capullitos”, nombre que se dio al grupo por simbolizar el inicio D. algo bueno y bonito. El grupo tiene 3 años D. conformado lo conforman 10 personas las cuales son amigas y vecinas. Fabiola y su pareja que es albañil, mantienen la casa y los estudios D. sus cuatro hijos D. 18, 14,7 y 1 año D. edad. Ella ayuda en su hogar con su trabajo D. costurera, desD. hace 12 años desempeña este trabajo para ayudar a su familia y últimamente ah conseguido comprar otra máquina D. coser para hacer sus diseños, los prestamos que se le brinda los utiliza en las telas que son su materia prima y espera comprar más maquinas y formar un equipo D. trabajo, pero para esto necesita más habilitaciones y que Edaprospo no le retire su confianza.
texts.en: Fabiola is 37. She lives with her partner and has worked with Edaprospo in the "Los Capullitos" ("The Buds") group for two years. The group chose this name to symbolize the beginning of something good and beautiful. The group has been together for 3 years and is maD. up of 10 people who are friends and neighbours. Fabiola and her partner, who is a bricklayer, support their household and the studies of their four children ages 18, 14, 7 and 1. She helps her household with her sewing business. She has done this work for 12 years to help her family, and she has recently been able to purchase another sewing machine to make her designs. She uses her loans for fabric, an essential. She hopes to purchase more machines and form a work team, but for this she needs more loans and to remain in Edaprospo's confidence.

loans.use: the purchase of products and inputs

loans.name: Darling Yanet

texts.es: Darling Yanet tiene su pulpería, inicio hace más de 7 años, con el esfuerzo propio de salir adelante. Tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, la ubicación de su actividad es en su vivienda en donde la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a comprar los diferentes productos que ofrece. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para su negocio, en la actualidad solicita este crédito para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Darling Yanet has a grocery store which she started over 7 years ago out of her own desire to get ahead. She has 3 young children under her care. Her store is in her home, and the majority of her customers go there to purchase the  various products that she offers. This is not the first time that she has taken out loans for her business. She is currently requesting a loan for the purchase of candies, soft drinks, bread and detergents, among other items.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Marcial Salvador

texts.es:
Marcial es un hombre muy emprendedor, pequeño comerciante de venta de ropa, zapatos, el cual inicio hace treinta tres años con poca mercadería. Que gracias a su empeño de sobresalir adelante con su familia comienza a vender y aumenta sus niveles de ganancia.
Hoy en día aumento más su capital de productos de ropa nueva, ropa usada y la venta de zapatos con financiamiento que la institución ha dado, lo que para él ha sido de muchos beneficios, para la compra de variedad y estilo de zapato ya que la demanda es mucha.
Día a día labora en un tramo desde horas temprana para lograr vender su mercadería en donde vende a precios accesibles ya que compra a mayorista y que da  a buen precio. Con este nuevo préstamo será para la compra de cajones de zapatos variados para caballeros y niños. Que espera aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en: Marcial is a very enterprising man, a small-scale merchant who sells clothing and shoes. He started doing this thirty years ago with a little merchandise. Thanks to his effort to excel, he started selling with his family and his earnings are increasing. He currently increases his stock of new and used clothing and shoes with the loans that the institution has given him. These loans have been very beneficial for him, for the purchase of varied styles of shoes since there is great demand. Day to day he works, starting very early in the morning, in order to sell his merchandise. He sells at accessible prices, since he buys wholesale and gets a good price. This new loan will be for the purchase of crates of varied shoes for men and children. He hopes to increase his sales.

loans.use: To purchase cases of various shoes for children and men.

loans.name: Marcela Alexander

texts.es: Marcela Alexander tiene más de 5 años con su negocio que es una pulpería. Pues siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar su condición de vida, ya que es una persona muy responsable y siempre se preocupa por proporcionarle a su familia el pan de cada día. Se acercan buenas temporadas y Marcela quiere aprovechar para vender más. Ella está solicitando este crédito para la compra de gaseosas, golosinas, detergentes, granos básicos y pan.
texts.en: Marcela Alexander has been running her general store for more than five years. As a very responsible person, she has always been concerned about improving her standard of living and providing for her family. The important holiday season approaches, and Marcela wishes to take advantage of it by increasing sales. She is seeking a loan to buy soft drinks, candy, detergent, basic grains, and bread.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store

loans.name: Kalo (Étoile) Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Kalo sont toutes mariées et ont une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Ces  femmes se sont connues par des relations de commerce, de parenté et de voisinage. 
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles en nette croissance, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de groupe et tous les cinq prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt AÏSSATOU K., compte acheter, 20 cartons de savons auprès des grossistes de Bamako. Elle effectue sa vente en détail et en gros, au comptant et à crédit au marché de Bougouni. 
Avec ce prêt AÏSSATOU espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35.000 FCFA  qui sera utilisé pour soutenir les frais de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The women of the Kalo group are all married and, on average, are 36 years old with 5 children. They live in traditional extended family households with their brothers, sisters, spouses, co-spouses, and children. These women live in the Torakabougou area in the city of Bougouni (3rd Administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know each other through commercial, neighbourhood, and familial relations.
In order to satisfy the sharply increasing needs of their customers, they decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their sixth group loan, and all five previous loans were repaid properly.
With this new loan, Aïssatou Keïta (one of the members) intends to buy 20 boxes of soap from wholesalers in Bamako. She makes her sales at retail and in bulk, in cash or on credit at the Bougouni market.
With this loan, Aïssatou hopes to realize a monthly profit of 35,000 FCFA, which will be used to pay for her children's health costs.

loans.use: To buy soap

loans.name: Teriya (Amitié) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Teriya (amitié) de l‘association Badeya est composé de femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans, 4 enfants et vivant dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier Heremakono-Centre de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Ces  femmes se sont connues par des relations de commerce, de parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe et le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt MAMBA D.,la présidente du groupe, compte acheter, une balle de friperie et 20 pièces de pagnes auprès des fournisseurs de Bamako. Elle effectue sa vente en détail et en gros, au comptant et à crédit, dans le marché de Bougouni. 
Avec ce prêt MAMBA D. espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70.000 FCFA  qui sera utilisé dans leurs activités.
texts.en:
The Teriya (friendship) group from the Badeya association is composed of married women with an average age of 29 and four children each, living in traditional extended families with their brothers, sisters, co-wives, children and husbands. These women live in the Heremakono-Centre neighborhood in the town of Bougouni (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got to know each other through business, family and neighborhood ties.

In order to satisfy their customers, they decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their second group loan and the previous loan has been fully reimbursed.

With this new loan, Mamba D., the group's president, plans to buy a bale of used clothing and 20 lengths of pagne (brightly colored cloth) from the suppliers in Bamako. She sells her goods both retail and wholesale, for cash and credit, in the Bougouni market.

With this loan Mamba D. hopes to make a monthly profit of 70,000 FCFA which will be used in their business activities.

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Yury Dalila

texts.es:
Yury es una joven de 26 años, casada, madre de cuatro hijos, pequeña comerciante que ha venido invirtiendo en la venta de ropa y cosméticos para poder apoyar a su familia. Su esposo labora en zona franca de operario y es quien ha dado parte del dinero y ahorro de su trabajo anterior.
Inicio  vendiendo solo cosmético de la Avon el cual se vende por catalogo, luego comienza la venta de ropa, zapatos para aumentar el nivel de ventas lo que ha logrado satisfactoriamente. Es por eso necesita más dinero para invertir el cual lo hará por medio de un financiamiento en Afodenic.
En donde comprara ropa, cosmético y comprara también joyas para lograr vender más,  así como captar clientela.
Como planes a futuro es hacer mejoras a su vivienda, como principal pondrá piso a su casa ya que es a un  de tierra.
texts.en:
Yury is a young woman of 26.  She is married and has four children.  She is a small trader, who has invested in the sale of clothing and cosmetics in order to help her family. Her husband is a manual worker in the duty free zone; he gave her some of the money to start her business and has supported her work in the past.  She began by selling Avon cosmetics from a catalog, but then added clothes and shoes to increase her level of sales, which has worked well for her.  For this reason, she needs more investment money and has approached microfinance partner Afodenic for funding.

By buying more clothes, cosmetics and also jewelry, she will be able to sell more products and get more clients.

In the future, she hopes to improve her home by adding an additional floor to her one-level house.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of clothes, cosmetics, and jewelry to entice clients with new products.

loans.name: Pedro Raul

texts.es: Pedro Raúl tiene 48 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de sastrería desde hace más de 26 años que inicio este negocio con el fin de sufragar los gastos de su hogar, el es una persona muy responsable y disfruta de su actividad ya que la mayoría de sus clientes siempre le solicitan diferentes prendas de vestir y el siempre esta preocupándose por ofrecer prendas de muy buena calidad. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de hilos, tijeras, telas, zipper entre otros productos necesarios para la elaboración de sus productos.
texts.en: Pedro Raúl is 48 years old and has been a tailor for more than 26 years.  He started this business to cover his household expenses.  He is a very responsible person and  works diligently to offer high quality clothing. He enjoys his job since the majority of his customers request different types of clothing. With the loan that he is requesting he will buy thread, scissors, fabric, zippers and other items that are necessary to make his clothing.

loans.use: To purchase thread, scissors, fabric, zippers and other items

loans.name: Teriya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Teriya de l’association Balimaya sont toutes mariées et ont une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier Heremakono-Centre de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Ces  femmes se sont connues par des relations de commerce, de parenté et de voisinage. Elles excellent dans le commerce d’articles divers, savons liquides, Sounbala, graines d’arachide, beurre de karité etc.
Pour satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles  en nette croissance, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur premier prêt de groupe. 
Avec ce  prêt MASSABA C., compte acheter, 500Kg de graine d’arachide, 300kg de beurre de karité et quelques paquets de divers autres condiments alimentaires auprès des fournisseurs des villages environnants. Elle effectue sa vente en détail et en gros, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile, dans le marché de Bougouni, aux consommateurs et revendeurs. 
Avec ce prêt MASSABA C. espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the Teriya group within the Balimaya association are all married and, on average, are 34 years old and have 3 children. They live in extended traditional families with their brothers, sisters, co-wives, children and husbands. These women live in the Heremakono-Centre district of the town of BOUGOUNI, (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women met each other through business, family and neighborhood ties. They excel in the sale of various items: liquid soaps, Sounbala (a traditional condiment), peanut seeds, shea butter etc.

In order to meet sharply increasing customer demand, they decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is their first group loan.
