Solicita el crédito para la compra mercaderías de consumo de primera necesidad para cargar en su despensa y  para poder satisfacer la demanda durante estas fiestas navideñas.
 Agradece a la fundación paraguaya el apoyo obtenido para su actividad  y mediante ello su negocio ve en progreso.
texts.en:
Rocío A. is twenty-five, and married to Juan Duarte, who is forty-three.  They live in the city of Caacupé, some fifty-five kilometers from the capital city of Asunción.  They have a one-year-old child together.

They live in the Yaka Roysa compañia [rural areas on the outskirts of Paraguayan cities]  in Caacupé .  They've run a pantry in their house for the past three years.  

Inasmuch as Roció and her husband have made a lot of progress with their business, they need to increase sales by offering the widest variety of products in order to attract customers.  Rocío is seeking a loan to buy merchandise, including basic necessities, for her pantry, so she can satisfy demand during the Christmas holidays.

Rocío appreciates Fundación Paraguaya for supporting her business, which is progressing through the organization's help.

loans.use: To buy merchandise, including drinks, canned goods, sausages, etc.

loans.name: Glenda Yamilet

texts.es:
la sra. Glenda Yamilet E. E. tiene 36 años de edad, vive en los Prados Choluteca, Glenda se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion.
Glenda es madre soltera de 4 hijos, se esfuerza mucho para sacarlos adelante.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas abarroteria al por mayor y asi tener mas surtido su negocio. 
su meta darles un buen estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en: Mrs. Glenda Yamilet Elivir E. is 36 years old and lives in the Prados Choluteca.  Glenda is dedicated to the sale of popular consumer products and has a store in her home.  Glenda is a single mother of 4 children and tries hard to bring them up.  The loan will be used to buy more groceries in bulk to have a better stocked business.  Her goal is to give a good education to her children.

loans.use: the purchase of rice, beef, pork and chicken, beans, cereal, butter, flour, soft drinks, churros, soups, pasta, toilet paper, sardines, candy, balls, soaps, oil, butter, margarine, eggs, candles, batteries, matches, sanitary napkins, salt,

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tires and spare parts

loans.name: Elizabet

texts.es: Elizabet, de 43 años, está casada con Clemente, de 45 años. Ambos tuvieron 6 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos: Joel de 23, Paúl, de 12 e Isabel de 8 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Ricrican. El trabajo al que se dedica Elizabet, es la agricultura, sus principales sembríos son de papa, arveja, olluco (tubérculo). Ya tiene 20 años dedicándose a ello, y como buena mujer del campo, gusta mucho arar la tierra. Sus cuidados que le brinda, hace que sus cosechas sean bien pagadas en las diferentes ciudades donde los comercializa, en Tarma, Huaral, donde lleva semilla de papa para su comercialización. Pero a pesar de su éxito en la agricultura, Elizabet, también se dedica a la compra y venta de carne de carnero. Por los constantes éxitos en sus negocios, ella quiere más adelante seguir mejorando sus cultivos y abrir una tienda de comestibles en su casa. Está segura que lo logrará con la ayuda de sus hijas mayores, que hace algún tiempo, se fueron al país de Argentina, donde trabajan arduamente en búsqueda de un mejor futuro. Este es el  sexto crédito con MFP, y agradece el apoyo recibido en todo este tiempo por los integrantes de su banco comunal. Con el monto que solicita comprará 30 sacos de abono orgánico, para su cultivo de papa, que hace algunos días sembró. Por lo que está segura que obtendrá una buena cosecha para el mes de marzo.
texts.en:
Elizabet is 43 years old.  She is married to 45 year-old Clement.  They have 6 children but only 3 still live with them: 23 year-old Joel, 12 year-old Paúl and 8 year-old Isabel.  They live together as a family in their own home which is located in the town of Ricrican.  Elizabet's business is farming.  Her main crops are potatoes, peas and olluco (a tuber).  She has been in this business for 20 years and, as a good farming woman, she very much enjoys plowing her land. 

The care that Elizabet takes of her land ensures that that her harvests receive a good price in the different cities where they are sold, in Tarma, Huaral where she takes her potato seed to sell.  However, in spite of her success in farming, Elizabeth also works buying and selling mutton.  For the future success of her businesses, she would like to continue improving her crops and open a grocery store in her home.  She is certain that she will achieve this with the help of her elder daughters who went to Argentina some time ago.  They work hard there in search of a better future.

This is Elizabet's sixth loan with MFP and she is grateful for the support she has received in all this time from the members of her community bank.  She will use her loan to buy 30 sacks of organic manure for her potato crop which she sowed some days ago.  She is certain that she will have a good harvest in March.

loans.use: To buy 30 sacks of organic manure

loans.name: Cristo Y Nuestro Esfuerzo 1, 4, 8 Group

texts.en:
Junette is the coordinator of her group, Cristo y nuestro esfuerzo 1, 4, 8 (Christ and our effort). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner. She says that her most difficult challenge is saving enough money to buy a house.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying her business.

Junette is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for three years, starting with a loan she took from a friend. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying shoes, clothes and cosmetics products to sell. She will save the profits, because through this business she wants to make her dreams come true, especially to have her own house. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she wants to improve her business and learn more about how to run a business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural area surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and irregular electricity.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothes and cosmetics products to sell

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
el señor Pedro Pablo R. tiene 68 años de edad, vive en la colonia 21 de Diciembre de la ciudad de Choluteca y se dedica al destazo de ganado,  actividad que realiza desde hace varios años, distribuye su proucto a varias carnicerias de dicha ciudad.
Pedro lucha cada dia para para seguir creciendo como micro empresario y de esta manera darle una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa, es bien responsable y honrado.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ganado.
texts.en:
Señor Pedro Pablo R. is 68 years old. He lives in the 21 de Diciembre neighbourhood of the city of Choluteca and works as a slaughterman, which he has been doing for many years. He sells his meat to various butchers across the city.

Every day Pedro succeeds in growing his small business a little more, and in this way he gives his wife a better quality of life. He is a most responsible and honourable man. The loan will be used for the purchase of livestock.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock for slaughter

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: La señora Delfina nació  en  Chuquisaca el 25 de diciembre,  es viuda, tiene 2 hijos ya mayores,  ella tiene su parcela en Pampa del Coscal a 32 km de San Luis, ella se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería en agricultura ella siembra maíz, maní, poroto y todo lo que ella cosecha lo saca a vender al mercado de El Torno, sus hijos le ayudan en el transporte de mercadería, en cuanto al ganado cría ovejas y vaca,  ella hace también queso para vender,  la Sra. Delfina  es primera vez que está sacando crédito, con el dinero del crédito comprara semillas para la siembra, también para el preparado de la tierra y esta muy feliz y esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Delfina was born in Chuquisaca on the 25th of December, she is a widow, and has two older children. She has farm in Pampa Del Coscal, 32km from San Luis. She dedicates herself to agriculture and ranching. She plants corn, peanuts, and beans, and sells what she harvests in the El Torno market with the help of her children who aid in the transport of her products. In terms of ranching, she also raises sheep and cows, and makes cheese to sell.  This is Delfina’s first time requesting a loan; with this loan she will purchase seeds to plant and also to prepare the land. She is very happy and thankful to institution for the support it has given her.

loans.use: To purchase seeds to plant corn.

loans.name: Dedicación

texts.es: Dedicación, de 44 años, enviudó hace un año de su esposo Maurilio. Ambos tuvieron 5 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos: Nora, de 18 y Candí, de 16 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ricrican. Está valerosa mujer se dedica a la siembra de tubérculos en la variedad de papa, olluco y oca, lo que más le gusta a ella, son los momentos en los que puede bajar de sus terrenos agrícolas a la ciudad, donde vende su cosecha, a muy buen precio. Según cuenta Dedicación, ella baja por lo menos una vez a la ciudad de Tarma, donde aparte de vender sus nutritivos tubérculos, también comercializa carne de cordero al por mayor, con la venta puede costear los alimentos de la semana. Ella agradece a Dios, por todo el apoyo que recibió y a pesar de lo pesado que es trabajar en la chacra, está feliz de poder tener algo propio y trabarlo para sus hijos. Este es el onceno crédito con MFP, y como socia antigua de su banco comunal, espera seguir trabajando por el desarrollo de los mismos. Con el monto que solicita comprará, varios sacos de abono orgánico y si el dinero le alcanza, invertirá en sustancias contra la plaga de insectos que azotan constantemente sus sembríos.
texts.en: Dedicación is 44 years old, and has been widowed this past year from her husband Maurilio. They had 5 children together, but only 2 of them still live with her: Nora, who is 18, and Candí, 16. They live as a family in their own house, located in the Ricrican area. This brave woman dedicates her time to growing potatoes, yams and other tubers. What she likes best about her work is when she comes down from her farmlands to the city, where she can sell her harvest for a good price. Dedicación goes on to say that when she goes to the city of Tarma, apart from selling her nutritious potatoes, she also sells mutton. With the proceeds from the sale she can buy food for the week. She thanks God for all the support she has recieved, and despite the hard work the farm represents, she is happy that she has something of her own and is able to hold onto it for her children. This is her 11th loan from [field partner] MFP, and as a long-standing member of her communal bank, she hopes to continue working and developing the same. With the sum she is looking to borrow, she will buy sacks of organic fertilizer, and - if she has sufficient funds - she will invest in chemicals to control the insect pests that constantly plague her crops.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer and chemicals to control insect infestations.

loans.name: Jose Sipriano

texts.es:
el señor Jose D. tiene 55 años de edad, vive en el barrio san francisco de la ciudad de Choluteca y se dedica a prestar los servicios de moler maiz, tiene un motor para moler maiz, brinda sus servicios a la mayoria de las personas que viven en ese barrio, se levanta todos los dias a las 4 de la mañana para poder cubrir con todas las molidas de maiz.
Jose es bien trabajador, responsable y honrado, se esfuerza mucho para seguir creciendo con su negocio.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de repuestos para darle un mantenimiento al motor.
ahorita tiene  mucha demanda ya que muchas personas estan moliendo bastante maiz para elaborar nacatamales.
texts.en:
Señor Jose D., age 55, lives in the San Francisco neighbourhood in the city of Choluteca. His business is based on his machine for grinding corn, and most of the people in his neighbourhood use his service. He gets up every day at 4am so that he can fill all his orders for maize to be milled.

Jose is a very hard working, responsible and honourable man, who puts in a lot of effort to continue growing his business. He will use the loan to pay for parts to maintain the machine's motor. Right now he has a lot of demand for his services, because people need a lot of maize flour at the moment to make nacatamales (a festive local dish).

loans.use: To buy parts for a milling machine

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando, de 39 años, convive con Guadalupe, de 30 años. Ambos tienen un hijo: Cristian, de 13 años de edad. En unión familiar los tres viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la ciudad de Tarma. Hace 15 años, esté trabajador hombre se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, ovino, vacuno y porcino; el cual los engorda y mata, para luego comercializarlo en su carnicería que con esfuerzo y mucha dedicación adquirió en el mercado modelo de su ciudad. Pero no solo a ello se dedica Rolando, él también incursionó hace 2 años, al trasporte público, cubriendo las rutas de Tarma - Palcamayo, obteniendo un ingreso extra. Ahora él, está pensando adquirir un auto mejor implementado, con el que podrá trasportar a los pobladores de la ciudad al campo, asimismo está pensando adquirir máquinas para cortar carne, y así tener una carnicería de producción; con ello espera tener mejores ingresos para darle a su hijo una educación de nivel. Este es el onceavo crédito con MFP, y como presidente de su banco comunal, trabaja con ahínco y mucha responsabilidad, en el desarrollo constante de sus integrantes. Con el monto que solicita comprará, varios kilos de carne de animal, ovino, vacuno y porcino. Con esto piensa abastecer su carnicería, para las épocas de mayor demanda comercial que se avecinan.
texts.en:
Rolando is 39 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife, 30 year-old Guadalupe.  They have one son: 13 year-old Cristian.  The three of them live together in their own home which is located in the city of Tarma.

This hard-working man started his business buying and selling sheep, cattle and pigs 15 years ago.  He fattens the animals, slaughters them and then sells them in the butcher's shop which he acquired in the town market through a lot of hard work and commitment.  However, Rolando doesn't just have this one business.  He also broke into the public transport market two years ago.  He covers Tarma-Palcamayo routes, thereby making an extra income.

Rolando is now thinking of acquiring a better car with which he can transport the residents of his town to the countryside.  He is also planning to acquire machines for cutting meat which will allow him to have a productive butcher's shop.  He hopes to thereby make more profits so that he can give his son a good level of education.

This is Rolando's eleventh loan with MFP and, as president of his community bank, he works hard and very responsibly, to constantly help the bank's members to develop.  Rolando will use his loan to buy several kilos of meat: lamb, beef and pork.  He plans to use this to stock his butcher's shop for the coming season which sees a high demand for his products.

loans.use: To buy meat: lamb, pork and beef, to stock his business

loans.name: Oscar Walter

texts.es:
En el sector conocido como el Guabito de  la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Amor Y Felicidad.

En este lugar encontramos a don Oscar, tiene 47 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 5 hijos, dos de ellos ya son mayores de edad, los menores estudian en colegio y escuela, su mujer es comerciante.

Se dedica a conducir un taxi por las tardes y noches. Además tiene una pequeña granja de pollos en su casa, compra por cajas los pollos cuando están pequeños, los cría por dos meses y luego los vende en pie o por libras a los vecinos o entrega a las tiendas de la localidad, dice que sus pollos se venden mucho ya que los cría con maíz por lo cual su carne es  parecida al pollo criollo. Trabaja todos los días dos a tres horas por día.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más pollos y comida y medicamentos para estos, además de ropa para el negocio de su esposa. Está en el Banco Comunal desde sus inicios y le gusta porque los intereses son bajos.  Sus sueños son tener una granja grande y con tecnología.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Amor y Felicidad' (Love and Happiness) community bank meet in the Guabito sector of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí.  For many years this city has been known as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

Here we meet 47 year-old Oscar.  He lives with his common-law wife and has 5 children.  Two of his children are already grown up and the younger children are studying in high school and elementary school.  Oscar's wife is a saleswoman.

Oscar drives a taxi in the afternoons and evenings.  He also has a small chicken farm at home.  He buys the chicks by the box load when they are young, he raises them for two months and then he sells them whole or by the pound.  He sells them to neighbors and also delivers them to local stores.  He says that his chickens sell well because he raises them on corn which means that their meat is similar to that of 'pollo criollo' (Creole chicken).  Oscar works every day for two or three hours a day.

Oscar will use this loan to buy more chicks, feed and medicines.  He will also buy clothes for his wife's business.  He has been a member of his community bank since the beginning and he likes it because the interest rates are low.  His dream is to have a large farm with technology.

loans.use: To buy chicks, feed and medicines.  To buy clothes

loans.name: María Viviana

texts.es:
En el sector conocido como el Guabito de  la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Amor Y Felicidad.
 
En este lugar encontramos a la señora María, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y  fruto de esta relación tiene 3 hijos de 7, 1 año  y el ultimo de 1 mes de nacido, su esposo es peluquero. Ella está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos.

Tienen junto con su esposo un gabinete de belleza donde realizan diversidad de trabajos a personas que llegan hasta su local, trabajan todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 20h00, tiene muchos clientes que los prefieren por el buen trabajo que realizan, además vende productos de belleza, naturales y por las noches también prepara y vende hamburguesa y batidos de frutas.

Este crédito que realizó lo va invertir en comprar tintes de cabello, oxigenta, y otros materiales útiles es el arreglo personal. Sus metas son tener un gran SPA y su casa propia
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Amor y Felicidad' (Love and Happiness) community bank meet in the Guabito sector of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí.  For many years this city has been known as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

Here we meet 27 year-old María.  She is married and has three children aged 7, 1 and 1 month.  Her husband is a hairdresser.  María has been a member of her community bank since the beginning and she likes it because the loans are quickly dispensed.

María and her husband have a beauty salon where they provide a range of treatments for people who come to their premises.  They work every day from 8.00am to 8.00pm.  They have a lot of loyal customers who like them for the good work that they do.  They also sell natural beauty products and in the evenings María prepares and sells hamburgers and fruit smoothies.

María will invest this loan in buying hair dyes, peroxide developer and other materials which are useful in her business.  Her goals are to have a large spa and her own home.

loans.use: To buy hair dyes, peroxide developer and other products for personal treatments

loans.name: Fidelina Albertina

texts.es:
la señora Fidelina Albertina L. tiene 38 años de edad, vive en la colonia 21 de Diciembre de la ciudad de Choluteca y se dedica a la produccion y venta de pan y rosquillas, su producto lo distribuye en varias pulperias y tambien vende por detalle a sus vecinos.
Fidelina tiene la ayuda de su mama para la fabricacion del pan y de las rosquillas, Fidelina lucha mucho para sacar a su hija adelante y darle una mejor calidad de vida.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar los materiales para la fabricacion del pan y de las rosquillas.
texts.en:
Fidelina Albertina L. is 38 years old.  She lives in the 21 de Diciembre neighborhood of the city of Choluteca.  She makes and sells bread and 'rosquillas' (a type of doughnut).  She delivers her products to several grocery stores and she also sells retail to her neighbors.

Fidelina has her mom's help in making her bread and 'rosquillas'.  Fidelina works hard to get her daughter ahead in life and give her a better quality of life.

Fidelina will use her loan to buy the material she needs to make bread and 'rosquillas'.

loans.use: To buy flour, yeast, sugar, milk, cheese, corn, firewood and water

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hugo Cesar

texts.es:
Hugo de 56 años, con dedicación, esfuerzo y la liquidación que le dieron en el trabajo cuando lo retiraron por recorte de personal pudo comprar víveres de primera necesidad para ubicar la tienda que siempre quiso.  

Viviendo en una zona llamada Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas) ha sido conocido como el que tiene la tienda del barrio. Trabaja con ayuda de su hijo desde la mañana hasta el anochecer. La tienda la tiene ubicada en la parte delantera de su casa vende todo tipo de víveres como arroz, granos, bebidas, enlatados etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar víveres de primera necesidad como arroz, aceite, bebidas para surtir su tienda. En el futuro quiere surtir su tienda con mercadería y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Hugo is 56 years old.  Through commitment, hard work and the severance pay which they gave him from his previous job when they laid him off due to staff cutbacks, he has been able to buy basic groceries and set up the store that he has always wanted.

Hugo lives in an area called Paraíso de Guayaquil (a peri-urban area with dirt roads whose houses are to be found in the mountains).  He has become known as the man who owns the neighborhood store.  Hugo works, with his son's help, from morning until nightfall.  His store is located in the front of his home and he sells all kinds of foodstuffs such as rice, grains, drinks, canned goods, etc.

Hugo will use his loan to buy basic foodstuffs such as rice, oil and drinks to stock his store.  In the future, he would like to stock his store with merchandise and finish building his home.

loans.use: To buy oil, rice and soft drinks

loans.name: Yuly Veronica

texts.es: La Sra. Yuly tiene una tienda ubicada cerca de la Agencia, su familia esta integrada de 4 personas su esposo Bismark, un niño de 4 años y una niña de 2 años, su esposo trabaja en la ciudad de el alto en una empresa y ella tiene una tienda de barrio  con la tienda en calidad de alquiler es una Sra. Emprendedora  ella tiene la tienda cerca de un local lo cual ayuda que le vaya bien sus ventas, ya que cada ves que en el local hay fiestas ella vende muy bien refrescos y dulces, solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería, razón por la cual se solicita el financiamiento kiva, desea comprar abarrotes, galletas, refrescos para surtir su tienda, es una persona muy trabajadora y esta muy agradecida en la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yuly has a store located close to Emprender's branch office. Her family is made up of four people: her husband Bismark, a 4-year-old son and a 2-year-old daughter. Her husband works at a company in the city of El Alto, and she has a neighborhood store in a rented space. She is a very enterprising woman, and her store is near a popular gathering place, which helps her sales since every time there is a party she sells lots of drinks and sweets.

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise, which is why she is requesting Kiva funding. She would like to buy basic grocery items, cookies, and drinks in order to offer a wider variety of products at her store. She is a very hard-working person and is grateful to Emprender for supporting her.

loans.use: Buy basic grocery items and cookies

loans.name: Lorena Del Rocio

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres En Acción.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Lorena, tiene 38 años  de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de siete y seis años ambos estudian en escuela. Su marido es mecánico.

Ella se dedica además de su hogar al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo pero nos cuenta que lo que más vende es ropa de mujer y de niñas. También vende productos Oriflame y Sayson (artículos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorio para damas). Trabaja los viernes, sábados, y domingos desde las 8h30 hasta las 16h00 aunque si algún cliente quiere algo la llama y ella la recibe en su  casa ya que ahí  tiene una vitrina, sus productos  los recibe en su casa.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa sobretodo de mujer y de niñas, además de cremas y perfumes, etc. está en el Banco Comunal hace 8 años y le gusta porque a través de los créditos a podido financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son  tener un carro y que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank Mujeres en Acción meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo - a city commonly known as Los Reales Tamarindos - which is also the capital of the Manabi province in Ecuador.

In this city lives Lorena, a 38 year old woman with two children who lives with her partner. Her children are 6 and 7 years old, and both are in school. Her husband is a mechanic.

Apart from working at home, she sells clothes of all types. Children and women's clothers sell the best. She also sells Oriflame and Sayson products, which include beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories. She works Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays from 8:30 until 4 pm, though if a client wants to purchase something all they need to do is call and she will receive them at her house where she has a display case with all her products. 

This loan will be used to purchase clothes, above all those for women and children, in addition to creams and perfumes, etc. She has been a member of the community bank for 8 years,  and she enjoys it as through her loans she has been able to finance her business.  Her dream is to have a car and to see her business grow.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for women and children, creams, perfumes, cosmetics and other things

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
el sr. Juan F. tiene 29 años de edad, vive en la colonia santa anita de yusguare y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion. Juan es una persona emprendedora y  dedicado a su  negocio, es padre de 2 hijos los cuales los tiene en la escuela de la comunidad. 
el y su esposa trabajan duro para sacar adelante la familia, se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para atender a su 
clientela.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio, desea tener bien surtido su negocio para navidad.

su tiempo libre lo dedica a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan F. is 29 years old, lives in Santa Anita de Yusguare, and dedicates his business to the sale of general consumer goods.  His store is based out of his home.  Juan is entrepreneurial and dedicated to his business.  He is the father of 2 children, both of whom go to a community school.  He and his wife work hard to give their family a better life.  Each morning he wakes up at 5am to attend to his customers.

He will use his loan to purchase merchandise and stock his business.  He hopes to have his store fully stocked by Christmas.  Juan spends his free time with his family.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, butter, cooking oil, churros, refreshments, cheese, lard, chicken, coffee, milk, bread, crackers, soup, pasta, toilet paper, paper towels, batteries, candles, and matches.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Laura Maryorie

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres En Acción.

La señora Laura lleva en el Banco Comunal por 6 años en el que está  muy contenta, le gustan las charlas más que todo las de salud, además de los créditos que le brindad una gran ayuda en su negocio. Tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos dos mayores y uno de 16 años que está en colegio. Su esposo es taxista.

Ama de casa que además se dedica al comercio, vende productos Esika, Yanbal y Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorio para damas). Además de ropa por catalogo de las marca Nivi, Unimoda, Leoniza y otras marcas nacionales y colombianas. Trabaja todos los días unas cinco horas por dia, la mercadería la recibe en su casa, solo la ropa colombiana la retira en una distribuidora.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, ropa interior, etc. Sus sueños son tener una casa propia y un  local comercial.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for years as the city of the real tamarinds, there reunites every 15 days, the members of the Communal bank of Women in Action.

Mrs. Laura has 6 years as a customer of The Communal Bank, where she is very happy.  She enjoys the meetings, most of all the ones about health.  She appreciates the loans that she receives which are a great help for her business.  She is 51 years old, and married with 3 children: two adults, and a 16 year old who is still in school.  Her husband is a taxi driver.

She is a housewife as well as a business owner.  She sells Esika, Yanbal, and Avon products in addition to catalog clothing sales for Nivi, Unimoda, Leoniza, and other national and Colombian brands.  She works everyday, 5 hours a day.  She receives the clothes in her home and gets Colombian brands from a distributor. 

She will use this loan to purchase pants, blouses, clothes, and underwear.  Her dream is to have her own home and a store.

loans.use: Purchase pants, blouses, underwear, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Nerys Dario

texts.es:
el joven Nerys Dario E. es un hombre trabajador, se dedica a cortar de pelo a caballeros, esta empezando con su negocio y no tiene sillas ni sillones. en estos momentos esta teniendo varios clientes, cada dia que pasa su negocio crece y necesita los sillones y sillas para atender mejor a sus clientes. trabaja de 7 am a las 8 pm, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion.
el es soltero y vive con sus papas, les ayuda a sus padres economicamente para los gastos del hogar.
sus tiempos libres visita sus familiares.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de sillas y sillones para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nerys Dario E. is a hard working young man.  He dedicates himself to cutting hair for men.  He is beginning his business and does not have any chairs or benches.  He currently has many customers, everyday his business more and he needs the chairs and benches so he may better attend new customers.  He works from 7am to 8pm and his business is run from his own home.  He is unmarried  and lives with his parents.  He helps his parents economically with household expenses and visits family on his spare time.

He will use his loan for the purchase of chairs and benches so he can provide better service for his customers.

loans.use: Purchase of chairs and benches

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: La Sra. Elizabeth vive en la zona del Plan 3000, vive en casa de sus padres y se dedica al bordado de chinelas con piedras de colores y de fantasía, a pesar de su corta edad es una persona responsable y proactiva que todas las semanas entrega por docena y también por unidad las chinelas que borda, las entrega en la feria de Barrio Lindo, una zona muy comercial que sólo se abre los días miércoles y sábados, lo que le da tiempo entre semana para poder terminar el bordado para cada feria. Cuando tiene demasiado pedido sus hermanas menores le colaboran con el bordado de las chinelas. Ella aprendio este oficio desde hace unos 3 años. Es la segunda vez que accede a un crédito en Emprender, ella necesita del capital para incrementar su mercadería, comprar chinelas, piedras, perlas e hilos, ya que en esta temporada es lo más vende debido a la temporada de calor.
texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in the Plan 3000 neighborhood in her parents' house. She embroiders sandals with colored stones and other decorations. Though she is young, she is a responsible, proactive person who sells her sandals by the dozen and also by the pair. She sells her wares at the Barrio Lindo market, a very commercial fair that is only held on Wednesdays and Saturdays, which gives her time to finish her embroidery work before each fair. She learned this trade three years ago. 

This is her second loan from Emprender. She needs the money to increase her merchandise by buying sandals, colored stones, pearls and thread, since this is the season in which she sells the most due to the hot weather.

loans.use: Buy sandals, colored stones, pearls and thread

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 46 años, convive con Yolanda, de 36 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Hugo, de 16 y Yordan, de 9 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ricrican. La siembra de tubérculos como; papa, olluco y oca, es su principal actividad económica; ya que desde niño creció entre la vegetación y los terrenos agrícolas, ya desde que formó su propia familia, comenzó a sembrar en terrenos alquilados, pero gracias a la dedicación que brinda a sus sembríos los que cultiva y cuida constantemente. Consigue vender sus cosechas, en el mercado central de su ciudad, obteniendo buenas ganancias; los que hicieron que ahora obtuviera sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Por todo lo que avanzó, Juan; desea mejorar la construcción de su casa, para darles una excelente calidad de vida a sus hijos. Esté es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y como socio de su banco comunal, se siente agradecido por el apoyo constante, que recibe por parte de sus integrantes. Con el monto que solicita comprará 5 sacos de abono orgánico, lo que esparcirá en sus sembríos de papa, que en estos meses cosechará.
texts.en:
Juan is 46 years old and shares a home with 36 year old Yolanda.  Together they have two sons, 16 year old Hugo, and 9 year old Yordan.  They live as a family in their own home, located in the Ricrican neighborhood.  He raises tubers, such as potatoes, olluco, and oca.  As a child, he grew up around vegetation and farmland and now it's his primary economic activity.  When he started his family he began planting on leased land, but thanks to his dedication to his crops, which he constantly cares for, he sells his harvest in the city market, where he makes good earnings, which allowed him to buy his own farmland.

Juan wants to improve the construction of his home, so that he can give his children an excellent quality of life.  This will be his fourth loan through MFP, and as a member of his communal bank.  He is grateful for the constant support he gets from his fellow members.  He will use the money from this loan to buy five bags of organic fertilizer, which he will spread on the potato crop that he will harvest in the coming months.

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Rosa Mariana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres En Acción.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 50 años  de edad, es madre soltera y  tiene una hija de siete años que estudia en escuela. Vive en una casa arrendada. Hace siete años es socia del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho con su negocio y para sacar adelante a su hija.

Tiene un pequeño  salón de belleza y en el cual realiza muchos trabajos como cortes de cabello, tinturados, maquillajes, arreglos de uñas entre otros. Trabaja de lunes a sábado de 9h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde ya que los clientes a veces necesitan trabajos más tarde y ella tiene que cumplir con los clientes.
 
Este crédito lo va invertir en comprar tintes de cabello, shampo, oxigenta, y otros materiales útiles es el arreglo personal,  Sus metas son tener un gran SPA y su casa propia.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí which has been know for many years as the city of Los Reales Tamarindos (The Royal Tamarinds), the members of the community bank Mujeres en Acción (Women in Action) meet twice a month.

In this place, we met Mrs. Rosa who is 50 years old, single mother, and has a 7-year-old daughter that goes to school. She is renting a house. She has been a member of the community bank for 7 years and she likes it because the loans have helped her a lot with her business and to support her daughter.

She has a small beauty salon where she provides many services such as haircuts, hair coloring, make up, manicures and more. She works from Monday thru Saturday from 9:00 am until 8:00 pm, and sometimes later since her customers may need her services later in the day and she has to serve her customers.

She will invest this loan to buy hair dyes, shampoo, coloring agents, and other supplies for personal grooming. Her goals are to have a great Spa and own a house.

loans.use: Buy hair dyes, shampoo, coloring agents and other products for personal grooming.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel, de 22 años, es un hombre soltero y trabajador, que vive con su mamá, de 48 años, a la que cuida y ayuda en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ricrican. Después de la muerte de su papá, Miguel tuvo que salir adelante junto a su familia. Hace 4 años que se dedica al cuidado de los terrenos agrícolas de su mamá, quien esta agradecida por el apoyo y la responsabilidad que le brinda constantemente. Sus cultivos constan de papa, los cuales cuida infatigablemente, por ello, en épocas de cosecha los comercializan en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad “Tarma”; obteniendo buenas ganancias. Pero consiente de las carencias que tiene, el desea juntar una suma considerable de dinero, para comprar sus propios terrenos agrícolas, con el empeño que lo caracteriza, está seguro que lo conseguirá. Este es el onceavo crédito con MFP, y espera salir adelante en compañía de su banco comunal, que son personas responsables y muy comprometidas. Con el monto que solicita podrá completar la compra de 22 sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Miguel, 22, is a single, hard working man living with his 48 year old mother whom he cares for and helps out in his own house located in the community of Ricrican.  

After his father’s death, Miguel had to get ahead with his family.  For the last four years he has been taking care of his mother’s farmland who is very grateful for his help and the responsibility he constantly shows her.

He farms potatoes which he tirelessly tends to and when they are harvested he sells them at Tarma’s wholesale market earning good profits.  

Because of the things he lacks, he’d like to save enough money to buy his own land and is certain he’ll succeed in doing so thanks to his characteristic dedication.

This is his 8th loan with MFP and he expects to get ahead together with his communal bank which is made up of responsible, very committed people.

He will use the entirety of his loan to complete the amount he needs to buy 22 sacks of organic manure.

loans.use: To buy 22 sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Hector Freddy

texts.es:
Héctor de 63 años, tiene una actividad económica no muy común que es la de vende carne de chancho en un local. Antes de tener su negocio trabaja en una tercena (carnicería) rebanando carnes. 

Como independizarse le llamaba mucho la atención decidió tener su propio negocio para poder mantener a su familia en una situación económica estable. En la actualidad el tiene un negocio de venta de carne de cerdo. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 19h30pm. El vende la libra de cerdo a $ 2.00. Una de las facilidades que tiene es que su esposa le ayuda en el negocio haciendo fritadas (plato típico del ecuador con granos). 

Para seguir con el negocio él quiere comprar con el préstamo carne de chancho. En el futuro quiere surtir su negocio con diferentes carnes para tener todas las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Héctor, 63, has a not-too-common economic activity which is selling pork in a locale.  Prior to having his business he worked for a butcher shop cutting meat.

Becoming independent was very attractive to him so he decided to set up a business of his own to support his family in a stable economic way.  He currently has a pork selling business.  He works from 8am until 7:30pm.  He sells a pound of pork for $2.00.  One of the things that help his business is that his wife makes fritadas (a typical Ecuadorean dish made with grains).

To stay in business he wants to use the loan to buy pork.  In the future he’d like to stock the business with different kinds of meat in order to meet all his customers’ needs.

loans.use: For meat.

loans.name: Nicolas Hipolito

texts.es: El Sr. Nicolás vive en la zona del plan 3000, vive en la casa de su hermana, el es transportista desde hace 15 años. El crédito que esta solicitando es para convertir a gas su vehículo conversión de gasolina a gas para así poder tener más ingresos porque le va a ahorrar en combustible. El señor Nicolás es una persona trabajadora que se esfuerza para salir adelante, desea poder comprarse un terreno y poder hacer construir su casita ya que por el momento su hermana le ayuda con la vivienda y el ya no quiere ser una molestia para su hermana, por eso esta conversion le ayuda a ahorrar un dinerito, esta muy agradecido con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Nicolás lives in the Plan 3000 zone in his sister’s house.  He has been in transportation services for 15 years.  He is asking for a loan to convert his vehicle from gasoline to gas so that income will rise because he will save on fuel costs.

Nicolás is a hard working person who strives to get ahead.  He hopes to buy a lot and build a house because currently his sister is helping out but he doesn’t want to be a burden to her any longer.  This is why this conversion will help him save a little money.

He is very grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To convert his vehicle from gasoline to gas.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutas”  ubicado en el distrito y  provincia Puno, tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene 02 hijos.  La señora estudió educación superior pero no pudo concluirlos.

Trabaja  con  el  Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 05 años, su préstamo inicial fue de   S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio, ella se dedica a la fabricación de muebles y artículos artesanales.

Con éste crédito de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, comprará lanas y maderas para la fabricación de muebles en general.  Nelly trabaja junto con su esposo.

Su visión a futuro es tener una barraca y una tienda artesanal donde pueda ofrecer sus productos.
	
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la responsabilidad de las socias y de Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of the “Las Kantutas” (national flower of Peru and one of two national flowers of Bolivia) communal bank located in Puno district and province.  She is 29 years old, has a live-in spouse and two children.  She did not finish higher education.

She has collaborated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 5 years.  Her initial loan was for 300 new soles that she invested in her furniture and crafts making business.

With this 1000 new sol loan she will buy wool and wood to make furniture.  Nelly works together with her husband.

Her vision for the future is to have a booth and artisanal shop where she can sell her products.

What she enjoys about her communal bank is the punctuality and responsibility of its members and of Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To buy wool and wood to make furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cereals at wholesale.

loans.name: Blas

texts.es: Blas, de 47 años, convive con Dionisia, de 49 años. Ambos tienen un hijo: Gerson, de 8 años de edad. En unión familiar, los tres viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ricrican. La siembra de tubérculos como: papa, olluco, oca y mashua; son su principal actividad agrícola, lo que más le gusta a él, es salir todas las mañanas acompañado de una radio, donde al compás de la música cuida, riega y aplica abono a sus cultivos, según afirma “el campo es su vida”. Desde niño creció aprendiendo las técnicas de cultivo; por ello cada cosecha es símbolo de su perseverancia y sus buenos cuidados. En el mercado mayorista de su localidad, vende no solo la cosecha de sus cultivos, también la carne del cordero que cría; pero a diferencia de sus demás pobladores, él también comercializa la lana de este animal, que es muy gruesa y protege del frío. Ahora Blas, quiere comprar un camión, con el cual piensa trasladarse con mayor facilidad. Este es el  séptimo crédito con MFP, y muy alegre comenta, que gracias al apoyo que le brindó su banco comunal, pudo salir adelante. Con el monto que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico, los cuales esparcirá en sus sembríos.
texts.en:
47 year-old Blas lives with his common-law wife, 49 year-old Dionisia.  They have one son: 8 year-old Gerson.  The three of them live together as a family in their own home which is located in the town of Ricrican.  Blas grows potatoes, olluco (a native tuber) and mashua (a native tuber).  They are his main crops.  What Blas most likes about his work is going out every morning, together with his radio.  To the rhythm of his music he cares for, irrigates and applies manure to his crops.  He says that the land is his life.

Since he was a young boy, Blas grew up learning farming techniques.  For this reason, every harvest is a symbol of his perseverance and the good care that he takes of his land.  In his town's wholesale market he sells not only the crops which he grows but also the meat from the lambs that he raises.  However, unlike other residents, he also sells the wool from these animals which is very thick and helps protect people from the cold.

Blas would like to buy a truck which would allow him to travel more easily.  This is his seventh loan with MFP.  He comments, very happily, that thanks to the support of his community bank, he has been able to get ahead in life.  He will use his loan to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer which he will spread on his crops.

loans.use: To buy several sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Maribel Evis

texts.es:
Maribel es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutas”  ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Puno, tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene  02 hijos.  Estudio educación secundaria.

Trabaja  con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 04 meses, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio, ella se dedica a la  producción de adoquines (helado de hielo) y artículos artesanales.

Con este nuevo crédito de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  invertirá  comprando productos para producir adoquines y lanas para sus tejidos de chullos (artesanía).
 
Su visión en el negocio es tener su tienda de artesanía o una ferretería.
	
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones porque es una distracción para ella, conversar y compartir ideas entre todas las socias.  También le gusta los préstamos de la cuenta interna.
texts.en:
Maribel is a member of the 'Las Kantutas' community bank which is located in Puno district, in Puno province.  She is 29 years old and lives with her common-law husband and 2 children.  She has a high school education.

Maribel has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 4 months.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles.  She invested this money in her business which is making popsicles and handicrafts.

She will use this new loan to invest in buying products for making her popsicles and yarn for hand making her 'chullos' (woolen hats with earflaps).

Maribel's vision for her business is to have a handicrafts store or hardware store.

What Maribel most likes about her community bank is the meetings because they are a distraction for her.  She gets to chat and share ideas with the other members.  She also likes the loans from the internal account.

loans.use: To buy products to make popsicles and to buy yarn for making her 'chullos' (woolen hats with earflaps)

loans.name: Lucila Doris

texts.es:
Lucila es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutas”  ubicado en el distrito y  provincia de Puno, tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene  02 hijos y estudio educación secundaria.

Esta  trabajando con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 08 meses, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 200.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su tienda de abarrotes.

Con éste nuevo crédito de S/. 100.00 nuevos soles, comprará lanas para tejer sus chompas, también nos cuenta que comprará un poco de mercadería para su tienda.

Su visión en el negocio es ampliar y convertir su tienda en una bodega.
	
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad de los préstamos.
texts.en:
Lucila is a member of the 'Las Kantutas' community bank which is located in the district and province of Puno.  She is 37 years old and lives with her common-law husband and two children who are in high school.

Lucila has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 8 months.  Her first loan was for 200 Peruvian soles and she invested it in her grocery store.

She will use this new loan for 100 Peruvian soles to buy yarn for knitting her sweaters.  She also tells us that she will buy a small amount of merchandise for her store.

Lucila's vision for her business is to expand her store.  What she likes most about her community bank is the ease of obtaining a loan.

loans.use: To buy groceries: sugar, rice, noodles, etc.  To buy yarn.

loans.name: Artemia

texts.es: Artemia, D. 52 años, está casada con Lucio, D. 60 años. Ambos tienen 8 hijos, pero solo viven con 4 D. ellos, a los que cuida y educa en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad D. Ricrican. Los días D. Artemia, son inspiradores, pues está hermosa mujer, todos los días desD. las primeras horas D. la mañana sale a cuidar a sus corderos, gallinas y cuyes, a los que alimenta para engordarlos y luego comercializarlos a un mayor precio. Ella tiene 40 años dedicándose a la agricultura, donD. también siembra tubérculos como: papa, olluco y oca; “toda una vida”, y según afirma, está acostumbrada a la vida del campo, su mayor deseo es morir entre las hermosas praderas verdes D. sus sembríos. Pero como aún tiene hijos menores, ella está pensando acondicionar un pequeño espacio en su casa, donD. venderá verduras y hortalizas. Este es el  séptimo crédito con MFP, y como socia activa D. su banco comunal, aporta ideas y sugerencias para el progreso D. su banco. Con el monto que solicita comprará, 15 sacos D. abono orgánico, los que esparcirá en todos sus sembríos, los que muy pronto cosechará.
texts.en:
Artemia is 52 years old.  She is married to 60 year-old Lucio.  They have 8 children but live with only 4 of them, who they care for and educate in their own home which is located in the town of Ricrican.

Artemia's days are inspiring.  This beautiful woman gets up early in the morning every day to go and care for her lambs, hens and guinea pigs.  She feeds her animals, fattens them and then sells them at a higher price.  She has been in the farming business for 40 years.  She also grows root vegetables such as potatoes, 'olluco' (a native tuber) and 'oca' (a native tuber).  She has been doing this for “an entire lifetime” and she says that she is used to the country life.  Her biggest desire is to die amongst the beautiful green fields of her crops.  However, as Artemia still has young children, she is thinking of adapting a small space in her house from which she can sell greens and vegetables.

This is Artemia's seventh loan with MFP and, as an active member of her community bank, she brings ideas and suggestions to her bank which help it to make progress.  She will use her loan to buy 15 sacks of organic fertilizer which she will spread over her crops that she will harvest very soon.

loans.use: To buy 15 sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Antonia Floridalva

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres En Acción.

La señora Antonia esta en el Banco Comunal casi desde el principio hace 38 ciclos  y le gusta por las facilidades que presta la institución para dar los créditos. Tiene 62 años, está divorciada y de esa relación que tuvo procreo  4 hijos  todos son mayores de edad, es modista aprendió corte y confección en una Academia en la ciudad de Manta.

Ella es modista tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa donde cose todo tipo de ropa pero lo que más confecciona es ropa para damas,  y también nos cuenta que hace ropa para niños, una de sus hijas que vive cerca de su casa le ayuda en su tarea cuando tiene mucho trabajo. Trabaja todos los días unas seis horas por día. Ella realiza obras a personas que requieren de sus servicios y son muchos los que llegan hasta su taller.

Este crédito lo va  emplear en comprar materiales para la  costura. Sus sueños son  tener salud para seguir adelante en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Mujeres en Acción' (Women in Action) community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí.  This city has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

Antonia has been a member of her community bank almost since the beginning, 38 loan cycles ago.  She likes her community bank for the ease with which the institution provides loans.  Antonia is 62 years old.  She is divorced and has 4 grown-up children from her relationship.  She is a dressmaker and she learned dressmaking in an Academy in the city of Manta.

Antonia is a dressmaker and has a small dressmaking workshop in her house where she sews all kinds of clothes.  What she makes the most of is ladies' clothes.  She also tells us that she makes children's clothes.  One of her daughters lives nearby and she helps her when she has a lot of work on.  Antonia works six hours every day.  She does work for people who require her services and a lot of people come to her workshop.

She will use this loan to buy materials for her dressmaking business.  Her dream is to continue to enjoy good health so that she can continue in her work.

loans.use: To buy fabric, threads, buttons, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Kenia Katiuska

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres En Acción.

En este lugar encontramos a Kenya. Tiene 22 años de edad y es madre soltera de un hijo de 4 años el mismo que estudia en jardín de infantes. Vive en la casa de sus padres. Ella es auxiliar de enfermería. Además también es comerciante.

Tiene un local en el centro comercial Bahía Rio en la ciudad de Portoviejo, en el cual vende ropa de todo tipo y productos Yanbal (productos de cosméticos, belleza, perfumería y accesorios de damas) trabaja los días de la semana desde las 9am hasta las 17h00, lo que más vende es ropa para niños, nos cuenta que lleva con su local ya por cuatro años y que a pesar de la crisis económica le va bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa como: pantalones, blusas, camisas, ropa de niños, etc. Este es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y está muy contenta le gusta las facilidades para conseguir los créditos  Sus sueños son tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of the 'Mujeres en Acción' (Women in Action) community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí.  This city has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

Here we meet 22 year-old Kenia.  She is a single mother and has a 4 year-old son who is in nursery school.  She lives in her parents' home.  Kenia is a nursing assistant.  She is also a saleswoman.

Kenia has premises in the Bahía Rio shopping mall in the city of Portoviejo.  She sells all kinds of clothes and Yanbal products (cosmetics, beauty products, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She works every day of the week from 9.00am to 5.00pm.  What she sells the most of are children's clothes.  She tells us that she has had her premises for four years and, in spite of the economic crisis, things are going well.

Kenia will use her loan to buy clothes such as pants, blouses, shirts, children's clothes, etc.  This is her fourth loan cycle with her community bank and she is very happy.  She likes the ease with which she can obtain loans.  Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, shirts, children's clothes, etc.

loans.name: Elina Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres En Acción.

En este lugar encontramos y conocimos a la señora Elina, tiene 32 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 11 y 4 años, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su marido es comerciante de frutas.

Se dedica al comercio, vende artículos para el hogar como planchas, licuadoras, tostadoras, sabanas entre otros,  también vende prendas de vestir. Trabaja dos días a la semana y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, su sistema es por cartillas el mismo consiste en que los clientes eligen un producto y pagan por semanas y cuando le toca el turno reciben su producto. Esto lo viene realizando hace muchos años y nos cuenta que le ha ido muy bien.
 
Este crédito es para comprar más de sus productos como planchas, licuadoras, camisas, pantalones, etc. Este es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y está muy contenta le gusta porque los intereses son bajos. Sus  sueños tener su casa propia y bien arreglada.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres en Acción” (Women in Action) communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of Royal Tamarinds.

This is where we met and got to know Elina, 32.  She is in a common law relationship and has two children who are 11 and 4 years of age.  The oldest is in school.  Her husband is a fruit merchant.

She is a merchant selling various items for the home like: irons, blenders, toasters and sheets, among others.  She also sells clothes.  She works two days a week door to door.  She uses a system called “cartillas” in which customers choose a product and pay weekly.  When their turn comes up they receive their item.  She has been doing this for several years and she tells us that she’s done quite well.

This loan is to buy more of her products like: irons, blenders, shirts, pants, etc.  This is her 4th cycle in the communal bank and she is very happy. She likes it because interest rates are low.  Her dream is to have a nicely decorated house of her own.

loans.use: To buy irons, blenders, toasters and clothes.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es: Erlinda, de 43 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Oswaldo de 44 años y sus 2 menores hijos; juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante en busca del progreso. Desde hace 5 años esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a la venta de comestibles y productos de primera necesidad, comercializa  en su tienda que esta instalada en su casa. Dice que le gusta mucho su labor pues le permite atender los quehaceres de su hogar; además de trabajar para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Atiende sola todos los días, desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, solo cuando sus hijos no tienen tareas escolares le ayudan en la atención, y obtiene ganancias regulares pues su negocio es el mejor abastecido de su zona, y el tiempo que vende sumado a la buena atención, le ha permitido captar gran cantidad de clientes que la prefieren porque los precios de sus variados productos son muy accesibles. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar las instalaciones de su negocio, pues esta quedando algo pequeño para la cantidad de alimentos que vende.  Es el séptimo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Erlinda tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de panetones, y otros alimentos, pues como las fiestas navideñas están cerca, desea ofrecerles lo mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Erlinda, 43, lives in her own house with her husband, Oswaldo, 44, and their two minor children.  Together they strive daily to get ahead seeking progress.  For the last five years this hard working woman has sold food and basic need items in a store installed in her house.  She says she enjoys it very much because it allows her to do her housework as well as help her husband meet household expenses.

She works alone every day from 7am until 10pm.  Her children help her only if they don’t have any schoolwork to do.  Her profits are regular because she has the best stocked store in the zone.  The length of time she’s been in business added to the good customer service have produced a large number of regular customers that prefer her because the prices of her various products are quite accessible.

As an enterprising woman she plans to expand her installations in the future because it’s getting a bit small for the amount of products she stocks.

This is her 7th loan with MFP and she promises to repay punctually because she does not want to disappoint the people who made this loan, which will allow her to stay in business seeking progress, possible.

Erlinda plans to use the requested funds to buy a quantity of Panettones and other food items because, since the Christmas season is near, she wants to offer the best to her customers.

loans.use: To buy Panettones, chocolate and other foods consumed during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Ambrosia

texts.es: Ambrosia, de 53 años, está casada con Rómulo, de 53 años. Ambos tienen 8 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos: Ivan, de 22, Ángel, de 20 y Fredy, de 16 años. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ricrican. Hace poco Ambrosia, sufrió la perdida de uno de sus hijos, pero a pesar de ello; está valerosa mujer sigue trabajando arduamente, la ganadería y la agricultura, son sus principales actividades económicas. Sus sembríos constan principalmente de papa, los que después de cada cosecha, los comercializa en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, y en épocas de campaña agrícola, los lleva a la capital, donde adquiere mejores ganancias. Mientras que la carne que compra, lo lleva a la ciudad de San Ramón (selva central peruana), donde la carne de cordero escasea. Ahora, está valiente mujer desea comprar un auto, con el cual piensa incursionar en el trasporte público. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, y agradece el apoyo de su banco comunal, que fueron personas solidarias y le brindaron apoyo en el momento más difícil de su vida. Con el monto que solicita comprará, varios sacos de abono orgánico, y si el dinero le alcanza comprará carne al por mayor, para comercializarlo.
texts.en:
Ambrosia, 53, is married to Rómulo, 53.  They have 8 children but only three, Iván, 22, Ángel, 20, and Fredy, 16, live together as a family with them in their own house located in Ricrican.

A short time ago Ambrosia suffered the loss of one of her children.  Despite that, this brave woman continues working hard.  Her main economic activities are farming and cattle raising.

Her crops are mainly potatoes and she sells her harvests at the Tarma wholesale market.  During agricultural campaigns she takes them to the capital where she obtains greater profits.  The meat she buys she takes to the city of San Ramón (Peruvian central jungle) where lamb is scarce.

Now this brave woman wants to buy a car to go into public transportation services.

This is her 7th loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the support from her communal bank.  They are supportive people who helped her through the most difficult moment in her life.

She will use the loan to buy several sacks of organic manure and if there is enough money will buy meat at wholesale to resell.

loans.use: To buy several sacks of organic manure and meat at wholesale.

loans.name: Fredesvinda

texts.en:
Fredesvinda is sixty-six years old.  She lives in the village of La Estancia in the district of Olmos.  Olmos is a rural region which is heavily populated by farmers who manage small plots of land and grow corn, rice, yucca, sugar cane and other crops.  Fredesvinda is married.

In corrals behind her home, Fredesvinda raises animals.  Specifically, she raises fowl, sheep, goats and hogs.  She cares for and feeds the animals until they reach the appropriate size to be sold in local markets or to neighbors.  The animals serve as integral parts of the daily nutrition of the people in the zone and form a part of the rich culinary tradition of northern Peru.

Fredesvinda plans to use the loan funds to purchase additional feed for her animals and make improvements to her corrals.  She hopes to be able to improve the quality of her animals through using better feed and providing a healthier and better living environment.  By improving her business, she expects to be able to improve her lifestyle, make improvements to her home and spend more time with her husband.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed for her animals and make improvements to her corrals.

loans.name: Hubert

texts.en:
Hubert is thirty-five years old.  He lives with his partner and their three children in the small community of Saltur in the Zaña district.  It is a rural region approximately forty minutes outside of the city of Chiclayo.  It occupies a river valley, and through complicated irrigation systems and a relatively high water table, the population is able to plant a wide variety of crops, including rice, corn and sugar cane.

Hubert sells bread and other baked goods, including empanadas, cookies and sweets.  He has sold these items for over five years and has a good number of loyal clients who frequently pass by his regular sales spots.  He is proud to play an integral role in the daily nutrition and enjoyment of his neighbors.

This will be Hubert’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.  He plans to use the loan funds to increase his daily inventory and take advantage of the growing demands of his clientele.  He also hopes that this will enable him to make larger purchases each morning in order to obtain greater bulk discounts.  Hubert is a hard working man, with a strong drive to get ahead in life.  He hopes to be able to increase his family’s opportunities and provide his children with a good education.

loans.use: To increase his daily inventory and take advantage of the growing demands of his clientele.

loans.name: José Augusto

texts.en:
Jose is forty-six years old.  He shares his home with his partner and their three children.  They live in the small village of Collique Bajo, which is located in the district of Zaña and is approximately forty minutes outside of the city of Chiclayo.  It occupies a river valley, and through complicated irrigation systems and a relatively high water table, the population is able to plant a wide variety of crops including rice, corn and sugar cane.

Jose raises cattle in corrals near his home.  He raises both dairy cows and cattle for their meat.  He has been involved in the business for over ten years.  In addition to cattle, Jose has a small plot of land on which he plants and raises crops.  Depending on the season and the crop rotation, he can be found planting any number of common crops in the area, including corn, rice, beans and vegetables.

The planned use of the loan is to purchase additional feed for the cattle and fertilizer for his crops.  He wants to invest additional funds in his current products in order to increase his income over the coming months and improve his family’s lifestyle.  He dreams of making improvements to his home and providing his children with education.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed for the cattle and fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Neza

texts.en:
Neza P. is from the village of Bato. She is 56 years old. Neza is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $71 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Neza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Neza is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en:
Enhtuya B. is 45 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a traditional Mongolian housing dwelling called a ger in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. Both of her children attend the university and her husband supports her business. 

Enhtuya operates a dairy retail business at the local market. She began the business in 2006 with working capital of 300,000 MNT. Since then, her business has become successful and her working capital now exceeds 1,000,000 MNT. In the years of running her business, she has gained a reputation among her customers as a reliable supplier of quality dairy products. Enhtuya is a very honest person and says, "My only concern is to provide good quality dairy products to my customers." 

She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more dairy products to sell in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products to sell.

loans.name: Chreng

texts.en:
Chreng S., 62, is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits from her business to repair her house. 

S. sells food, earning an income of about $5 per day. She is married and resides with her husband and two children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia, an area known for being well supplied with fresh water from major rivers. Every month, the family has to spend $44 on food, $10 on electricity and $45 on other necessary expenses. Her two children are employed as construction workers, earning an income of about $3 each per day to help cover the family expenses.  

This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Norb

texts.en:
Norb P., 49, is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike for family use. In the future, she would like to repair her house. She is married and resides with her husband and three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia, an area known for being well supplied with freshwater from major rivers. 

P. is a housewife and her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of about $2 per day. Every month, the family has to spend $22 on food, $3 on electricity and $19 on other necessary expenses. One of her children is employed at the factory, earning an income of about $2 per day to help cover the family expenses.  

This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy M. is from the village of Sinaman, Dipolog City. He is 28 years old, married, and has no children. Jimmy operates a family member's business in the food sector, making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. He has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately $105 a month.

In 2009, Jimmy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. 

Jimmy is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be his 2nd loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell in his carenderia

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine C. is from the village of Lower Inuman. She is 23 years old and married. To make a living she plants and harvests vegetables to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Catherine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her 3rd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, such as manure

location.town: Lower Inuman, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Amelia's Group

texts.en:
Amelia A. is from the village of Santo Domingo in Luna municipality, Isabela province. She is 49 years old. Amelia is the group leader of a four-member group applying for a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Amelia is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Amelia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Amelia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP when she sells one of her raised animals.

In 2008 Amelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 22000 PHP from ASKI. Amelia is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Amelia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Enhtsetseg

texts.en: Enhtsetseg M. is a single mother who lives with her son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her son, age 16, attends university in a foreign country. Enhtsetseg operates a clothes retail business in the city.
