loans.name: Jerome

texts.en:
Jerome is 24 years old and currently single, but he cares for one orphan.  Jerome owns a secretarial service and works with his parents and other family members in Kimironko, a suburb of Kigali.  He has worked here for 2 years.

Jerome has requested a loan for a photocopier and more computers for his small, clean and well-organised office.  He plans to use any profits to provide food for his family.

loans.use: To buy equipment for a secretarial service

loans.name: Praxides

texts.en: Praxides N. W. is fifty years old. She is married and has five children between ten and thirty years old. Her business is located in Kakamega. She owns a grocery store in which she sells such items as cabbages, kale and other vegetables. She has been in this business for twenty years now and has one employee. She sells to the local people. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is that there are very many people in the area doing the same kind of business.  Hence, customers are spoilt for choice. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 35,000 to buy more vegetables to expand her business and use some of it to pay her children's school fees. Actually, Kes 15,000 will be used on vegetables and the rest will be used for school fees. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and even open a retail shop. She also hopes that in five years time,she will have educated all her children. She describes herself as a determined lady.

loans.use: Vegetables and school fees

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok K. is a hard working woman who has currently been living in Phnom Penh City. She was married, but she divorced her husband years ago. Sok K. lives with two married children and earns a living by planting various crops on their own farmland. Sok K. can earn an income of approximately $4 per day for managing the family’s expenses. Sok K. said that the main profit in her family comes from her son-in-law who works as a motor taxi driver. Currently, her son-in-law wants to purchase a trailer to connect with his existing motorbike, but he lack some fund. To see that, Sok K. wants to encourage her son-in-law and she will use her loan for him to purchase a trailer for connecting with an existing motorbike for providing service.

loans.use: Tto purchase a trailer for connecting with an existing motorbike for providing service.

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en:
Gantumur S. is 48 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Hovd province in Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest son currently works and lives in Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia, and the other three children all attend a local secondary school. His wife operates a construction decoration business which is seasonal.

Gantumur is a carpenter and produces a variety of wooden items out of his home according to his customer's specification. He started his business in 2005 and has since gained a lot of experience as a craftsman. In addition, he helps his wife's business during summer months to supplement his family income. Gantumur is a friendly and modest man and is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan in order to purchase livestock at wholesale price.

loans.use: To purchase livestock at wholesale price.

loans.name: Djamila

texts.en:
Djamila is 29 years old and is married with four children who are between 1 and 6 years old. Djamila is known in the business of selling new clothes, mainly children’s clothes. She has been in this business for about three years and currently employs one person.

Djamila has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to help expand her business by buying more clothing styles, including clothes for men and women.  If successful, Djamila hopes to continue building a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Fifty-two year old Teresita C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has 4 children. Her eldest child is 23 years old and the youngest is 9. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Teresita also owns and manages a sari-sari store where she sells different products.

Teresita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to buy farm inputs and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and additional merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Battsooj

texts.en:
Battsooj G. is 25 years old and lives with his wife in an apartment in the Dragon district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife is a university student and Battsooj operates a gold and silver crafts business in the city. He has a lot of skill as a craftsman and designs and produces a variety of jewelry and accessories. He started his business after working as an assistant goldsmith in the Nomin Goyol company for 4 years.

For the future, Battsooj hopes to expand his business by hiring more workers and increasing his business earnings. He is a hardworking and clever man. He needs to purchase more raw materials in order to produce and preserve a large quantity of silver cups to sell during the upcoming big holidays. He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of raw materials and silver for his production.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of raw materials and silver.

loans.name: Bazaroy

texts.ru: Шамакова Базарой жительница района Кубодиён. Ей 42 года. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Муж и старший сын находятся в России на заработках. Сама Базарой занимается животноводством. Она закупает скот и разводит их у себя дома. В основном Базарой разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 6 лет. Кредит берет для закупа скота, чтобы увеличить их количества. Она хочет расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Bazaroy S., 42, resides in Kubodien. She has secondary education and is married with 5 children. Bazaroy's husband and eldest son are working in Russia. Bazaroy herself if engaged in animal husbandry. She buys the cattle and breeds them at home, mostly for sale. Having done this work for 6 years, Bazaroy is applying for a loan that would allow her to purchase more livestock and increase turnover.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock and fodder

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce W. M. is a single lady with two children aged ten and three years old. Her business is located at the busy Kongowea-Karama market in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian ocean white beaches. She sells cosmetics, hair additions, lotions, relaxers and others. She also owns a salon and mostly works on the local women's hair.

She has been in this business for the last three years. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is there are so many people doing the same kind of business as hers in the area and so customers are spoilt for choice. However she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more weaves, relaxers and carpets to expand her business. She hopes to be a market leader at Kongowea by opening many more premises. She hopes to give her children a quality education and own a house some day. She describes herself as determined, persevering and open minded.

loans.use: Carpets, weaves and relaxers.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine P. is from the village of Sicayab. She is 30 years old, separated and has 1 school aged child. Catherine operates a family member's business in the retail sector, running a general store in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Catherine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Catherine is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products for her sari- sari store. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Catherine from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Hap

texts.en:
Hap B., 33, is a married man living in Takhmao City. He is a local crop farmer, growing rice and vegetables on his land, which came from his grandparents in 2005. His wife is a vegetable seller, and makes a profit of $3 per day on average. Hap B. owns motorbike and he also uses it to take his wife and the vegetables to the local market every morning.

Hap B.’s wife thinks that it is time to sustain her investment's growth and look for extra revenue, which she proposes to do by selling vegetables at the market. She wants to buy a larger quantity of vegetables to sell to retailers in the market, but she complains that she doesn’t have a big enough vehicle to transport more vegetables. To achieve her goal, Hap B. has decided to seek a loan in order to purchase a trailer to connect to his existing motorbike so that he can use it to pick up more vegetables. He will use rest of the loan towards purchasing farm supplies to use on his field.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer, and farm supplies.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma A., 45 years old, is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is a farmer, and cultivates her land to plant and harvest rice crops for sale. She has been farming for more than 20 years already. She also raises pigs for fattening and sale. Erma works hard to support her family financially. She also wants to be able to save for future emergencies.

Erma joined CEVI to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 that she will use to buy farm inputs and feed for the pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and feed.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Genoveva T. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 55 years old. Genoveva is married and has 10 children. To make a living, Genoveva owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Genoveva is thankful for their farm because it helps her family immensely.

Genoveva joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genoveva has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Genoveva is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael N. K. is a married lady with one child aged five years old. Her business is located at the busy Kongowea-Karama market in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian ocean white beaches.

She sells clothes to the local people. She has been in this business for the last seven years. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is impassable roads during the rainy seasons, thus slowing her business. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 40,000 to buy more clothes to expand her business and meet the demands of her customers, especially as we approach the Christmas festivities. She hopes to expand the buisness and move it to a more convenient place which is easily accessible, especially during the rainy seasons. She describes herself as hardworking, honest and goal oriented.

loans.use: To buy ladies' clothes.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine P. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 38 years old, married, and has 2 children. To make a living, Geraldine owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Geraldine has been engaged in farming for over 15 years already.

Geraldine joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Geraldine has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Geraldine is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Mutua Ikandi

texts.en:
Mutua Ikandi is 54 years old and married to Muli. They have nine dependent children. For the past 10 years, Mutua has run a business buying and reselling chicken and goats after fattening them. Mutua earns 1,400 KES each month and his wife also contributes to the family’s total monthly income through her business.

This is Mutua’s third loan with KADET LTD and he will use it to buy goats and chicken. He has successfully repaid his previous loans. In the future, Mutua hopes to start selling cows to a Nairobi slaughter house in Dagorretti. He also wants to give his children quality education.

loans.use: to buy chicken and goats

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Thirty-five year old Grace P. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has a 7 year old child. Grace is a farmer. She cultivates her land to plant and harvests rice crops for sale. She also raises pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells pork meat to their town's market. Grace does her best to help improve her family's living conditions.

Grace needs farm inputs and pig feed. She applied for a loan of PHP 15,000 from CEVI to buy the supplies that she needs. Grace is hopeful that this loan will help her farm and piggery immensely.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and pig feed.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean B. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 28 years old, married, and has a 3 year old child. To make a living, Jean owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jean wishes for her business to succeed.

Jean joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jean has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Jean is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Bright Future Primary School-Kampala Group

texts.en: Annet B. is 36 years old and happily married with three children. She belongs to the group “Bright Future Primary School.” For the last nine years, Annet has been working as a teacher. She is drawn to teaching even if her remuneration is minimal and she goes about her work with painstaking dedication, diligence, and buoyancy. If it was not for these virtues, Annet’s close friends say that she would probably have already given up teaching. But she has remained committed to her profession and earns a monthly salary of 250,000 UGX. Annet says that she will buy land with her portion of the loan.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: Kholiyor

texts.ru: Тураев Холиёр проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 48 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Жена, занимается торговлей на рынке. Сам Холиёр арендует земельный участок, где засеивает пшеницу и выращивает овощи для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 10 лет. Целью кредита является закуп семян картошки, пшеницы и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Kholiyor T., 48, lives in the Shahritus region. He is married with 4 children. His wife sells goods at the market. Kholiyor rents a plot of land where he  sows wheat and grows vegetables for sale. Having done this work for over 10 years, Kholiyor is applying for a loan which would allow him to purchase mineral fertilizers, potatoes and wheat.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa D. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 57 years old, married, and has 5 children. To make a living, Josefa owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Josefa also raises ducks and sells duck eggs in their community. 

Josefa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefa has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Josefa is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to buy farm inputs and duck feed.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and duck feed.

loans.name: Mansueta

texts.en:
Mansueta S. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 59 years old. Mansueta is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Mansueta owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Mansueta hopes to have a successful business so she can continually support her family.

Mansueta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mansueta has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Mansueta is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Twisungane Tudahemukirana Group

texts.fr: M. Marceline a 28 ans, elle est mariée, elle est membre du Groupe Twisungane Tudahemukirana et elle a 3 enfants entre 6 ans et 3 ans.  Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans d’école primaire, et 2 de ses enfants vont à l’école.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter la machine de pompe pour arroser ses champs de tomates. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’augmenter sa l’étendu cultivé.  Elle voudrait continuer sa carrière jusqu'à arriver à une grande cultivatrice des tomates exemplaire. Elle voudrait aussi payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants jusqu’au niveau, et assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en: M. Marceline is 28 years old, married and a member of the Twisungane Tudahemukirana group. She has three children between the ages of three and six. She had six years of primary schooling and two of her children go to school.  She is going to use her loan to purchase a machine pump to water her tomato fields. Her strategy for expanding her business is to increase her farmable surface. She would like to continue her career until she becomes an important and model tomato farmer. She would also like to pay her children's school fees and assure her family's well- being.

loans.use: Purchase of a machine pump to water the tomato plantation

loans.name: Nhoeb

texts.en:
Nhoeb C. is 25 year old married woman and mother. She and her family have been living in Phnom Penh City of Cambodia.

She owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows different kinds of crop on her land, such as cabbages and cucumbers, which she sells to buyers every two or three months when the plants mature. Her husband has grown these crops with her. The couple is married and has two school-aged children.

In the past, Nhoeb C. has always hired the neighbor’s cow in order to alleviate the chore of plowing the farmland. Right now, she hopes to buy her own cow and that is why she is applying for a loan from Kiva. She hopes to use the rest of fund for buying fertilizers, and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To buy a new cow, fertilizers, and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita L. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 45 years old. Cristita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Cristita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling a variety of viands like fried fish and chicken adobo in the local community. Cristita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cristita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Cristita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Cristita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad B. is from the village of Daan Lungsod, Gingoog City. She is 40 years old. Felicidad is widowed and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Felicidad owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling dried fish and vegetables like string beans and eggplants in the local community. Felicidad has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Felicidad joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felicidad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Felicidad is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional vegetables like squash and carrots. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Felicidad from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables like squash & carrots.

loans.name: C5501 Twitezimbere Group

texts.en:
Alise is 27 years old and is married with two children who are 4 and 8 years old. She is the president of a group called “Twitezimbere”, and in the picture she has her hand raised. Alise sells bananas. This is their third successful year in this business.

Alise has requested a loan to purchase a large quantity of bananas to sell at the market. Alise hopes this will help her to earn a good profit from the sale and allow her to provide for her family, pay school fees, and save some money for the future.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of bananas.

loans.name: Elpedio

texts.en:
Elpedio O. is from the village of Barangay 24, Gingoog City. He is 60 years old, married, and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Elpedio owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a welding shop in the local community. He is also engaging in buying and selling of coconuts in the local community. Elpedio has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elpedio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elpedio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Elpedio is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional coconuts. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Elpedio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional coconuts.

loans.name: Heriknaz

texts.en:
Heriknaz A. lives in Yerevan with her husband, sister-in-law and her son. Heriknaz first worked in a self-service store as a cashier and later in a shoe factory. In 1991, Heriknaz and her husband left Armenia for Bulgaria where they managed their own shop. After 5 years, they have returned home and Heriknaz started a business renting a space at the trade fair where she sells a variety of toys, including mechanical, musical, and educational toys. 

Heriknaz’s first Kiva loan allowed her to organize mixed products trading in her shop and place a stall with mixed products for resale in front of her rented shop. Now, she is requesting a loan of 500, 000 AMD to buy a lot of toys for her shop in view of the New Year's holidays. This is Heriknaz’s eleventh loan from Nor Horizon and her second loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy toys for her shop in view of the New Year's holidays

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda S., 37, is from the village of Laligan, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Luzviminda owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling used clothing, shoes, blankets and sandals in the local community. Luzviminda has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Luzviminda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzviminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI which she used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Luzviminda is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell such as t-shirts and blouses. This will be her fifth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell such as t-shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, 32, is married with four children between the ages of 2 and 13. She owns a small local bar selling locally produced beer called “sorghum beer". She buys it in five jerry-cans of 20 litres each and sells it to the local people. Besides selling the local beer, she also roasts goat meat which the local people enjoy, especially in the evenings after a day of hard work on their farms.

Agnes has requested a loan to expand her business. She will buy other equipment for her beer garden such as tables, cups and bottles and increase her beer stocks for the Christmas season. She hopes to continue to grow her business and will invest any profit back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more equipment and stock.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica M., 34, is from the village of Salawagan, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Jessica runs a business buying and selling rice by the kilogram in the local community. Jessica has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Jessica joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI which she used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Jessica is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase additional rice to sell. This will be her fourth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie O., 25, is from the village of Puntian, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is single. To make a living, Rosalie owns and operates a business providing motorcycle tire repair services to local community members. Rosalie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Rosalie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase materials needed to expand her service offering. Rosalie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase materials needed to provide her services. This will be her third loan from HSPFI and she plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina P. is from the village of Salawagan, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 38 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Saturnina owns and operates a specialized retail store buying and selling clothing, blankets, pillow cases and shoe products in the local community. Saturnina has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Saturnina joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Saturnina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like t-shirts and blouses. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: Purchasing goats for resale

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol S. is from the village of Salawagan, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 33 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Mirasol owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, soft drinks, convenience foods, canned goods and instant noodles in the local community. Mirasol has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Mirasol joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Mirasol is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as beverages and convenience foods. This loan will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.name: Roque

His main source of income comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, and junk foods in the local community. Roque has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

Roque joined HSPFI in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional inventory and use working capital. For his second loan, Roque is requesting 8,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell such as junk foods and beverages. Roque plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to improve and expand his shop.

loans.name: Jhonna

texts.en:

loans.name: Jennalyn

texts.en: Jennalyn L. is from the village of Alanib, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 32 years old. Jennalyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jennalyn makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies like rice cakes and hot cakes in the local community. Jennalyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2010, Jennalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. loans.name: Rahat

texts.en:
Rahat S. is 49 years old and widowed with one son. Rahat worked as a schoolteacher and is known as a very precise and hardworking person. In 2001, after the death of her husband, she became the only breadwinner for her small family. In order to find an additional means of subsistence,  Rahat started her own business in the reselling of fancies. 

She started with the initial sum of only 1,000 Kyrgyzstan soms (KGS) and managed to raise her floating capital to 15,000 KGS.  Now Rahat needs to develop her business and plans to use this loan of 30,000 KGS for widening her assortment of goods. It will allow her to broaden her business and pay for her son’s education. Also, Rahat is a very attentive daughter and revenues from this loan will allow her to support her parents with larger maintenance.  Rahat is a very optimistic person who sets a goal and makes every effort to reach it. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target an especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene C. is from the village of Alanib, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 38 years old. Arlene is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Arlene makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling viands (tasty dishes) like pork and chicken kebabs. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Arlene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Arlene from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Rasul

texts.en:
A. Rasul is 34 years old, married and has four school-aged children. Rasul is a manufacturer who produces wooden doors, windows, benches and cradles. His shop is located right in his house. Working in this business for 14 years, Rasul has become an experienced master and now he has students. Producing goods of a good quality and acceptable price means that Rasul has many customers. He sells his products from his house and also from a trading place located in the local market. In general, Rasul's business is very successful and generates a stable income for his family. Now Rasul is planning to purchase an additional woodworker that he needs to expand his business. For this purpose, he is requesting a loan of $2,000 USD.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase a woodworker

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of rice, maize, sugar and oil for small shop

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
M. Gulchehra is 43 years old and comes from a large and humble family. She is married and the loving mother of 3 children. Her father's hard and demanding character showed her, from the time she was a little girl, the significant value of work, and therefore she has been successful in various activities throughout her life. Now she dedicates herself to raising and selling cattle, and with the income she generates she provides a better quality of life for her children, who are her greatest joy and have become her best friends. Gulchehra asks for a loan of $1976 USD in order to buy more young cattle to later sell when they are fully grown. With this investment she will be able to substantially grow her earnings and improve her quality of life. Let’s support this dedicated mother's proposal. 
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing young cattle in order to expand the business and to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas De Candia Loma Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la Cía. Candía Loma de la ciudad de Caacupé.
 La Presidenta, la Sra. Petrona G. de Correa, vive con una hija y nietos, posee una despensa que es el sustento de su hogar, también ahora empieza con la venta de anteojos para lectura de venta libre, que le facilita la Fundación con otros de los programas con que trabaja, es una mujer muy trabajadora, y sacrificada, el crédito y las constantes capacitaciones son para ella un incentivo, un apoyo muy grande para salir adelante.
 Está muy agradecida con la fundación y por su intermedio con kiva por la confianza que depositaron en ella, y sus compañeras.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías ya que quiere estar bien surtida en su negocio para las fiestas, especialmente bebidas de consumo masivo, enlatados, dulces y otros.
texts.en:
The women of this group are from the city of Candia Loma in the Caacupe. The leader of the group is Petrona G. de Correa. She lives with one of her daughters and her grandchildren. She has a convenience store in her home. She has recently started selling reading glasses to the general public, which helps her with the other programs in which she participates. She is a very hard working woman who has sacrificed a great deal in her live. These loans and the constant support are an incentive for her and it is a great push for her to come out ahead. 

She is very grateful to the organization and to Kiva for the trust that they have imparted upon her and her colleagues. She requests a loan to purchase merchandise in order to stock her business in time for the holidays, especially drinks in large quantities, canned foods, sweets etc.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Bedan Maina

texts.en:
Bedan is 63 years-old and married to his wife, Rose. She also contributes to the family income. Bedan has a dairy farm which has been running for six years and generates an income of 20,000 Kshs. per month. 

This is his first loan with KADET LTD and he want to use it to buy animal feed. He hopes to venture into green house farming in order to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy animal feed for his dairy farm

loans.name: Serob

texts.en:
Serob A. lives in Yerevan. He is 26 years old and lives with his wife and his baby. From 2005 to 2008, Serob was a minibus driver. As his work wasn’t profitable, Serob decided to change his profession.  For about 2 years, Serob has engaged in jewelry production. 
Serob is a private entrepreneur renting a workshop and stall in one of the biggest jewelry markets in Yerevan.   He makes and sells his jewelry there. Thanks to the profit from his business, Serob can meet his young family's needs, and buy new furniture and household appliances for his apartment.
Serob asks for a $2500 loan to buy gold for his business because prices for gold are going up in gold markets now.  He hopes the loan will help him to increase his profit in future.

loans.use: To buy gold for his business

loans.name: Rose  Jerotich

texts.en:
Rose Jerotich K. is a 28-year-old married women.  She and her husband have two children, ages eight years and five years. They live in Iten, outside of Eldoret, Kenya. Rose has a grocery store where she sells food products to earn her income. She has been in this business for the past five years making an income of 15,000 KES per month.

Rose was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and she is applying for her sixth loan of 60,000 KES with KADET LTD. With this loan she plans to buy bananas, tomatoes, carrots, and irish potatoes for sale.

She hopes to operate a large scale grocery, whereby she can be able to supply hotels and sell the best quality products for her customers and in future to extend these services to the city center.

loans.use: To buy bananas, tomatoes, carrots, and irish potatoes

loans.name: Twitezimbere Rukoma Group

texts.fr: Emmanuel G. est commerçant, et il est un membre du groupe Twitezimbere Rukoma.  Il a 47 ans, il est marié, et il a 1 enfant de deux ans.  Son niveau d’éducation est  de 6 ans de l’école  primaire, et il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter  deux machines à raser, deux  miroirs et tissus (pour le couvrement des clients pendant le coiffage) pour son salon de coiffures.  Il va aussi acheter des récoltes à vendre pour augmenter son revenu dans la saison de récolte (maintenant, c’est la saison de récoltes d’haricots).  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’améliorer ses activités actuelles.  Il voudrait satisfaire ses besoins, avoir une bonne vie, et payer des frais scolaires pour son enfant.
texts.en: Emanuel G. is a merchant, and a member of the Twitezimbere Rukoma group. He is 47 years old, married, and has one child, who is two years old. He attended 6 years of primary school, and will use his loan to buy who shaving machines, two mirrors and fabric (for covering clients while they get their hair cut). He will also buy some green beans to sell in order to increase his income during the harvest season (right now it is the season for harvesting green beans). His strategy for growing his business is to improve his current activities. He would like to make enough money to pay for his daily needs, live a good life, and pay for his child's school fees.

loans.use: Achat des recolte et materiel de salon de coiffure

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio Comandante Ojeda de la cuidad de Atyra que dista a 19 km de la oficina regional Caacupé.

La Presidenta del comité es la Sra. Sara Noelia A. ella se dedica a la cría de pollos, la señora vive con su marido que es empleado y dos hijos estudiantes, ella es una mujer muy sacrificada y humilde dedicada a su familia y a su pequeño negocio para ayudar en el sustento de su hogar.

Hoy en día ella ya tiene una clientela formada y está queriendo optar por otra clase de negocio también para poder seguir mejorando su calidad de vida.

Ella está muy satisfecha con el apoyo que le brinda la Fundación paraguaya y Kiva no solamente en créditos si no también con las capacitaciones y asesoramientos.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de alimentos para sus animales y también para lo gastos de sanitación de los mismos.
texts.en:
The women of this committee are from the Comandante Ojeda neighborhood of the city of Atyra which is 19km from our Caacupé regional office.

The committee's president is Mrs Sara Noelia A..  She raises chickens and lives with her husband, who is an employee in a company, and her two children who are students.  She is a very selfless and humble woman who is devoted to her family and to her small business which helps support her household.

Sara has an established customer base and she would like to choose another type of business in addition to her current one so that she can continue to improve her quality of life.  She is very satisfied with the support she is being given by Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva, not only through the loans but also through the training sessions and advisory sessions.  She is requesting this loan to buy feed for her animals and to cover the costs of keeping them healthy.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed

loans.name: David Nguyai

texts.en:
David is 45 years old and married to Lydia Njeri, who helps in the farm that provides income for the family. They have four children who are dependent on them. David has been in the farming business for about two years with an income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings per month. 

This is his first loan with KADET LTD and he intends to use the loan to buy a dairy goat for income generation. He hopes to start a business of selling potatoes and vegetables wholesale in order to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy a dairy goat

loans.name: Ohiniko

texts.fr: Ohiniko est marié et a 3 enfants.  Il est âgé de  36ans. IL est cuisinier de profession mais a créé  un restaurant que lui-même gère.  Il achète les ingrédients  au grand marché de Lomé et revient  préparer dans le bar dans le quartier Bè. IL sollicite au près de WAGES un prêt pour acheter 10 cartons de spaghetti, 8 cartons de lait et 5 cartons de tomates en boite pour satisfaire plus de clients.
texts.en: Ohiniko is married and has three children. He is 36 years old. He is a chef by trade and has an eatery which he manages himself. He purchases the ingredients at the big market of Lomé and cooks them in the bar of the Bè district. He is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to purchase 10 boxes of pasta, eight boxes of milk and five boxes of canned tomatoes in order to be able to serve more customers.

loans.use: Purchasing groceries

loans.name: Susan  Jeptoo

texts.en:
Susan Jeptoo K. is a hard-working lady of 30 years who is married to William Kigen, and together they have two children aged between five and ten years. She has been operating a boutique for the past two years and earns a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings.

When she first learned about KADET LTD, she had no history with any other MFI. She has applied for her third loan of 70,000 Kenyan shillings from KADET LTD with which she intends to buy clothes to sell. She plans to use the profits to expand her business.

Susan hopes to grow her business and to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Avaz

texts.ru: Алматов Аваз проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 50 лет. Он женат. Имеет четверых детей. Образование среднее. Зарабатывает он путем разведения крупно-рогатого скота. У него имеется не большой коровник. Аваз покупает молодых бычков, откармливает и продает на рынке по более выгодной цене. Это помогает обеспечивать семью. Целью кредита является закуп крупно-рогатого скота. Именно сейчас покупка крупно-рогатого скота может быть выгодна, так как зимою животные исхудавшие, продаются по низким ценам. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже 15 лет.
texts.en: A. Avas lives in the Shahrituz region. He's fifty years old, married and has four children. He has a high school level of education and has made a living for the past fifteen years by breeding livestock. He buys young bulls, fattens them and then sells them at the market for profit. This helps feed the family. He even has a small barn. He's asking for a loan to buy some more cattle, because this is one of the most profitable times to do so: in the winter, animals are very thin and tend to be a lot cheaper.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Joyce Njoki

texts.en:
Joyce Njoki K. is 32 years old and married to Haman Kabuga, who also contributes to the family income. They have two children. She has been running her retail shop for three years, with an income of about Kshs 13,000 per month. 

This is her first loan with KADET LTD and she wants to use it to buy additional stock of clothes for sale. She hopes to open more boutiques in the area and operate a wholesale shop in the near future.  She also hopes to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes for her retail shop.

loans.name: Eliud Musyoka

texts.en:
Eliud is 64 years old and supports four members of his family. He raises chicken as a primary business and has a retail shop for cereals. He has been in these businesses for about three years with an income of about 5,300 Kenyan shillings per month.

This is his third loan with KADET after successfully repaying his previous loans well and on time. He hopes to build a better permanent home for his family and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy cereals to stock his kiosk as a secondary business

loans.name: San Luis Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la Compañía Aguaity, Barrio Huyvaty de la cuidad de Eusebio Ayala que dista a 21 km de la oficina regional Caacupé.

La Presidenta del comité es la Sra. Victoriana Martínez ella se dedica a la venta de helados y comestibles,  ella es madre soltero vive sola con su hijo, ella es muy sacrificada trabaja  muy duro para que su hijo pueda estudiar.

La Sra. Victoriana vende helados, hielo,  remedios refrescantes y comestibles por la zona, sale todos los días por las mañanas a vender sus productos por la compañía de Aguaity. 

Doña Victoriana está muy agradecida con la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva por el capital que le brindo para poder invertir en su negocio y así  tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su pequeño hijo.  
Solicita el préstamo para la compra materia prima para la fabricación de helados.
texts.en:
The women of this committee are from the Aguaity residential development, in the Huyvaty neighborhood of the city of Eusebio Ayala which is 21km from our Caacupé regional office.

The committee's president is Victoriana Martínez who sells frozen treats and food.  She is a single mother who lives alone with her son.  She is very selfless and works very hard so that her son can study.

Victoriana sells frozen treats, ice, traditional tonics and food in the area.  She goes out every morning to sell her products in the Aguaity residential development.

Victoriana is very grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the capital that they have given her so that she can invest in her business and thereby enjoy a better quality of life for herself and her young son.  She is requesting this loan to buy raw materials for making frozen treats.

loans.use: To buy materials for making frozen treats

loans.name: Nelius Wanjiku

texts.en:
Nelius is 30 years old and married to Jacob Ngagi, who contributes to the family income. They have two children. Nelius has been running her retail shop for two years with a profit of about Kshs. 5000 per month.

She hopes to own a wholesale shop, give her children a quality education and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and flour

loans.name: San Miguel Arcangel Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la compañía Aguaity, Barrio Díaz Cué de Eusebio Ayala que dista a 22 km de la oficina regional Caacupé.

La Presidenta del comité es la Sra. Antonina O. ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comestibles,  ella vive con su pareja que trabaja como olero y tienen juntos 5 hijos de los cuales 3 están estudiando uno de ellos ya termino sus estudios y el otro aun no está en edad escolar. 

La Sra. Antonina se levanta todas las madrugadas a preparar sus comestibles y sale muy temprano para venderlos por la compañía de Aguaity, sus principales clientes son los hombres que trabajan en su gran mayoría en olerías. 

Ella está muy feliz por el crédito que le brindo la Fundación Paraguaya, anteriormente ella no contaba con un capital para trabajar mejor y hoy gracias al crédito que recibió puede trabajar a mayor escala. 

Doña Antonina está muy agradecida con la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva por el apoyo tan importante que le ha brindado a ella y a sus compañeras.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de carne.
texts.en:
The women of this communal bank are from the Aguaity residential development, in the Díaz Cué neighborhood of the city of Eusebio Ayala, which is 22 km from the Caacupé regional office.

Antonina O. is the president of the communal bank.  She makes and sells food.  She lives with her life partner, who works as a brickmaker.  They have five children.  Three of them are in school, one of them has finished school, and the other one is not yet school age.

Antonina gets up early every day to prepare her food.  She leaves very early to sell them in the Aguaity area.  Her main customers are the men that work in the area making bricks.

She is very happy for the loan from the Fundación Paraguaya.  Previously she did not have the money to work better.  Now, thanks to the loan she received, she is able to work on a greater scale.

Antonina is very grateful to the Fundación Paraguay and Kiva for the support, which is so important, that they have given her and her colleagues.  She is requesting the loan to buy meat.

loans.use: To buy meat

loans.name: Kadzo Karisa

texts.en: Kadzo Karisa K. is 35 years old. She is married to Karisa K. who is a civil servant. Kadzo supports five people. She has been in the tailoring business for the last three years. This will be her second loan from KADET LTD. Kadzo plans to purchase a new sewing machine and add to her stock of fabric for making dresses for sale. From the anticipated profits, she hopes to start a training school. Her dream is to own a tailoring training college and provide for her family’s needs.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine and add to her stock of fabric for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, meat, fish, oil, onion, salt, pepper, tomato etc

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy used clothing

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius K. is 46 years old and married to Rose Njeri, who also contributes to the family income. They have four children. He has been growing crops for nine years, and earns an income of 3,800 per  month. 

Julius is taking his fourth loan with KADET with which he plans to buy fertilizer and pesticide. He hopes to expand his farming activity to increase profits and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy slippers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rocks and sticks

loans.name: Kiira Development Group-Mukono

texts.en: Forty-two-year-old Sunday S. has been in charcoal sales for the last decade in Kiira Town-Mukono. He earns 150,000 UGX monthly. The idea for starting the business came from a close friend. Before that, he was operating a grocery store. To obtain a solid footing in this business, he has had to rely on hard work and a sense of determination. Sunday is happily married with two kids. With this loan, he plans to purchase more bags of charcoal. He belongs to the Kiira development group.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Ayub Kinyajui

texts.en:
Ayub Kinyanjui is 31 years old. He is married to Monica Wambui who contributes to the family income. They have one child. He has been running a funeral transport and services business for five years with an income of 30,500 Kenya shillings a month.

He is taking his second loan with KADET after successfully repaying the previous loans on time. He intends to use the loan to buy timber to make coffins.  

He hopes to build a mortuary at Kenol center in Thika and also improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy timber for making coffins.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of peanuts

loans.name: Via Ferrea Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio Vía Férrea de la  cuidad de Pirayu que dista a 20 km de la oficina regional Caacupé.

La Presidenta del comité es la Sra. Feliciana F. ella es Costurera, es una mujer muy sacrificada vive con su marido que se dedica a la construcción y  tiene 3 hijos estudiantes ella este año termina su sexto curso.

Ella hace buzos, romeras, camisas y todos los tipos de prendas de vestir por pedido y ella mismo los entrega. 

La Sra. Feliciana está muy feliz con el importante apoyo que le da la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva para seguir creciendo comercialmente y personalmente.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de distintos tipos de telas y otros accesorios que ella utiliza para la confección.
texts.en:
The women of this communal bank are from the Vía Férrea neighborhood in the city of Pirayu, which is 20 km from the Caacupé regional office.

Feliciana F. is president of the communal bank.  She is a seamstress and a very self-sacrificing woman.  She lives with her husband, who works in construction.  She has three children, and they go to school.  This year she is finishing her sixth cycle.

She makes thick winter pants, sweatshirts, shirts, and all types of clothes by order.  She delivers them herself.  

Feliciana is very happy with the important support from the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.  The support is important in order for her to keep growing commercially and personally.

She is requesting the loan to buy different types of fabrics and other accessories that she uses to make clothes.

loans.use: Buy fabric and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, gallons of oil, onions, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Christophe

texts.en:
Christophe is 33 years old and married. He has three children who are between one and ten years old. Currently one of his children is enrolled in school. Christophe works as a tailor, and he has spent six years in this business. 

Christophe would like to use this loan to purchase more equipment and necessary materials for his tailoring business. He said that his business started with little capital, but now he is finally seeing a profit, which will be used for school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for making garments for sale.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine owns a bar. She is married and has one child who is seven years old and goes to school. Her husband works as a technician. 

Claudine plans to use this loan to buy more chairs, tables, and drawers and cabinets which will be used in her bar. She said that any profits made will be used solely to reinvest and grow her business.  Currently she has only a few bartenders but would like to have more in the future.

loans.use: To buy more things for the pub like chairs, tables and drawers and cabinets

loans.name: Josiane

texts.en:
Josiane is 30 years old. She is married and has two children who are one year old and four and a half years old. None of her children go to school. Her husband sells shoes for a living, and Josiane also sells shoes, which she has been doing for ten years. 

From the experience she has obtained in this business, she decided to request this loan to buy more shoes to sell and to pay school fees for her child with the profits she anticipates. She would like to have her own residential house in the future.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi owns a hair salon for both women and men. She is 30 years old and married to a security guard, and they have two children who are two and six years old. 

Zawadi has requested this loan to buy more equipment to use in her salon and to employ more barbers. She would like to use the profits from her hair salon to set up a new restaurant to generate more income.  She has found her salon very helpful as it has allowed her to assist with many family problems.

loans.use: To add more equipment for the hair salon

loans.name: Ange

texts.en:
Ange is 30 years old and married to a primary school teacher. They have two children who are two and six years old.  Ange sells women clothes, and she has been doing this business for eight years. 

Ange decided to request this loan due to the growth of her business, and she needs to buy more women's clothes to sell. She said that the profit from her business will be used for savings because she has a lot of things to pay for in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en: Yvonne is 29 years old. She is married and has three children who are in the range of six and ten years old. She owns a boutique of various items with her husband. She says that with this loan she will create another business selling charcoal and add more merchandise in her current business too. She is determined to improve her business by reinvesting any profits she makes. She dreams of having a prospering store in the future.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la compañía Aguaity, barrio Virgen del Carmen.

La Presidenta del comité es la Sra. Patricia M. ella se dedica a la venta de Frutas y verduras, ella es una mujer muy sacrificada tiene 6 hijos 3 de los cuales viven con ella y estudian los demás ya son casados, una de ellas está viviendo en la argentina y le envía mensualmente un poco de dinero.

La Sra. Patricia es muy sacrificada sale tres veces a la semana a las tres de la mañana para trabajar en el mercada de San Lorenzo, ella está en el mercado hasta vender todos sus productos.

Doña Patricia está muy agradecida con la Fundación Paraguaya y a la vez con Kiva por el apoyo tan importante que les brinda a las señoras del comité.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
The women of this communal bank are from the Aguaity residential development in the Virgen del Carmen neighborhood.

Patricia M. is the president of the group.  She sells fruits and vegetables.  She is a very self-sacrificing woman, and she has six children.  Three of them live with her, and they go to school.  The other children are married.  One of them is living in Argentina and sends her a little money each month.

Patricia is very selfless; three times a week she leaves at three in the morning to work in the San Lorenzo market.  She stays in the market until she sells all of her products.

Patricia is very grateful to the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the very important support they offer the women in the communal bank.  She is requesting the loan to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Philomene

texts.en:
Philomene is a widow with four children between the ages of ten and eighteen. She is 51 years old and sells secondhand clothes of different kinds. 

She requested this loan to buy more secondhand clothes to sell and to provide food for the family and pay her rent with the profits. She dreams of establishing another business in the future of selling charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mukisa Development Group-Mpigi

texts.en: 35-year-old Florence K. has been in retail for the last four years. She credits her husband with coming up with the idea of starting this business. Florence is happily married with three kids. Before starting this business, she was working in a construction company. She now has her own small construction company. At her shop, she mostly sells home supplies such as soap, sugar, and bread. This business generates 350,000 shillings in profits monthly. With this loan, Florence, who belongs to Mukisa development group, says she is going to buy more goods for resale.

loans.use: The purchase of more goods for resale

loans.name: Mathien

texts.en:
Mathien sells rice, sugar and many more items in his boutique, which he has been doing for three years.  He is 27 years old and married. His wife works with him in his small shop. 

His loan will be used to add more items in his boutique for sale. He hopes to use the new profits towards the growth of the business. He hopes to supply to outside the country in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items such as sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Salumu

texts.en: Salumu is 46 years old, married, and has 3 children who all attend school.  Salumu sells foodstuffs in a small boutique, which he has done for nine years. Salumu will use the loan to purchase more items like potatoes, green bananas and sugar. With the new profits from his expanded business, Salumu plans to reinvest to continue to grow the business. He says that his business is successful because it allows him to pay school fees for his children and sustain his family.  One day he hopes to import more items to sell.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Placidie

texts.en:
Placidie owns a business that sells fish and also clothes, which she has been doing for 4 years. She is 47 years old, married, and has five children who are between thirteen and twenty-two years old. All her children currently go to school, and her husband is a soldier. 

Her loan will be used to buy more fish. With any profits from the loan she plans to build a residential house. She has a dream to buy a premise for her own business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and fish to sell.

loans.name: Venant

texts.en:
Venant is 37 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. Venant sells flowers with his wife, which they have done for 5 years. 

Venant will use this loan to purchase more flowers. With the new profits from his expanded business, Venant plans to buy land to plant more of his own flowers. In the future he would like to export flowers.

loans.use: To buy more flowers to sell.

loans.name: Djamila

texts.en:
Djamila is 43 years old, married, and has six children. Currently, six of her children attend school. Her husband is a businessman. Djamila owns a restaurant, which she has done for 13 years.  

Djamila will use this loan to purchase more utensils and foodstuffs for her restaurant. With the new profits from her expanded business, Djamila plans to build a house. She hopes to have a booming business in the future where she can cover all her basic necessities.

loans.use: To buy more utensils and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Moses Mukima

texts.en:
Moses is an 18-year-old single man. He has a dairy cow and has been supplying milk for one year with an income of Kshs. 2,000 a month. He want to use this loan to buy animal feed and salt in order to increase milk production.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He hopes to expand his farm by buying more dairy cows and also venturing into poultry farming. His goal is to earn enough income to improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and salt.

loans.name: James Mburu

texts.en:
James is 54 years old and married to Teresia Wangari, who is a farmer. He earns a good income using his passenger vehicle. He has been in the transport business for about 10 years and earns an income of approximately 45,000 KES a month.

This is his second loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the first. He hopes to expand his business and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To service his passenger vehicle and buy spare parts.

loans.name: Suma Amparanaca Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “Suma Amparanaca” (en lengua aymara Buenas Manos) está iniciando su primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Senkata. Cuenta con nueve integrantes.  La mesa directiva está compuesta por la presidenta, la señora Corina, por la tesorera, la señora Clotilde y como secretaria de actas Francisca. Los negocios de las señoras están relacionados con el comercio y servicio, como por ejemplo: venta de libros, kiosco surtido, venta de comida venta de ladrillos, tejidos, gimnasio, tejido de mantas.

La señora Corina, presidenta de la asociación “Suma Amparanaca”, es socia antigua, ella recuerda que solicitó su primer crédito el año 2000, luego dejó de solicitar el crédito hasta ahora que lo necesita.  La señora Corina cuenta con el negocio de tejido de mantas, inicio el negocio por iniciativa propia, para comenzar tuvo que comprar muestras y revistas.   Ahora requiere de crédito para comprar lana.  La señora Corina está casada y es madre de seis hijos.
Cuando le consultan sobre  qué es lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el grupo porque es unido y puntual.
texts.en:
The 'Suma Amparanaca' ('Good Hands' in the Aymara language) community bank is starting its first loan cycle as part of the Senkata regional office.  The group has nine members and its board is made up as follows: Corina, the president; Clotilde, the treasurer and Francisca, the secretary.  The ladies' businesses are related to commerce and services.  They include: book sales, kiosk, food sales, brick sales, knitting, gym, shawl knitting.

Corina, the group's president, is a long-standing member of our institution.  She remembers that she requested her first loan in 2000.  She then stopped requesting loans for a time but now needs one again.  Corina has a business knitting shawls.  She started her business on her own initiative.  In the beginning she had to buy patterns and magazines.  She is now requesting a loan to buy yarn.  Corina is married and has six children.

When we asked Corina what she most likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the group because it is united and punctual.

loans.use: To buy yarn

loans.name: Biyinzika Productive Group - Mpigi

texts.en:
Twenty-eight-year-old N. Gorret operates a restaurant business in Kayabwe, Mpigi. She describes herself as progressive and open-minded. Gorret is happily married with 2 kids. 

She has been engaged in this business for the past 4 years and before that, she was working as a bookshop attendant. She says the availability of customers is the underlying reason for her business' growth and why she began it. In a week, she says her profits are to the tune of 30,000 shillings. With this loan, she says she is going to buy more food, beverages, and furniture for her restaurant business.

loans.use: To purchase more food, beverages, and furniture for her restaurant

loans.name: Lucy Wanjiru

texts.en:
Lucy is 40 years old and is married to David Murigi, who contributes to the family income. She runs a greengrocer in Kabati and has been in operation for about 8 years with a monthly income of 7,000 Kenyan shillings per month.

This is her second loan with KADET after successfully repaying her previous loans well and on time. She hopes to be a leading greengrocer and give her children a quality education and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy stock of pawpaw and tomatoes.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. Carmen, tiene 47 años de edad, es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, Cñia. Isla Ybate, tiene 2 hijos que ya están en edad de ayudarlas y su marido trabaja como taxista en la ciudad de Asunción.

    Hace varios años que trabaja como vendedora ambulante, comercializa distintos productos como: huevos caseros, carne de chancho, queso, también vende productos artesanales, realiza sus recorridos en la ciudad de Asunción, cuenta con clientelas formadas.

       Agradece a la Fundación  Paraguaya y kiva por la oportunidad de préstamo que le otorga para así incrementar el nivel de su negocio y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y de la familia.
texts.en:
Carmen is 47 years old.  She is from the city of Carapeguá, Cñia.  She has two children who are old enough to help her and her husband works as a taxi driver in the city of Asunción.

Carmen has been working as a street trader for several years.  She sells a variety of products such as: home-raised eggs, pork and cheese.  She also sells handicrafts.  She sells her products in the city of Asunción and has an established customer base.
