Carmen is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for providing her with this loan which will help her to increase her level of business and thereby improve her own quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: To buy sugar, eggs, oil and cheese

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The purchase of more farming supplies like hoes

loans.name: Nyaruhanda Twimukye Group-Ibanda

texts.en: 28-year-old Gelard A. belongs to the Nyaruhanda Twimukye group-Ibanda. For the past 5 years he has sold bananas in a Mpembwe trading center market. It is a business he says he began after he got capital from his agro-produce sales. The happily married father of 2 says hard work and determination have been attributes he has constantly relied on. This business generates 220,000 shillings for him monthly, and with this loan, he is going to purchase more manure for his banana gardens.

loans.use: To purchase manure for his gardens.

loans.name: Damaso

texts.es:
El Sr. Dámaso  tiene 48 años de edad, casado y tiene 4 hijos; dos  en edad escolar y dos son  mayores de edad, vive en la ciudad de Carapeguá, compañía Espartillar.
    	 Don Dámaso  trabajó  como empleado de un Surtidor por mas de  7  años  y  de a poco  fue adquiriendo capital y así  pudo  comprar mercaderías para iniciarse como vendedor ambulante,  recorre por las ciudades  de Alto Paraná ofreciendo  y colocando  productos de primera calidad.
                 Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías (hamacas, frazadas, fajas y sábanas).Este mes tiene muchos pedidos y con un pequeño apoyo podrá satisfacer la cantidad de demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dámaso is 48 years old.  He is married and has four children: two are school age and two are grown up.  He lives in the city of Carapeguá, in the Espartillar residential development.

Dámasco used to work as an employee in a gas station for more than 7 years.  He gradually gathered together some capital and was able to buy merchandise and set himself up as an itinerant street vendor.  He sells his products on the streets of Alto Paraná, offering top quality products.

Dámaso is requesting this loan to buy merchandise (hammocks, blankets, woven belts and sheets).  This month he has a lot of orders and with a little support he will be able to satisfy his customers' demands.

loans.use: To buy bedspreads, sheets, hammocks, etc.

loans.name: Héctor

texts.es:
Héctor O. tiene 49 años de edad, oriundo de la ciudad de Roque González, está casado hace más de 23 años con  Petrona Fleitas de 50 años de edad, tienen 5 hijos, 2 en edad escolar y 3 hijos que  ya son mayores de edad, profesionales y económicamente independientes.
	La despensa que montó en su casa tiene 22 años de antigüedad ya cuenta con clientela formada, además se graduó de docente que también ejerce y cuenta con un ingreso adicional.	
Ahora desea comprar más mercaderías para aumentar su stock de mercaderías. 
En el mes de diciembre los precios suben y con esta compra va a mantener el margen del costo.
 El desea aumentar sus ingresos para seguir apoyando a sus demás hijos para que en el día de mañana sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Héctor O. is 49 years old.  He is originally from the city of Roque González.  He has been married to 50 year-old Petrona Fleitas for more than 23 years.  They have five children: two are school age and the other three are already grown up, professionals and financially independent.

The grocery store that Héctor set up in his home 22 years ago now has an established customer base.  Héctor also graduated as a teacher.  He carries out this profession too which provides him with an additional income.

Héctor would like to buy more merchandise to increase his stock.  In the month of December prices rise and with this purchase he will maintain his cost margin.  He would like to increase his income so that he continue supporting his two youngest children so that they can become good professionals.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (noodles, rice, sugar, etc.)

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Andrés, de 53 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Agustina de 40 años y sus 2 hijos menores Jonier de 11 y Yosy de 7 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo que realiza Andrés es el cultivo de cacao, café y hojas de coca, todas las mañanas junto a su esposa comienza sus días cultivando y regando sus tierras, los ánimos que posee lo ayudan mucho en esta labor, ya que es una actividad que necesita de esfuerzo físico, pero él sabe que ningún esfuerzo esta de más con tal de brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus productos, ya que siente que los meses de trabajo lo están recompensando, lleva 13 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta el mercado de la ciudad de San Francisco. Con el tiempo, desea juntar el dinero necesario y comprarse un auto, con el cual pueda transportar sus cultivos. Este es el décimo sexto crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte lo ayudará mucho en el desarrollo de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable y motivo por el cual es muy respetado por sus compañeras de grupo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono e insecticidas, ya que desea mejorar la productividad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Andrés is 53 years old.  He is a very kind and hard-working man who lives in his own home with his wife, 40 year-old Agustina, and his two dependent children: 11 year-old Jonier and 7 year-old Yosy, for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life.

Andrés grows cacao, coffee and coca leaf.  Every morning, together with his wife, he begins his day farming and irrigating his land.  The energy he has helps him a lot in his work since it is an activity that requires a lot of physical effort.  However, he knows that no effort is too much if it helps him to offer his family the best in life.  What Andrés most likes about his work is harvesting his crops since he then feels like the months of work have been rewarded.  He has been in this business for 13 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be transporting his crops to the market in the city of San Francisco.  Over time, Andrés would like to gather together the money he needs to buy a car which he would be able to use to transport his crops.

This is Andrés' tenth loan from MFP.  He knows that this support will help him a lot in making progress in his work.  He is a very responsible member of his community bank which means that he is very well respected by his fellow group members.  He will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles he is requesting to buy manure and insecticides since he would like to improve the productivity of his land.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure and insecticides

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo M. tiene 41 años de edad, oriundo de la ciudad de Acahay,  está casado  con Sra. Felicia de 38 años de edad, tienen 2 hijos, uno en edad escolar y el otro esta cursando el cuarto año de la carrera de análisis de sistema en una universidad de la zona.   
El Sr. Hugo es comerciante se dedica en la venta de electrodoméstico hace mas de 15 años, recorre  todas las ciudades en busca de clientes. Gracias a su esfuerzo y a esta actividad pudo construirse su casa propia en el centro mismo de la ciudad en un terreno que heredó de su padre.
Cabe destacar que aprovechó la ubicación de su casa y montó una librería, el cual le genera un ingreso agregado muy importante. Este crédito solicita para aprovechar la temporada, pues, como los años lectivos han culminado puede aprovechar para conseguir lotes de mercaderías mucho mas barato.
texts.en:
Hugo M. is 41 years old.  He is originally from the city of Acahay.  He is married to 38 year-old Felicia and they have two children.  One of their children is school age and the other is in the fourth year of his Systems Analysis degree at a local university.

Hugo is a salesman who has been selling electrical appliances for more than 15 years.  He goes from town to town looking for customers.  Thanks to his hard work and his business, he has been able to build his own home in the very center of the city on a plot of land that he inherited from his father.

Hugo took advantage of the location of his home and set up a book store there which generates him a very important additional income.  He will use this loan to take advantage of the season since the school year is over and he can take advantage of this fact and acquire batches of books much more cheaply.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as exercise books, paper and writing supplies in general

loans.name: Beata

texts.en: Beata is 32 years old, married, and has six children who are in between two and eleven years old. Currently, five of her children attend school. Beata owns a hair salon, which she has been doing for three years. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver. Beata will use the loan to purchase more clippers for hair. With the new profits from her expanded business, Beata plans to buy more equipment to use in the salon.

loans.use: To buy more clippers for the hairstyling/barber business.

loans.name: Berinicil

texts.es: Berinicil, de 28 años, es una mujer muy amable y sencilla, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Alberto de 39 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Con mucho esfuerzo Berinicil ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva cacao, café y hojas de coca, productos que luego lleva a vender a la ciudad de San Francisco, donde las vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Más adelante, espera mejorar sus cultivos y poder así tener mejores ingresos. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono e insecticidas, con lo cual espera mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Berinicil is 28 years old.  She is a very kind and humble woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 39 year-old Alberto, and her three beloved children, for whom she would like to provide a better quality of life.  Through a lot of hard work, Berinicil has managed to work her land and make it very productive.  She grows cacao, coffee and coca leaf.  She takes her produce to the city of San Francisco to sell wholesale.

Berinicil's crops have given her the necessary income to support her family.  This is why she wants to put all her effort into making progress in her business.  What she most likes about her work is caring for her crops.  She has been in the business for 10 years and she considers that the most difficult part of her work is transporting her produce to the market since the sacks that she must carry are very heavy and tire her out.  In the future, she hopes to improve her crops and thereby make better profits.

This is Bernicil's fourth loan with MFP.  She has been very punctual in making the repayments on her previous loans and she hopes to continue this.  Bernicil participates a lot in her community bank  and she is always up to date on the agreements that her group reaches.  She will use the 500 Peruvian soles she is requesting to buy manure and insecticides with which she hopes to improve her crops.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure and insecticides

loans.name: Linda Ethel

texts.es:
Linda es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutas”  ubicado en el distrito y  provincia de Puno, tiene 20 años de edad, de estado civil soltera y no tiene  hijos.  Linda actualmente sigue estudiando educación superior.

Trabaja  con  el  Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 2 años, su préstamo inicial fue de   S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de prendas de vestir para damas.

Linda solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  invertirá para comprar mercadería como medias, ropas interiores (lencerías).  Ella les vende a sus amistades y familiares, además cuenta con el apoyo de su mamá.

Su visión a futuro es tener un puesto fijo o una boutique donde pueda ofrecer su mercadería.
	
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Linda is a member of the 'Las Kantutas' community bank which is located in the district and province of Puno.  She is 20 years old, single and doesn't have any children.  She is currently studying in higher education.

Linda has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 2 years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her business selling ladies' clothes.

Linda is requesting a new loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles which she will invest in buying merchandise such as tights and underwear.  She sells her products to her friends and family members.  She also has her mom's support.

Linda's vision for the future is to have a fixed sales stand or a boutique where she could offer her merchandise for sale.  What she most likes about her community bank are the savings.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as tights and underwear

loans.name: Rina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Rina; ella tiene 29 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche,menestras,golosinas entre otros, la socia es una persona muy emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante, la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar mas su pequeño negocio y así poder sacar a sus hijos adelante.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rina is a member of the 'San Rafael' community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Rina is 29 years old.  She is married and has three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store business.  Rina sells essentials such as rice, sugar, milk, vegetables, candies, etc.  She is a very enterprising person with a great desire to get ahead in life.  She works together with her husband.

Rina is requesting this loan to keep her small business running so that she can get her children ahead in life.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and she pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To keep her small store running so that she can get her children ahead in life

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inicio la Sra Gladys Nerella F. domiciliada en el Barrio Niño Jesús de la Ciudad de Quiindy   distante a 20 km de la oficina de Carapeguá. 
   “Renacer”fue denominado el comité y actualmente se encuentra en la etapa decimo tercer ciclo con 20 integrantes,es un grupo de señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras,ellas se dedican diversas actividades.
     Algunas de las integrantes ya contaban con trabajo antes de formar parte del comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y se integraron para lograr mejorar su emprendimiento,otras sin embargo comienzan con su primera actividad ajena a los que se refiere su familia.
     Las mujeres Agradecen a la Fundacion Paraguaya por la iniciativa ya que mediante ella logramos desarrollar bastante nuestra capacidad de trabajo.
     Todas realizanactividades independientes,pero ayuda y esfuerzo lo realizan en forma conjunta.
El comité lo conforman mujeres muy sacrificadas que han luchado toda su vida para llevar adelante a sus familiares a pesar de los abstáculos que siempre axisten.
Se puede comentar el caso de la Sra. Crecencia  quien se dedica hace varios años a la venta de ropas, ella se levanta muy temprano a preparar su bolson  para salir a vender.
La venta lo realiza de forma ambulante  para el recorrido lo ayuda su  marido.
La Sra. Agustina agradece de manera especial a la Fundacion por que mediante el apoyo brindado por la misma pudo adquirir mas capital y asi poder agradar su negocio porque ahora cuenta con un salon comercial en su casa donde atiende sus hijas.
Solicita el prestamo para la compra de ropas para la temporada de verana.
texts.en:
This committee was set up by Gladys Nerella F. who lives in the 'Niño Jesús' neighborhood of the city of Quiindy, 20km from our Carapeguá office.  The members named the committee 'Renacer' (to be reborn).  It is currently in its thirteenth loan cycle and has twenty members.  It is a group of very responsible and hard-working ladies who work in a number of different businesses.

Some of the group's members already had work before they joined the Enterprising Women's Committee program and joined in order to improve their businesses.  Others, however, are just beginning their first business activity outside of caring for their families.

The women are grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the initiative as it has helped them to develop their capacity for work.  All the women carry out their own business activities but they also help each other and work hard as a group.  The committee is made up of very selfless women who have fought all their lives to get their families ahead in spite of the obstacles that always exist.  We could mention the case of Crecencia who has been selling clothes for several years.  She gets up very early every morning to prepare her bag of clothes so that she can go out and sell.  She makes her sales as an itinerant street vendor.  Her husband helps her in her work.  She is requesting this loan to buy clothes for the summer season.

Agustina has a special thank you for Fundación Paraguaya since, through the support they have given her, she has been able to acquire more capital and improve her business.  She now has a commercial salon in her home where her daughters work.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, shorts, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Maritza; ella tiene 38 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en un restaurante turístico la socia es cocinera hace 2 años atrás, ella trabaja todos los días menos los domingos que es su día libre esto puede variar cada mes, de esta forma la socia saca a su familia adelante con la ayuda de su pareja.

La socia solicita el préstamo para los estudios de su hija.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Maritza is a member of the 'San Rafael' community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Maritza is 38 years old and lives with her partner.  She has three daughters and works in a tourist restaurant as a cook.  She has been in this job for two years.  She works every day except Sundays which is her day off, though her day off can change each month.  Through her work, she gets her family ahead in life, with her partner's help.

Maritza is requesting this loan to pay for her daughter's studies.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's studies

loans.name: Rachana

texts.en:
This is 35 year-old Rachana M.. She is married and has 3 children aged 17, 14 and 12. In 2007, she established her vegetable farming business. Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supoorts her family. 

She has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farming.  In the future, Rachana plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Noemi Luz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Noemí; ella tiene 51 años de edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de ferretería lleva años trabajando en este negocio, la ferretería está ubicado en su misma casa, la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercadería para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Noemí is a member of the 'San Rafael' community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Noemí is 51 years old.  She is married and has four children.  She has a hardware business where she has been working for years.  It is located in her own home and she works together with her husband.

Noemí is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise for her business.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and she pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her business

loans.name: Rina

texts.es:
Rina es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutas”  ubicado en el distrito y  provincia de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, no tiene hijos.  La señorita estudió educación superior.

Trabaja con el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 05 años, su préstamo inicial fue de   S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en productos de belleza.

Con éste nuevo crédito de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, comprará más productos de belleza como labiales, colonias, talcos, etc, para  venderlos a sus amistades y familiares.

Su visión a futuro es ser directora de Unique (Empresa distribuidora de cosméticos), tener su propia empresa y tener un restaurant turístico.
	
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Rina is a member of the 'Las Kantutas' community bank which is located in the district and province of Puno.  She is 30 years old, single and doesn't have any children.  She studied in higher education.

Rina has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for five years.  Her initial loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in buying beauty products.

Rina will use this new loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy more beauty products such as lipsticks, cologne, talcum powder, etc. to sell to her friends and family members.

Rina's vision for the future is to be a manager for Unique (a cosmetics distribution company), to have her own company and to own a tourist restaurant.  What she most likes about her community bank is the ease with which she can obtain a loan.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products such as lipsticks, cologne, talcum powder etc. to sell to her friends and family members

loans.name: Sushila

texts.en:
This is 29 year-old Sushila D.. She is married and has one child, aged 4. In 2000, she established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supoorts her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy grocery goods for her business. 

In the future, Sushila plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: to buys grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.en:
Ana is a 44-year-old mother of 5 who lives with her 2 grandchildren, 3 children, and husband in San José, located in the central valley of Costa Rica. The loan consultant who has been working with Ana describes her as a responsible, hard-working entrepreneur with a fighting spirit. One year ago, Ana was diagnosed with cancer of the uterus. Since then, she has undergone 2 operations, and at the moment she is going through ovarian treatment. One of her daughters is deaf/mute; Ana and her husband have worked hard as a team in order to support all of their children.

Ana runs a sewing business out of her home. At the moment, she executes her sewing on 2 sewing machines, one that was a gift from her mother and the other Ana bought with her own funds. The main obstacle which Ana faces is a lack of access to funding for working capital. She is applying for this loan to make investments in prime sewing materials such as threads, fabrics and needles in order to produce various types of clothing, hopefully in time for the Christmas season. Ana makes all types of products including quilts, sports pants, pajamas and pillows.

Ana has been able to battle her illness and, with the support of her family, she has been able to carry on with her life after cancer. In the mornings, she takes care of domestic tasks, such as cooking and cleaning, and in the afternoons, she is dedicated to her business, sewing and making sales. Ana's long-term goals are to expand her business and earn more revenue to be able to make a more significant contribution to family income.

loans.use: For the purchase of sewing materials: fabric, needles and thread.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
La Sra. Liz G. es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, compañia Tajy Loma, ubicada a unos 7  Km. de la ciudad, tiene 21 años y vive con sus padres.
Se dedica al comercio (venta ambulante) hace más de 2 años, pues, en su casa tejen frazadas y colchas y ella aprovecha para comercializarlas. 
Actualmente cuenta con negocio propio y  realiza sus ventas por la zona de la gran Asunción. Cabe destacar que tiene un hermano mayor de edad quien es a la vez su compañero de trabajo. 
Cuenta con más de 60 clientes.
El préstamo le sirve para comprar mayor cantidad de hilos y facilitar a sus familiares para la producción y así le resulta disminuir su costo de mercaderías. También compra Sábanas, Colchas, Hamacas para colocarlas. Ella sueña con tener su propia casa y la única manera de lograr es aumentando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Liz G. lives in the Tajy Loma residential development of Carapeguá, some 7km from the city.    She is 21 years old and lives with her parents.

Liz works as an itinerant street vendor.  She has been doing this for more than two years.  In her home she also knits blankets and bedspreads which she sells.

She currently has her own business and makes her sales in the Gran Asunción area.  We should point out that she has an older brother who works with her.  Liz has more than 60 customers.

This loan will be used to buy a larger quantity of threads to give to her family members so that they can help with production.  This will reduce the cost of her merchandise.  Liz also buys sheets, bedspreads and hammocks to sell.  She dreams of owning her own home and the only way to achieve this is to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (sheets, bedspreads, hammocks, blankets and footwear)

loans.name: Gaby Alejandra

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Srta.Gabi; ella tiene 22 años de edad, soltera; La socia es egresada de la carrera de economía de la Universidad particular Andina del Cusco, la socia es una persona muy entusiasta y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y empezar a trabajar en su carrera.  

La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar su grado en la universidad y otra parte para apoyar en el negocio de sus papas que es una ferretería.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Gabi is a member of the 'San Rafael' community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Gabi is 22 years old and single.  She is studying an economics degree at the Universidad Particular Andina del Cusco.  She is a very enthusiastic person who has a great desire to get ahead in life and begin working in her profession.

Gabi will use one part of her loan to pay for her university degree and the other part to support her parents' hardware business.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and she pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To pay for her university degree and to support her parents' hardware business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Victoria; ella tiene 29 años de edad, casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia se dedica a la agricultura ella siembra maíz, papa, entre otros para luego distribuirlo a los mercados y ferias tanto de Cusco Urubamba y Ollantaytambo su chacra se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Ollantaytambo, a la vez la socia trabaja haciendo llamadas telefónicas de forma ambulatoria.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más insumos para su negocio como semillas para su chacra.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the 'San Rafael' community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Victoria is 29 years old.  She is married and has one child.  She works as a farmer and grows corn, potatoes and other crops which she then delivers to markets in Cusco, Urubamba and Ollantaytambo.  Her farm is in Ollantaytambo province.  She also works providing telephone calls in an itinerant manner.

Victoria is requesting this loan to buy more supplies for her business such as seeds for her farm.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her business such as seeds for her farm

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA LUZ DEL MAÑANA NRO II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ofelia; ella tiene 29 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda bazar de regalos, ella vende diferentes tipos de regalos como peluches, juguetes y adornos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7.00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de regalos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para el bazar de regalos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ofelia is a member of the 'NUEVA LUZ DEL MAÑANA NRO II' (New Light of Tomorrow Number II) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Ofelia is 29 years old.  She is married and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her gift store business.  She sells different types of gifts such as cuddly toys, toys and decorations.  She works from 8.00am to 7.00pm and would like to expand her business.  She is requesting this loan so that she can buy more merchandise for her gift store.

Ofelia is happy to be receiving this loan and she pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her gift store

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste is 38 years old and is married with three children between the ages 4 and 12 years old.  Theoneste owns a small cafe. Theoneste works hard in order to improve his economic situation. The hours of his business are from 7 in the morning until 6 in the evening everyday, and his cafe has been open for four years.

Theoneste has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing more beans, coffee and other foodstuffs, which can help him attract more customers. He would like to build a house and save for the future with any profits he makes.

loans.use: To purchase more food for his cafe.

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Srta. Jenny; ella tiene 24 años de edad, soltera; La socia tiene su negocio de tienda de abarrotes donde vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar leche entre otros más, la socia a la vez es estudiante de la carrera técnica de enfermería, la socia se encuentra feliz ya que le falta poco tiempo para concluir sus estudios. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar más su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Jenny is a member of the San Rafael village bank, located in the district of Cusco, which is in the province and department of Cusco.

Jenny is twenty-four and single.  She has a grocery business where she sells basic necessities like rice, sugar, milk, and other items.  Meanwhile, she is a studying for her technical nursing degree.  She's glad to be nearly done with school.

Jenny is seeking a loan so she can keep her business going.  She's happy to have the loan and promises to make all her payments.

loans.use: Jenny is seeking a loan to keep her business going.

loans.name: Anderson

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA LUZ DEL MAÑANA NRO II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Anderson; el tiene 39 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de una empresa de venta de todo tipo de maquinarias, el socio también alquila estas maquinarias, el trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de maquinarias. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar una maquinaria para trabajar en agricultura.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The client belongs to the "Nueva Luz de Mañana #2" (New Morning Light #2) village bank. The group is located in the district of Urubamba, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco. 

The client is Mr. Anderson, he is 39 years old and married with two children. He alternates his daily activities with a business selling all kinds of machinery. Anderson also rents out these machines. He works from 9am to 7pm. He would like to expand his business selling machinery, and is requesting this loan to buy a machine for working in agriculture. 

The client is happy with his loan and has committed to making his repayments on schedule.

loans.use: Buy a machine for working in agriculture

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
This is 29 year-old Laxmi M.. She is married and has 2 children aged 7 and 1. In 1996, she established her business making brass religious statues. Working 7 days a week and 6 hours a day, she supoorts her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys raw materials like bronze, wax, silver, etc., for her work. In the future, Laxmi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts. Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity. Terracotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills. Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand-tool finishing. In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone. With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume. This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing her profit margin. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business making bronze statues

loans.name: Nohemi Rosalia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA LUZ DEL MAÑANA NRO II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nohemi Rosalia; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de materiales de construcción socia vende cemento, piedras, arena y ladrillos, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de materiales de construcción. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "NEW LIGHT OF TOMORROW NRO II".  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Nohemi Rosalia.  She is 30 years old and is married with 2 children.  She combines her daily activities with the business of selling building materials.  The member sells cement, stone, sand and bricks.  She works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm, and wants to expand the business of selling building materials. The member is requesting a loan to buy construction materials.

The member is happy for the loan and agrees to comply with the repayment.

loans.use: The member wants a loan to buy building materials

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 36 years old and has three children who are between 2 and 13 years old. Rose sells new clothes, mainly pajamas. She has been in this business for about five years.

Rose will use this loan to purchase more clothing styles and upgrade her facilities. Any profits she makes from the use of this loan will be put back into the business to help it grow.

loans.use: Adding a variety of styles to her clothing store.

loans.name: Yesenia Maria

texts.es:
Yesenia E. tiene 29 años de edad, vive en la aldea el Jacalito a 8 kilometros de la carretera que conduce a Guasaule frontera de Honduras-Nicaragua. Yesenia de dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, Yesenia es una mujer muy trabajadora. su negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitacion.
Yesenia es madre de un niño que tiene 2 años, junto con su esposo trabajan duro para darle todo lo necesario a su hijo.
Todos los dias se levanta bien temprano para moler el maiz y empezar a hacer las tortillas y luego salir a venderlas.
tambien se dedica a la crianza de gallinas.
sus tiempos libres visita la iglesia y a familiares.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maiz, leña, cal y agua para la fabricar las tortillas.
texts.en: Yesenia E. is 29 years old and lives in the village of El Jacalito, about 8 kilometers from the highway that runs to Guasaule, on the border of Honduras and Nicaragua.  Yesenia is a very hard working woman who makes and sells tortillas.  Her business is located in her home.  She is the mother of a 2 year-old son, who she and her husband work hard to provide with everything he needs.  Every day, she gets up early to grind the corn and start making tortillas, and then she goes out to sell them.  She also raises chickens.  In her spare time, she goes to church or visits family.  She will use this loan to buy corn, firewood, lime, and water for making tortillas.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, firewood, and water

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jenny; ella tiene 38 años de edad, soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia tiene su negocio de comida rápida que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Limatambo el cual lo administra su hermana, la socia a la vez trabaja en una agencia de turismo como secretaria, la socia es una persona muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

 La socia solicita el préstamo para la implementación de su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This member belongs to the San Rafael communal bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

This borrower is Ms. Jenny.  She is 38 years old, single, and has one son.  She owns a fast food business located in the province of Limatambo, which her sister runs.  At the same time, Jenny works as a secretary at a travel agency.  She is a very enterprising person with a great desire to get ahead.

This borrower is requesting a loan for the implementation of her business.  She is happy to receive this loan and promises to comply with the repayment terms.

loans.use: for implementing her business

loans.name: Anisie

texts.en:
Anisie is 55 years old and married with six children between the ages of 15 and 28 years old. Anisie is well known for her business selling a variety of goods, mainly popular local beers like Primus and Amstel. She has had this business for 16 years.

Anisie has requested this loan to expand her shop by purchasing a large quantity of local beer and to help buy a house.  With this additional business, Anisie hopes that she will earn more profits to help her take care of her family and keep reinvesting for better progress in her business.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods including local beer for resale

loans.name: Efficacité Plus Group

texts.en:
Alain is a leader of the community bank named “Efficacité Plus,” which is composed of 15 microentrepreneurs united in solidarity to obtain loans from Kiva through the MFI HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses.

Alain, 30 years old, single and taking care of his younger brother, is a bread provider in his area located in the northern and most populated area of Kinshasa. In business since 2001, he makes about $35 per week through his sales. His plans are to use the next loan to diversify his business by adding a telephone booth in order to increase his income. He is a trustworthy client of the MFI Hope DRC, having received and fully repaid seven loans. He dreams of one day opening a bread facility to provide his area with loaves of bread.

loans.use: To purchase a small generator in order to increase the ouput

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Rubertina Liucadia

texts.es:
Rubertina es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutas”  ubicado en el distrito y  provincia de Puno, tiene 50 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene 04 hijos.  La señora estudió hasta 2do de educación primaria.

Trabaja  con  el  Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 02 años, su préstamo inicial fue de   S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de abarrotes.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  invertirá en su tienda de abarrotes y comprará cajas de gaseosas para venderlo en el distrito de Titiri.

Su visión a futuro es mejorar el negocio y mejorar sus ingresos..
	
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el préstamo con meses de gracia, el seguro de vida y lo que ganan sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Rubertina is a member of the "Las Kantutas" Communal Bank, located in the district and province of Puno.  She is 50 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has four children.  She studied through the second grade of primary school.

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years.  Her initial loan was for S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, which she invested in her business of selling groceries.

Ms. Rubertina is requesting a new loan in the amount of S./2000.00 nuevos soles, which she will invest in her grocery store.  She will buy cases of soft drinks to sell in the district of Titiri.

Her vision for the future is to improve her business and to increase her earnings.

The things she likes about her communal bank are that the loans have grace periods of several months, the life insurance, and what her savings earn.

loans.use: to buy cases of soft drinks and other products like rice, sugar, noodles, milk, etc.

loans.name: Cheri Mai

texts.en:
Cheri Mai M. is 50 years old, and married, with 2 children aged 18 and 15.  In 1995, she established her tailoring  business.  Working 7 days a week and 6 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to purchase raw materials for her tailoring business.  

In the future, Cheri Mai plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailoring stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal (a long tunic worn over baggy pants) and men's daura surwal, a traditional outfit.  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women.  Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.   Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to its clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.  Also, join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her tailoring work

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Valentina; ella tiene 39 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de llamadas telefónicas la cual trabaja en forma ambulatoria ya hace un par de años atrás ,siendo esta la única actividad que realiza y por este medio la socia saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar sus celulares y para algunos gastos personales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the San Rafael communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

This borrower is Ms. Valentina.  She is 39 years old, married, and has three children.  She has a phone use business, which she runs in an ambulatory manner.  She has already been doing this business for two years and it has been the means by which she has moved her family forward.

Ms. Valentina is requesting this loan to pay for cell phone minutes, as well as for some personal expenses.  She is happy to receive this loan and promises to comply with the repayment terms.

loans.use: to pay for cell phone minutes and personal expenses

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
don Luis Antonio G. tiene 41 años de edad, vive en la aldea San Geronimo, Luis es una persona emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de peliculas, musica, fajas, bolsas y protectores para celulares, peines, cepillos entre otros productos.
su negocio esta ubicado en las afueras del mercado nuevo de Choluteca, todos los dias viaja de su comunidad hacia el mercado de choluteca.
Luis es padre de 5 hijos los cuales los tiene estudiando.
trabaja muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia.
en sus tiempos libres visita a sus hermanos y demas familiares.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener mas variedad de productos que vender.
las ganancias las necesita para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis Antonio G. is 41 years old and lives in the village of San Geronimo.  He is an enterprising person who sells movies, music, belts, bags and cases for cell phones, combs, and brushes, among other items.  His business is located on the outskirts of the new market of Choluteca.  Every day he travels from his community to the market of Choluteca.

Luis is the father of five children who are all in school.  In his free time, he visits his siblings and other relatives.

He will use this loan to buy more merchandise and therefore to have a greater variety of products to sell.  He needs the income to help his children get ahead.

loans.use: to buy DVDs, CDs, movies, boxes for CDs and DVDs, belts, bags and cases for cell phones, combs, brushes, and flashlights

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es: Cirila, de 41 años, es una mujer muy amable y sencilla, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Arístides de 56 años y sus 3 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Las chacras de Cirila son de las mejores cuidadas en el poblado de Limonchayocc, todas las mañanas, trabaja desde muy temprano en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del cuidado que le brinde a su cacao, café y hojas de coca dependerán los ingresos de su familia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene para pasear por los verdes campos de su poblado, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus tierras de las plagas. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono e insecticidas para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Cirila, 41, is a very friendly and simple woman.  She lives with her husband, Arístides, who is 56 years old, and her three young children, to whom she hopes to offer a better quality of life.  Cirila's farmland is the best cared for in the village of Limonchayocc.  She starts working on her land very early every morning because she knows that her family's income is dependent upon how well she cares for her cocoa, coffee, and coca leaves.

Her favorite thing about her work is the freedom that she has to stroll through the green fields of her settlement.  She has been doing this work for 20 years and considers the most difficult part to be protecting her fields from plagues.

In time, she hopes to buy more land in order to increase her production.  This is her second loan through Microfinanzas Prisma and she hopes to be very punctual with her repayments, as she does not want to cause problems for her communal bank, which she is very content with.  She will use the requested 1,500 nuevos soles to buy fertilizer and insecticides for her crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Marcelino José

texts.es:
Este es el segundo credikiva que hace Marcelino, él quedó muy satisfecho con el resultado de su primera inversión a través de este programa, porque logró tenr un nuevo capital, reinvertir y obtener una rentabilidad del 40%, un margen de contribuciónde un 60% y la rotación de su inventarios es en la actualidad de 28 dias; aunque en la actualidad tien un capital de trabajo de $4.000.000 COP. debe prepararse para la temporada decembrina que vien con muchos requerimientos por parte de sus clientes, pues quieren proveerse de arroz, aceite, granos, enlatados y embutidos para hacer la comida de estas  hermosas fiestas famliares. Yesto es lo que justamente comprará con su nuevo credikiva.
Si quiere leer su historia ingrese al siguiente enlace:

http://kiva.org/lend/188483
texts.en:
This is the second Kiva loan that Marcelino has requested. He was very satisfied with the results of his first investment through this program as he was able to have new capital, reinvest and obtain 40% profitability, a contribution margin of 60%, and the rotation of his inventory is currently at 28 days. Although at present he has a working capital of $4.000.000 COP, he must prepare himself for December as it comes with many requirements from his customers who want to provision themselves with rice, oil, grains, canned goods, and sausages to cook meals for these great family holidays. This is precisely what he will buy with his new Kiva loan.

If you would like to read his history, visit the following link: 
http://kiva.org/lend/188483

loans.use: To buy wholesale provisions

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “OLLANTAY II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Margarita; ella tiene 55 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. tienda D. abarrotes, la socia venD. productos D. primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros, la socia atienD. desD. las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar la tienda D. abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda D. abarrotes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the "Ollantay II" communal bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is also in the province and department of Cusco.

This borrower is Ms. Margarita.  She is 55 years old, married, and has four children.  She alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business.  She sells staple items like rice, sugar, and milk, among other products.  She tends to her store from 6:00 am until 10:00 pm.  She wants to expand and improve her grocery store.  She is requesting this loan in order to buy products for her grocery store.

Ms. Margarita is happy to receive this loan and promises to comply with the repayment terms.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store

loans.name: Nelly Del Carmen

texts.es: Nelly es Barranquillera, y con dos hijos, de 8 y 5 años que mucho ama;  se dedicó desde hace ocho años a la venta de mercancía a credito , dulces y a la oferta de servicios de telecomunicaciones por minutos de contado, como una iniciativa para generar ingresos, sostener su familia  y apoyar a sus padres;  porque además  es una madre comunitaria,  que hace parte de un programa estatal a través del cual escogen a mujeres con un perfil definido para que se dediquen parte de su tiempo a cuidar, educar y alimentar a pequeños niños a cambio de un ingreso y de acceder a los servicios de salud.  Nelly es una mujer valiosa, porque  en la vida ha tenido momentos críticos,  como la separación de su esposo y esto no ha sido impedimento para lograr objetivos,  como el de su crecimiento personal y empresarial a través del emprendimiento. Su sueño ahora es tener su casa propia y lograr desarrollar un almacén bien ubicado en un local. Este es su primer  financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con su credikiva comprará ropa al por mayor,  como jeans para niños, vestidos para damas,  sandalia en mayor cantidad para desarrollar una venta importante en un momento en que   repuntan por la temporada de fin de año y de fiestas familiares. El porcentaje de utilidad  de su negocio es del 75%, y sus razones de éxito con esta inversión  son su experiencia y carisma, pero dice que principalmente es la compañía de Dios   y el sabe seleccionar a su clientela. No tiene experiencia crediticia con otras instituciones financieras, tiene siete años de experiencia con resultados positivos, visiblemente está organizado  su negocio y viene recomendado de una microempresaria que apoya la gestión de la Fundación.
texts.en: Nelly is from Barranquilla and has two children, ages eight and five years old. For the last eight years, she has worked selling merchandise on credit, selling sweets, and offering telecommunications services by the minute. She does this to create income, sustain her family, and support her parents. She is also a "community mother" who takes part in a state program that chooses women who fit a certain profile to spend part of their time caring for, educating, and nurturing small children in exchange for payment and access to health care services. Nelly is a brave woman. She has fared difficult moments in her life, such as separating from her husband, but this has not stopped her from achieving goals including personal growth and growing her business through entrepreneurship. Her dream is to have her own house and to develop a grocery store in a good location. This is her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use her credikiva to buy wholesale clothing, such as jeans for children, dresses for women, and sandals. She will buy wholesale in order to make important sales around the season of the new year and family parties. Her business has a 75% utility rate and she says that she will be successful with this loan because of her experience and charisma, but mostly because she is in the company of God, and he knows how to choose her clientele. She does not have experience borrowing from other financial institutions, but she has seven years of business experience with positive results. Her business is visibly organized and she comes to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo on the recommendation of a small businesswoman who supports the foundation's management.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing like jeans for children, dresses for women, and sandals

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es: Martha C. P. se dedica a la venta de dulces, al servicio de llamadas y a la confecciona de ropa, mejor dicho es una mujer emprendedora que tiene mucha visión de negocio. Ella en su condición de   casada y con  3 hijos en las edades de 25 y 28 años, ha logrado generar importantes ingresos para el hogar. Su gran sueño inició cuando a la edad de 15 años se vino a vivir a la ciudad de Barranquilla, en busca de mejores horizontes y al poco tiempo conoció a quien hoy es su esposo  quien es un gran pintor de autos y la persona que le aportó a demás de su apoyo emocional su primer capital para empezar a trabajar independiente después de estar tres años como empleada en diversa empresas , este es su segundo financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con ello  ha logrado incrementar su capital de trabajo y tener mas inventarios para enseñar a sus clientes. Martha posee un capital de trabajo de $840.000 COP. Su endeudamiento actual es cero (0) y su endeudamiento después  del crédito quedaría en un 7%, así como su capacidad de pago es de 93%. Su gran desafío ocurrió el año pasado cuando estaba arreglando las calles, pero ya esa situación está superada.  En la actualidad tiene 3 años de formar parte de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con este su credikiva comprará telas para confeccionar pantalones clásicos para caballeros y en la inversión de dulces y mecatos.
texts.en:
Martha C. P. sells candy, provides phone call service and makes clothes - she is an enterprising woman who has a lot of business acumen. She is married with 3 children aged 25 and 28 years, and has generated significant revenue for her household. Her big dream started when at the age of 15 she came to live in Barranquilla city in search of greener pastures, and soon met the man who is now her husband. He is a great painter of cars, and a person who provides others with emotional support.

Her first capital was to start working independently after three years employed in different companies. This is her second financing with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She has increased her working capital and added additional inventory to show her customers. Martha has a working capital of $840,000 COP.  Her current debt is zero (0) and her debt after the credit would be 7%, so her ability to pay is 93%. 

Her greatest challenge came last year when she was working on the streets, but that situation is over. Today she has been part of the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for 3 years, and with this Kiva loan she will buy fabric for making classic men's trousers and investing in candy and thread.

loans.use: Buying fabric for making classic men's trousers and investing in candy and thread

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María del Carmen M. V. de 40 años vive en el barrio Los Almendros de Soledad, se dedica a la elaboración de cuadernos al óleo y al comercio de ropa en general, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos en las edades de 20 y 4 años, Su negocio de venta de ropa funciona en un lugar ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Barranquilla desde hace 7 años , donde trabaja en compañía de su hermana, ella trae ropa desde Bogotá, ciudad capital y también le compra a confeccionistas  de los municipios aledaños como Juan de Acosta Soledad, entre otros. Sus compras las hace de contado. María del Carmen tiene también otro negocio y es el de elaborar cuadros al oleo desde hace un año  y funciona en su residencia, pero tiene distribución de puerta a puerta a través de un vendedor a quien le paga por comisión. Para la época navideña maneja unas ventas de $180.000 COP diarios con un margen de utilidad del 20% de descuento. Este, su credikiva es su tercer financiamiento a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con él comprará ropa casual, pantalones blusas y camisas elegantes. Desde que recibió su primer financiamiento con esta organización su vida ha cambiado porque complementó su subsidio de vivienda  y logró adquirirla. Su sueño ahora es adquirir el local al lado donde funciona su el comercio de ropa. Su mayor desafío es el manejo de la estacionalidad pero María ya tiene este aspecto controlado porque identifica los picos altos y bajos en sus ventas.
texts.en:
María del Carmen M. V. is 40 years old and lives in the Los Almendros de Soledad neighborhood. She dedicates herself to crafting oil paintings and also sells clothing. She is married and has two children who are 20 and 4 years old. Her clothing sales business has been located in the center of the city of Barranquilla for the past 7 years, where she works with her sister. She brings clothing from Bogota, the capital city, and also purchases clothing from tailors from neighboring municipalities like Juan de Acosta Soledad, amongst others. Her purchases are made in cash. María del Carmen also has another business; she has been crafting oil paintings for the past year in her home, but she distributes them from door to door through a salesman who she pays by commission. During the Christmas season she manages sales of 180 COP daily, with a sales markup of 20% off the discount. 

This is her third Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and with it she will buy casual clothing, pants, blouses, and elegant shirts. Since she received her first loan through this organization her life has changed because she complemented the housing subsidy she receives and was able buy her house. Her dream now is to acquire the locale next to where she has her clothing sales business. Her biggest challenge is managing the changes in seasons, however, Maria has this aspect under control because she is able to identify the peaks and lows of her sales.

loans.use: She will purchase casual clothing, pants, blouses, and elegant shirts.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es: Sala de belleza Margie es  el  negocio  de Luz Elena que lleva  siete  años de experiencia  y siete  de funcionamiento, su especialidad  es el  corte y los peinados  para damas, caballeros, niños y niñas, en toda ocasión. Su servicio es bien reconocido en el barrio el Silencio de Barranquilla y  de ahí se desprende la buena clientela con la que cuenta,  que es  de carácter fijo y ocasional. Sala de Belleza Margie, es una microempresa  que inició sus operaciones en el año 2003,  por iniciativa de su tía, cuando estaba por pensionarse y buscaba nuevos ingresos;  ella  alquiló un local con una amiga manicurista  y adquirió las herramientas básicas para empezar a trabajar. En el  año 2005  la tía  cedió su negocio a Luz Elena, para que tuviera su propia fuente de ingresos con que pagar  sus estudios  y desde allí no ha cesado, hizo remodelaciones y ha crecido; en la actualidad cuenta con dos estilistas, una manicurista y también gracias a él terminó sus estudios. Su sueño ahora se concentra en  tener su propio spa en un local propio  y está trabajando para lograr aumentar sus utilidades y más adelante poder lograrlo.  El credikiva es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  el comprará productos como champoo,  rinse gel, lacas y toallas al por mayor. El negocio  de Luz  es auto sostenible, presenta un margen de utilidad el 41%, puede solventar  todos sus gastos y tiene capacidad de pago  para afrontar compromisos futuros, así como liquidez para responder a  sus deudas a corto plazo, además de presentar una rápida rotación de sus cuentas por cobrar  e inventarios y su endeudamiento futuro no se verá afectado con el nuevo crédito.
texts.en: Margie’s Beauty Salon is Luz Elena’s business with which she has had seven years of experience and has also been in operation for seven years. Her specialty is haircuts and styling for women, men, boys, and girls for all occasions. Her service is well known in the neighborhood of Silencio de Barranquilla where she counts on great clients that are regulars and seasonal. Margie’s Beauty Salon is a microenterprise that started its operation in 2003, driven by the initiative of her aunt who was retired and looking for new income; her aunt rented a locale with a manicurist friend and she acquired the basic tools to start working.  In 2005 her aunt gave Luz Elena the business, so that she could have her own source of income to pay for her studies; since then she has not ceased, and has remolded and grown.  Currently she counts on two stylists and one manicurist, and thanks to her business she has finished her studies. Her dream now is to have her own spa in her own locale and she is working to increase her profits to be able to achieve this goal in the future. This is her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and with it she will purchase wholesale products such as shampoo, gel rinse, lacquers, and towels. Luz’ business is self sustainable, has a 41% profit margin, and she can pay all of her expenses. She has the capacity to handle future commitments, and also has the liquidity to cover her short term debt, and turn over her accounts to cover charges and inventory; her future costs will not be affected by her new loan.

loans.use: She will purchase wholesale products such as shampoo, gel rinse, lacquers, and towels

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dolores; ella tiene 45 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de llamadas telefónicas ella trabaja de forma ambulatoria por el centro de la ciudad, siendo esta la única actividad que realiza y de esta forma saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar lo equipos de celulares que adquirió.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “San Rafael”; The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is part of the Cusco province and department of Cusco.

Dolores is the bank member; she is 45 years old, lives with her partner, and has 4 children. The member has an ambulatory phone call business in the center of city; this is her only business through which she gets her family ahead in life.

The member is requesting the loan to pay for the cell phone equipment which she acquired. 

The member is happy with the loan and commits to make her scheduled payments.

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan to pay for the cell phone equipment which she acquired.

loans.name: Andrés Segundo

texts.es: Andrés Gutiérrez es un hombre de 61 años que trabaja fuertemente acompañado de su cónyuge (en la fotografía),  que es como si fuera su mano derecha en la vida y tienen 4 hijos en las edades de 15 a 24 años. Andrés inició en el año 1997 su negocio de vender gorras, bolsos, maletas, pañoletas  gafas y actualmente lo combina con el oficio de taxista,  que es otra actividad por la cual genera ingresos para el bienestar de su familia. Tanto sus hijos como su cónyuge le apoyan en su negocio y trabajan de 9.00 am a 9:00 p.m. de domingo a domingo. Con una basta clientela, después de muchos años de estar en el mismo sitio,  el negoció conforma un importante numero de compradores ocasionales y fijos, pues esta ubicado en la zona peatonal y muy comercial de uno de los centro comerciales del sur mas importantes, por lo que posee una amplia competencia, pero todos se conocen y se recomiendan, es decir cooperan los unos con los otros. Su negocio presenta una liquidez de 9,3% endeudamiento de un 9% y una rotación de inventarios de 25 días. Este es su sexto financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la que ha fortalecido su negocio mediante apalancamientos financieros, formación empresarial y asesoría por parte de su profesional de campo. El sueño familiar es tener una casa propia y lograr apoyar a sus hijos, hasta que logren la prosperidad futura, porque justamente esta es la razón por la cual trabajan unidos. Con su credikiva que es su sexto financiamiento, comprará pañoletas, gorras, bolsos provisionándose para renovar su actual inventario y vender en la mejor época del año, momento en el cual repuntan las ventas.
texts.en:
Andrés Gutiérrez, 61, works hard together with his spouse (in the photo).  It’s as if she were his right hand in life.  They have four children ranging in age from 15 to 24.

Andrés started his business in 1997 selling caps, purses, luggage, scarves, and sunglasses.  He currently combines this with being a taxi driver which is another activity that generates income for the family’s wellbeing.  His children and his spouse support him in the business and work from 9am until 9pm from Sunday through Sunday.  With a large clientele after all these years in business in the same place the business has an important number of occasional as well as regular buyers because it’s located in a very commercial pedestrian zone in one of the most important shopping areas in the south.  Because of this, he also has quite a bit of competition but everyone knows one another and recommends each other, that is, they cooperate among themselves.  His business earns 9.3% profit and has a 9% debt; his stock turns over every 25 days.

This is his 6th loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization with which he has strengthened his business through financial leverages, business training and advice from the field rep.

The family dream is to have a house of their own and to support the children until they attain future prosperity because this is precisely whey they all work together.

He will use the Kiva loan, which is his 6th loan, to buy scarves, caps and purses thereby stocking up for the best season of the year which is the moment when sales peak.

loans.use: To buy head scarves, caps and purses.

loans.name: Tuwisana Plus Group

texts.en:
Célestin K. is the president of the Community Bank named Tuwisana Plus, which is composed of 17 microentrepreneurs. These members are united by the same goal:  To grow their businesses by loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC. 

Célestin is 60 years old. His main activity is selling packages. He buys them in bulk and resells them via retail at a profit. He sells his products daily at the market in his area, west of Kinshasa.

Célestin started his business in 1990. He is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having six times obtained and repaid loans. His next loan will allow him to buy packages in larger quantities to increase his sales in order to make a better profit. Célestin makes a profit of about US $180 per week. With this increased profit, he plans to buy food and  and pay school fees for his children. He is married and the father of eight children between 11 and 31 years old. Four of them attend school. He is also responsible for another child left by his relative.

loans.use: To buying packages in larger quantities to resell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Jesus Mariano

texts.es: Jesús C. es un joven, soltero de 25 años de edad,  dedicado a la fabricación de puertas metálicas; él tiene un taller donde se fabrican puertas de metal con sus respectivos marcos, pintados y listos para instalar. Antes de iniciar este negocio tomó toda su experiencia en un taller  de soldadura,  donde ejercía la función de latonero y soldador. Con esta iniciativa sus padres lo apoyaron y le prestaron un espacio de su propia casa para que él  iniciara su propio negocio donde tuviera su empleo. Así inició Jesús su microempresa  y hace un año empezó a construir su historia crediticia con financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, ahora trabaja con un capital adicional y como el dice “mas suave” y con asesoría empresarial. Su sueño es tener más empleados y conseguir mas adelante un local más grandes para atraer nuevos clientes y estar físicamente más cómodo.  Este es su segundo crédito y con este dinero comprará materias prima como alambre de soldadura, tornillos, tuercas, accesorios y láminas metálicas; esta inversión asegura ser exitosa porque es para responder a pedidos de puertas y ventanas de buenos clientes, tiene una basta experiencia en diseñar elaborar y entregar pedidos siempre y cuando disponga de todos los materiales necesarios, por otro lado Jesús  es una persona muy responsable y el mercado de estos productos está en un corredor comercial ubicado en el centro y dirigido a  almacenes especializados,  sin tener que vender al detalle;  también porque sus precios son muy competitivos y él esta abriendo en el sur  de barranquilla un punto de venta que le permita a los clientes tener la facilidad de llegar  a comprarle, aunque  su taller  esta en un corredor vial importante muy cerca de una avenida principal en Barranquilla y ahí tien su propios clientes. Así los  indicadores financieros  del negocio de Jesús son los siguientes: Utilidad 50%, capital de trabajo $ 1.620.000 COP, endeudamiento 16%, rotación de cuentas por cobrar 30 días. Jesús es un joven soñador y muy seguramente tendrá consolidado y posicionado su microempresa con sucursales de venta, tal como es su gran sueño.
texts.en:
Jesús C. is 25 years old and single.  His business is making metal doors.  He has a workshop where he makes his doors, together with frames, painted and ready to install.  Before setting up this business, he gained experience in a welding workshop, where he worked as a brazier and welder.

Jesús' parents supported him in his initiative and provided him with a space in their own home so that he could start his own business.  Jesús started his small business and a year ago he started to build a credit history with loans through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  Now he works with additional capital which is, as he says, 'softer', and with business advice.  His dream is to have more employees and, in the future, to obtain larger premises so that he can attract new customers and be physically more comfortable.

This is Jesús' second loan and he will use the money to buy raw materials such as solder wire, bolts, nuts, accessories and metal sheets.  This investment will be successful because he needs these materials to fill orders for doors and windows from good customers.  Jesús has quite a lot of experience in designing, making and delivering orders, whenever he has the material he needs.  Jesús is a responsible person. The market for these products is a commercial corridor located in the city center and aimed at specialized warehouses.  He does not have to sell retail.   Jesús' prices are very competitive and he is opening a sales point in the south of Barranquilla which allows his customers to buy from him easily.  However, his workshop is on an important highway corridor which is very close to a main avenue in Barranquilla and this is where he has his own customers.  

The financial indicators for Jesús' business are as follows: profits 50%, working capital 1,620,000 Colombian pesos, debt 16%, accounts receivable turnover - 30 days.  Jesús is a young man with dreams and it is certain that he will consolidate and position his small business with sales branches as is his dream.
