loans.use: Compra de materias primas, láminas metalicas, tornillos tuercas y soldaduras

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “OLLANTAY II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ofelia; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad como arriz, azúcar, aceite y leche, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes que atiende desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This client belongs to the "Ollantay II" Village Bank, located in the distric, province and department of Cusco. 

The client is Mrs. Ofelia. She is 33 years old and single, with one child. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling basic grocery items like rice, sugar, and milk for her small grocery store, which she runs from 7am to 7pm. She would like to expand her business selling basic goods, and is requesting this loan to buy products like rice, sugar, milk and oil in bulk. 

She is happy with this loan and has committed to making her repayments on time.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, milk and oil in bulk

loans.name: 16 De Julio Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento 16 D. julio es un grupo que se encuentra en su 5ta secuencia esta conformado por 10  socias, la mayoría vive en la zona kupini en casa D. la Sra. Carmen se realizan las reuniones. Doña Carmen es la que ocupa el cargo D. tesorera, ella venD. comida en la zona  pero su principal actividad es la administración D. su taxi del cual percibe renta diaria, el esposo es albañil y ambos crían a su nieta quien es huérfana D. madre,  ambos viven en alquiler 20 años en el mismo domicilio con el dinero del crédito comprara insumos para la elaboración D. sus platos. La presidentes es la  señora Guadalupe  que confecciona delantales, mandiles y va a vender a los mercado, le hace en pedidos y ella va a entregar a distintos puestos del mercado, ella vive en casa propia con sus 4 hijos  el mayor es el que le ayuda con los gastos D. la casa trabaja en la alcaldía como empleado la señora es bastante trabajadora  y responsable, con el dinero del crédito comprara telas e hilos para confeccionar sus mandiles, todos las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que desean sacar a su familia adelante, están muy agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The Banco D. Emprendimiento 16th of July is a group in it's 5th loan cycle that is maD. up of 10 women, the majority of whom live in the Kupini zone.  The community bank meetings are held in Doña Carmen's house. Doña Carmen is the treasurer of the group, and she sells food in her community.  Her principal economic activity, however, is the administration of her taxi, which she rents out on a daily basis.  Her husband is a bricklayer and together they are raising their grandchild who is an orphan.  Both of them live in a rented home where they have lived for 20 years.  With the loan funds they will purchase supplies to make their plates.

The president of the group is Señora Guadalupe who makes aprons and sells them in the market.  She takes orders and delivers them to stalls in the market.  She lives in her own house with four children, the oldest of whom works at the city hall and and helps her with household expenses.  Señora Guadalupe is very hard working and responsible, with her loan funds she will purchase fabrics and strings to make aprons.  Each of the women in the group is personally responsible and hard working.  They are committed to improving their families' quality of life, and they are grateful for the help provided by the institution.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and string

loans.name: Dus Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Dus Maiya M., a resident of Thecho, lives with her husband and two children. Her daughter and son are studying in grades 7 and 4, respectively. 

Mrs. Dus Maiya M. and her husband, Mr. Nucha M., are both engaged in idol-making. They make different types of traditional gods' idols, according to the demands of their customers.  In their area, the demand for idols is increasing, and to meet the demand, they need to invest  in their business.  Due to lack of funds, they have been unable to meet the demands of their customers. Mrs. M. is requesting a loan of Rs 20000.00 to buy raw materials such as wax, silver and bronze for their business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her business

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es: Claudio, de 54 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Faustina de 47 años y sus 2 menores hijos Linder de 27 y Guido de 22 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Cuando era niño, los padres de Claudio le enseñaron todo lo que debía saber de la chacra y poco a poco a medida que pasaba el tiempo, él se fue encargando de las tierras de sus padres. Ahora tiene extensas tierras de cultivo, en las cuales cosecha café, cacao y hojas de coca, para luego venderlos en el mercado de la ciudad de San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que es la actividad que le da de comer a su familia, lleva 35 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es cuidar sus productos de las plagas. Desea con muchas ganas, comprarse un carro, con el cual pueda transportar sus productos. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es un socio muy solidario con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Claudio is 54 and a very friendly and hardworking man.  He lives in his own house with his wife, Faustina, 47, and their two youngest children; Linder, 27, and Guido, 22, to whom they wish to bring a better quality of life.  When he was a boy, Claudio's parents taught him everything he needed to know about farming, and little by little, over time, he took charge of his parents' fields.  Now he has vast crop fields where he harvests coffee, cacao, and coca leaves to sell at the San Francisco city market.  

What Claudio likes best about his job is cultivating his fields because that's what feeds the family.  He's been doing this for 35 years and finds that the hardest part is protecting the crops from pests.  He would very much like to buy a car to transport his products.  This will be his sixth loan with MFP; he has always been very punctual with his payments and hope to be with this one, too.  In his village bank he is very supportive of the rest of the members.  He plans to use his 3000 soles to buy more fertilizer to improve his crops.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Juana Nelly

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “OLLANTAY II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana Nelly; ella tiene 46 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de artesanía, la socia vende artesanía al por mayor y distribuye a diferentes tiendas de artesanía, la socia vende chompas, collares, chalinas y aretes, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Juana Nelly belongs to the OLLANTAY II community bank located in the district of Cusco, Peru. She is 46 years old, single and has three children. She alternates her daily activities with her crafts business, buying the items at wholesale and distributing them to different crafts shops, and also selling jackets, necklaces, scarves and earrings. Juana wants to expand her crafts business. She is requesting the loan to purchase crafts at wholesale. Juana is happy for the loan and promises to fulfill her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase handicrafts at wholesale

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
doña Olga Z. tiene 49 años de edad vive en namasigue Choluteca y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion.
Olga es una mujer emprendedora y muy dedicada a su negocio.
nos comento que su familia es lo mas importante para ella, es madre de 5 hijos.
junto con su esposo trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
todos los dias se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para alistar a sus hijos y luego para abrir su pulperia y atender a sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria, desea tener bien surtido su negocio para la navidad.
texts.en: Olga Z. is 49 years old and lives in Coluteca. She makes a living selling popular products at a convenience store she runs out of her home. Olga is an enterprising woman who is very dedicated to her business. She tells us that her family is the most important thing to her. She is a mother of five children. She and her husband work very hard to make headway for their children. She gets up every day at 5 a.m. to tend to her children and then opens up her store and tends to her customers. She plans to use the loan to purchase grocery items. She wants to have a well-stocked store for Christmas.

loans.use: Purchase chickens, pork, beef, rice, beans, coffee, bread, cookies, lard, oil, butter, soup, toilet paper, toothpaste, candles, matches, condiments, soap, churros

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Tari Mai

texts.en:
Tari mai M.  is 34 years old, and married, with a 5-year-old child.  In 2000, she established her religious statue-making business.  Working 7 days a week and 6 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW.  Tari mai used her most recent loan to buy raw materials such as bronze, wax and silver for her work.  In the future, Tari mai plans to improve the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.   

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts.  Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity.  Terra cotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills.  Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand tool finishing.  

In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone.  With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume.  This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing her profit margin.  

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.  Also, join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her business

loans.name: Juana Esther

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “OLLANTAY II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana Nelly; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche y productos de primera necesidad, la socia atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite y fideos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Juana Esther belongs to the OLLANTAY II community bank in Cuscuo, Peru. She is 36 years old, single and has two children. She has a business selling rice, sugar, oil, milk and other products of primary necessity. She tends to her store from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. She wants to expand her business to sell more primary-need products. She is requesting the loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk, oil and noodles. Juana is happy for the loan and promises to fulfill her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, milk, oil and noodles

loans.name: Adonai Plus Group

texts.en:
Mbuyi T. is the president of the community bank Adonai Plus, which is composed of 12 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Mbuyi, who is 25 years old and single, runs a telephone booth in his area located west of Kinshasa. He began his business in 2007. His beginning capital was $10. With hard work and determination, his business has prospered. Mbuyi is now well known and liked in this area. He has already received six  MFI HOPE DRC loans and fully repaid them. Since that time his business has prospered, and the loans he has received have helped him rent a well-located businessplace. He makes $60 profit each week. With his next loan, Mbuyi intends to purchase more prepaid cards to meet the customer demand and generate additional profits. His ambition is to open a cellular phone shop in his area.

loans.use: To buy more prepaid phone cards to meet customer demand

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Kantutas Group

texts.es: La Sra. Cinthia es la líder del grupo vive en la zona D. San Jacinto,  su casa esta en construcción  , tiene dos hijos  estudiantes , ella venD. chicharrón los fines D. semana, es muy conocida en la zona por su riquísimo chicharrón , con el dinero del crédito comprara material D. construcción para así poder hacer terminar su casita, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado, el grupo esta formado por vecinas y amigas D. muchos años que desean sacar a su familia adelante y así poder mejorar la calidad D. vida D. toda su familia.
texts.en: Cinthia is the leader of this group.  She lives in San Jacinto neighborhood.  Her house is in the process of being built and she has two children who are studying.  She sells 'chicharrón' (fried pork rinds) on weekends.  She is very well known in her area for her delicious 'chicharrón'.  She will use her loan money to buy building material so that she can finish her house.  She is a very hard-working and responsible person and is grateful to the institution for the support they have provided.  The group's members have all been neighbors and friends for many years and they all want to get their families ahead in life and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To buy building material

loans.name: Progresando Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PROGRESANDO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sabina; ella tiene 53 años D. edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica al negocio D. taller D. bordados D. imágenes, ella borda diferentes imágenes para los diferentes santos y también para las diferentes fiestas que existe en la ciudad D. Cusco, la socia lo realiza por pedido, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el taller D. bordados. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como hilos y telas.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la crianza D. cuyes, para la futura venta, venta D. pasto D. manera ambulatoria,  dos socias son cosmetologas, otra D. ellas tiene un snack cafetería y otro socio una carpintería. Todos los socios reinvertirán en sus negocios, como parte D. capital D. trabajo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota D. manera responsable.
texts.en:
These people belong to the 'Progresando' (Making Progress) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Sabina is 53 years old.  She lives with her partner and has two children.  Her business is a workshop where she embroiders pictures.  She embroiders images of different saints and also embroiders images for the different fiestas in the city of Cusco.  She does her work to order and would like to expand and improve her workshop.  She is requesting this loan to buy materials such as threads and fabrics.

The other members of the group work raising guinea pigs to sell, selling fodder as an itinerant salesperson, two of the members are cosmetologists, another has a café / snack bar and another is a carpenter.  All the group's members will reinvest in their businesses as working capital. 

Sabina is grateful for the loan and she pledges to make her repayments responsibly.

loans.use: To buy materials such as threads and fabrics

loans.name: Porfirio Hugo

texts.es: El señor Porfirio  es un cliente que se dedica a transporte publico, el mencionado cliente es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable con sus pagos ya que estos siempre han sido puntuales, es casado con dos hijos que están en la universidad, el Sr. Porfirio necesita de ingresos para mejorar sus condiciones de vida de su familia es por esa razón que ingresa al proyecto de créditos kiva,   El crédito será invertido en la  compra de un motor para su movilidad, que le ofrecieron por ocasión, ya que es una oportunidad para cambiar el motor de su vehículo ya que le esta presentando algunas fallas, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Porfirio works in public transportation.  He is a very hard-working person who is responsible in his loan repayments as they have always been paid on time.  He is married and has two children who are at university.  Porfirio needs income to improve his family's living conditions.  This is why he has enrolled in the Kiva loan project.  His loan will be invested in buying a second-hand engine for his vehicle.  He needs to change his vehicle's engine since it is not working properly.  He is grateful to the institution for the support they have provided.

loans.use: To invest in buying a second-hand engine

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina, de 54 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Prudencio de 45 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Frene de 23 y Jhon de 19 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Los arduos días de trabajo que Delfina tiene en su chacra, le han servido para mejorar sus cultivos y hacer más productivas sus tierras, junto al mayor de sus hijos trabaja desde muy temprano por la mañana, cultivando cacao, café y hojas de coca, productos que posteriormente llevará a vender al mercado de la ciudad de San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y ver como sus cultivos van creciendo, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, ya que los químicos que utiliza para eliminar a las plaga de insectos, son altamente dañinos para su salud. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras y así ampliar la cantidad de su producción. Este es el décimo tercer crédito con MFP, en su primer crédito fue muy puntual con el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una social muy alegre, motivo por el cual es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Delfina is 54 years old and a very cheerful and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own home together with her husband, 45 year-old Prudencio, and her two beloved children: 23 year-old Frene and 19 year-old Jhon, for whom she would like to provide a better quality of life.

The hard days that Delfina spends working on her farm have helped her to improve her crops and make her land more productive.  She works with her eldest son from very early each morning growing cacao, coffee and coca leaf.  She then takes her crops to sell in the market in San Francisco.  What Delfina most likes about her work is sowing her crops and watching them grow.  She has been in this business for 30 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be spraying her land since the chemicals that she uses to get rid of insect infestations are very harmful for her health.

Over time, Delfina hopes to buy more land and thereby expand her production.  This is her thirteenth loan with MFP.  She was very punctual in making the repayments on her first loan and she hopes to continue this.  Delfina is a very cheerful member of her community bank which means that she is well liked by her fellow members.  She will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles she is requesting to buy more manure to improve her crops.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure

loans.name: Yuriy

texts.en:
Yuriy is married. He sells agriculture products in the small markets neighboring his town. Yuriy uses his van to get to the markets and sells the produce right off the van. The net profit is 5,000 Grivnas per month.

Yuriy started this business 10 years ago. His persistence and hard work have helped Yuriy succeed and overcome competition. He has repeat clients who buy food from him every week. So when Yuriy goes to a market, people are waiting for him right there. 

Yuriy would like to borrow 10,000 Grivnas to increase his assortment of products. His business goal is to open a bulk food store, providing for small business owners like him, good quality food they can bring to their clients.

loans.use: To increase his assortment of products

loans.name: Dios Ante Todo 1, 2, 3 Group

texts.en:
Sadley is the coordinator of her group, Dios Ante Todo 1, 2 & 3 (God first), located in a village where most of the citizen are Haitians. She lives in a modest home with her five children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to work hard because she needs to give her children what they need. With this effort, she can make extra income and help her long-term partner. In the meantime, she will enjoy to eat and rest.

Sadley is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for three years, starting with some capital she saved by working after she came from Haiti. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying clothing, in different size, and for men, women and kids. She will re-invest the profits in her business because this is high season for sales. She dreams of having her own house and return to Haiti.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she invested in her business and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and the tourist industry dominate the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

The woman with face pic in the right corner is one of the member, she was absent at the time the group photo was taken.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Jose Aurelio

texts.es:
Don José Aurelio, tiene 43 años de edad, reside en San Carlos departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la albañilería, construcción y mejoramiento de viviendas, así como también servicio de instalación de energía eléctrica, él vive con su esposa y sus hijos: Estela Patricia de 17 años, Nilson Javier de 15, Tania Maritza de 10 años de edad.
Don José tiene más de 16 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, su horario de trabajo es de 6:00am a 3:00pm, aprendió esta labor de su padre. Hoy don José solicita un préstamo para la construcción de un cuarto para el cual necesita comprar bloques, hierro, lamina, cemento, arena y piedra, con esta ayuda podrá construir y ampliar la casa ya que contaran con una nueva habitación.
Su propósito es cancelar puntualmente el préstamo, dar a sus hijos el estudio necesario para que se superen, y terminar completamente la construcción de la casa.
texts.en:
José Aurelio is 43 years old.  He lives in San Carlos, in Morazán department.  He works as a builder, building and improving houses.  He also installs electricity services.  He lives with his wife and children: 17 year-old Estela Patricia, 15 year-old Nilson Javier and 10 year-old Tania Maritza.

José has been in this business for more than 16 years and learned the trade from his father.  He works from 6.00am to 3.00pm.  José is currently requesting a loan to build a room.  He needs to buy blocks, iron, metal sheeting, cement, sand and stone.  With this help, he will be able to build and expand his house with a new room.  His goal is to pay off his loan on time, provide his children with the education they need to get ahead and to finish building his house.

loans.use: To buy blocks, iron, metal sheeting, cement, sand and stone

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio, de 54 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Dolores de 47 años y sus 2 menores hijos Bertha de 20 y Cristian de 10 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. En la provincia de La Mar - Ayacucho, se encuentran las chacras de Julio, sus tierras son amplias y con los cuidados que les brinda las ha convertido en uno de los cultivos mejores trabajados del poblado, es por eso que cuando lleva a vender los granos de café, el cacao y la hoja de coca a la ciudad de San Francisco, obtiene muy buenos precios debido a la buena calidad de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles, lleva 32 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plagas que pueden afectarlos. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras en otros poblados para así aumentar su producción y variar sus cultivos. Este es el décimo sexto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable y siempre esta pendiente de los acuerdos a los que llegan en el grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras.
texts.en: Julio is 54 years old and is a very friendly and hard-working man. He lives in his own home with his wife Dolores, 47, and their two children, Bertha, 20, and Christian, 10, for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life. Julio's farmland is located in the province of La Mar-Ayacucho, Peru. His lands are expansive and the care he provides has made them one of the best crops in the area. It's for this reason that when he goes to sell his coffee, cocoa and cocoa leaves in the city of San Francisco he obtains very good prices due to the quality of the products. What he enjoys most about his work is sowing his lands and making them fertile. He has been doing this activity of 32 years and considers the most difficult task to be keeping his crops safe from plagues. With time, he wants to purchase more lands in other areas so he can increase his products and add more variety of products. This is his 16th loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he knows that he has to pay on time if he wants to be granted more loans in the future. He is a very responsible member of his community bank and is always aware of the agreements the group reaches. With the 1,000 soles he is requesting, he plans to purchase more manure and fertilizers to improve his land.

loans.use: Purchase manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutas”  ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 03 hijos.  La señora estudió educación superior.

Trabaja hace 08 años con  el  Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos, su préstamo inicial fue de   S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.  Ella se dedica a la venta de artículos artesanales, paralelamente tiene otro negocio, ella brinda servicios de internet y locutorio.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  aumentará a su capital para comprar una fotocopiadora y frutas para implementar su negocio de internet.  En este negocio participan sus hijos.

Su visión a futuro es poner otro internet y tener una tienda de comidas rápidas.
	
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad de préstamo con meses de gracia y el préstamo de la cuenta interna.
texts.en: Sabina is a member of "Las Kantutas" Community Bank in the district and province of Puno, Peru. She is 42 years old, married and has three children. She has a higher education. Sabina has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for eight years, and she used her initial loan of 300 soles to start her business. She makes a living selling crafts, which she does along with another business providing telephone and Internet services. She is requesting a new loan of 700 soles, which she plans to use to purchase a photocopier and fruits for her Internet business. Her children help her with the business. Her vision for the future is to have another Internet shop as well as have a food food stand. What she likes about her community bank is the easy of getting a loan with grace periods and internal accounts.

loans.use: Increase capital to purchase a photocopier and fruits to implement her Internet business

loans.name: Las Talentosas Group

texts.es: El señor Rómulo de 63 años de edad es presidente de la alcancía comunal “Las Talentosas.”  Es casado y tiene 8 hijos, todos son mayores de edad pero 3 de ellos viven con él.  Se dedica a la crianza de abejas (apicultura) desde hace 20 años, dichas abejas producen 25 litros de miel y pueden producir hasta el doble de esta cantidad en un año.  La miel es vendida a sus clientes fijos, él solicitó el préstamo a EDAPROSPO para comprar materiales (madera, clavos, rejillas, etc.) para construir una trampa caza polen también desea comprar un par de reinas más (abejas)para aumentar la producción de miel.
texts.en: Mr. Romulo is 63-years-old and is president of the communal group "The Talented.".  He is married and has 8 children who all are adults, but 3 of them live with him. He is dedicated to beekeeping (apiculture) for the past 20 years.  The bees produce 25 liters of honey and can produce up to twice that amount in one year. The honey is sold to regular customers.  He sought a loan from EDAPROSPO  to buy materials (wood, nails, vents, etc.) to build a pollen trap and also wants to buy another pair of queens (bees) to increase honey production.

loans.use: Materials to raise honey bees

loans.name: Rodolfo Antonio

texts.es:
Don Rodolfo, de 62 años de edad, es un señor muy trabajador y carismático, vive en San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel con su esposa y sus hijos de 10 y 2 años de edad, posee una panadería la cual atiende con su familia, este negocio nació hace 30 años y era su esposa quien lo comenzó a administrar, hoy día don Rodolfo se encarga de la administración.
Él está solicitando un préstamo pues quiere comprar un cilindro para elaborar pan francés,  dicho crédito ayudara a que él pueda adquirir esta herramienta útil para la preparación de pan, además estará dando un paso más en el desarrollo del negocio.
Su objetivo es trabajar cada día por la superación de su familia y por el desarrollo del negocio volviéndolo algún día un empresario exitoso.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is 62 years old.  He is a very hard-working and charismatic gentleman who lives in San Miguel, in San Miguel department with his wife and his children aged 10 and 2.  He owns a bakery where he works with his family.  The business was born 30 years ago and it was his wife who started running it.  Currently Rodolfo is in charge of running the business.

Rodolfo is requesting a loan because he would like to buy a cylinder for baking French bread.  This loan will help him to acquire this tool which is useful for preparing bread.  He will also be taking a step further in making progress in his business.

Rodolfo's goal is to work every day to get his family ahead and to make progress in his business, becoming a successful businessman some day.

loans.use: To buy a cylinder for making bread

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: Magdalena, de 34 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo David de 54 años y su querida hija Aliza de 5 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La actividad a la que Magdalena se dedica es el cultivo de caco, café y hojas de coca. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana, comienza con el cuidado de sus chacras, ya que sabe que mientras más cuidadosa sea con sus cultivos, mejores productos obtendrá el momento de la cosecha. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucha paciencia, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta el mercado de la ciudad de San Francisco, que es donde vende sus productos. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras, para aumentar sus cultivos. Este es séptimo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas si quiere acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetada por sus compañeras. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos, también comprará insecticidas.
texts.en: Magdalena, age 34, is a kind and hardworking woman who lives in a rented house with her husband David, age 54, and her beloved daughter Aliza, age 5, both of whom are the reason for all of her efforts. Magdalena grows cacao, coffee, and coca leaves for a living. She starts caring for her crops in the early morning hours every day, knowing that the more meticulous she is with her crops, the better her harvest will be. What she likes most about her job is planting the seeds, which she does with much patience. She has been in agriculture for 10 years, and she considers the most difficult thing to be transporting her goods to the market in the city of San Francisco, where she sells her products. In time, she hopes to purchase more crop fields so that she can increase production. This is her seventh loan with MFP, and she knows that she needs to be punctual with her payments if she wants to obtain more loans in the future. In her communal bank, she is a very responsible member, which is why she is respected by her fellow group members. With the 2,500.00 PEN that she is requesting, she will purchase pesticides, and chemical and organic fertilizers for her crops.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia Pérez S. vive en la comunidad de Tlayecac, Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México, ella tiene 40 años de edad, estudio hasta el 6º. Grado de primaria tiene su certificado, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos de ella con su esposo y 1 hija adoptiva que es hija de su esposo, sus hijos son Jorge de 11 años de edad está estudiando la primaria, Esli de 6 años de edad está estudiando la primaria, Gabriel tiene 3 años y su hija adoptiva Azucena de 17 años de edad es casada y tiene un niño.
La señora Antonia tiene su taller de costura y solicitó su préstamo para invertir en el taller en materia prima va a comprar hilos, ahujas, aceite, cierres, resorte, refacciones, deshiladores, tijeras, tela, encaje, listón, ella ofrece a sus clientes mandiles de 4 modelos diferentes, los fabrica, los vende y a veces maquila pans, uniformes para la primaria, uniformes deportivos de básquet bol, también tiene servicio de serigrafía y estampados, elabora servilletas para quince años, bautizos, 3 años, primera comunión, ella inicio su negocio hace 11 años, primero estuvo trabajando de empleada en un taller de costura elaboraba artículos para bebé como pañaleras, velo para cunas, forros para portabebés, estos productor eran para Liverpool.
El lugar donde tiene su taller se lo heredo su papá un espacio de 50 metros cuadrados, la fincada lo fue construyendo con los préstamos y las maquinas industriales y de serigrafía las compró con su liquidación que le dieron en el taller de costura donde trabajaba, su negocio se localiza en su casa en Tlayecac, la señora Antonia participó en un concurso estatal de costura donde participaron de varios lugares fueron 31 participantes y se ganó el primer lugar con su premio se compró 2 maquinas industriales.  Su negocio es importante y especial porque de ahí se sostiene económicamente, se mantiene, es una fuente de trabajo para su familia ya que su esposo sale a vender los mandiles que la señora Antonia fabrica y su hija adoptiva también trabaja con ella y se siente orgullosa de elaborar sus mandiles, ella comenzó con 8 mandiles de plástico que se utilizan para lavar y no se mojen. Los elaboró con trozos de plástico que eran desperdicios que la señora donde trabajaba le regaló y su esposo salió a venderlos y los termino muy rápido, con lo que obtuvo de la venta compró mas plástico y fueron creciendo sus clientes, sus clientes son varios. 
Ella fabrica mandiles por mayoreo a las tortillerías, las carnicerías, los taqueros. Los desafíos que enfrenta el negocio son el clima entra ya que el polvo entra al taller, pues no está terminado aún y sus telas se le ensucian, también le falta la herrería, la puerta, los vidrios. 
Las ganancias del negocio las vuelve a invertir, para la alimentación, para pagar el préstamo, para los gastos de la casa, ella está planeando ampliar su taller quiere comprar una maquina bordadora computarizada y una maquina ojaleadora y lo piensa logara ahorrando y con el préstamo va a completar, las mejorías que desea hacer a su vivienda son la herrería del taller, en el segundo piso: repellar, poner los vidrio, azulejo al baño para ampliar el taller.
A veces les da trabajo a más personas en el mes de diciembre pues es una temporada en la que ella vende mas.
Ella sueña con un taller completo y dar empleo a más personas, ella está muy emocionada con este préstamo que le proporcionan porque si lo sabe administrar le va mejor.
Las metas que tiene son lograr que hijos estudien una carrera u oficio y si les gusta la costura les va a enseñar su oficio de costura. A ella le gusta Tlayecac porque ahí nació y creció, la gente es muy tranquila, en tiempo de lluvias el cerro reverdece, la barranca crece y la vegetación crece hay pipiscas, hongos y se puede ir al campo a la tranquilidad. Ella quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “Gracias por el préstamo que me dan porque  por medio de este voy a ampliar mi negocio, trabajo en mi casa y estoy empleada y he podido atender a mis hijos en mi propio negocio, muchas gracias.”
texts.en:
Señora Antonia Pérez S. lives in the community of Tlayecac, Ayala, in Morelos state in Mexico.  She is 40 years old, she studies until the 6th grade, she is married and has 3 kids that are her own and 1 adopted kid. Her children are named Jorge, Esli and Gabriel. Jorge is 11 years old,  Esli is 6 years old and Gabriel is 3 years old. Jorge and Esli are  both currently in elementary school. Antonia's adopted daughter, Azucena, is 17 years old, is married and has a son.

Señora Antonia has a sewing workshop and requests the loan to invest in raw materials for the workshop.  She will buy yarn, needles, oil, closures, springs, parts, fringe, scissors, fabric, lace, ribbon.  She offers her customers aprons in 4 different styles which she makes and sells.  She sometimes makes uniforms for the elementary school and sports uniforms for basketball.  She also has silk screen and printing services.  She prepares napkins for quinceañeros (girls' 15th birthday parties), baptisms, and first communions.  She started her business 11 years ago, before which she used to work in a sewing workshop making decorative baby items, like diaper bags, crib veils, and linings for baby carriers, which were produced for Liverpool department store.  She inherited a small space of 50 square meters from her father, which is where she has her workshop.  She started with loans and the industrial machines and silk-screen printing were bought from the liquidation of the sewing workshop where she had worked.   Her business is located at her home in Tlayecac.  Señora Antonia participated in a statewide sewing contest where there were 31 participants from several places.  She won first prize, and with it bought 2 industrial machines. 

Her business is important and special as she is able to sustain herself financially.  It is a source of work for her family as her husband sells the aprons that Antonia manufactures, and her adopted daughter also works with her.  She is proud to make the aprons. She started with 8 plastic aprons that could be used for doing the washing without getting wet.  She made these with pieces of left-over plastic that the lady where she worked gave her.  Her husband went to sell them, and they wound up going very fast.  With what she made from the sale she bought more plastic and was able to grow her customers.  Her customers are varied, and she makes aprons in bulk for the tortilla makers, the butchers, the taco makers. 

A challenge facing the business is the climate, as dust enters because the workshop is not finished.   It lacks ironwork, a door, and glass in the windows. The business profits are reinvested, used for food, for repaying the loan and for household expenses. She is planning to expand her workshop.  She wants to buy a computerized embroidery machine and a machine for making buttonholes, and she thinks that with saving and the loan she will be  able to complete this.  The improvements she wants to make to her home are ironwork for her workshop, plastering and putting in glass on the second floor, and tiling the bathroom to expand the workshop.  She sometimes employs more people in the month of December, when she has more work.  She dreams of a having a full workshop and employing more people.  She is very excited about this loan that will be provided, because if she knows how to manage it things will go better for her and she can grow her workshop.  What she wants for the future of her children is that they consider a career or job, and if they like sewing, she will teach them her craft. 

She likes Tlayecac because it was where she was born and raised and the people are very pleasant.  During the rainy season the hill becomes green and the gully grows vegetation.  There are small birds and fungi, and you can go to the countryside for some peace and quiet. 

She wants to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad, "Thank you for giving me the loan because through this I will expand my business, work in my home and be employed.  I can tend to my children with my own business  Thank you very much."

loans.use: Buying raw materials, yarn, needles, oil, closures, springs, parts, fringes, scissors, fabric, lace, ribbon

loans.name: Sonnia Estefania

texts.es:
Sonnia de 22 años, por la falta de oportunidad en distintos lugares que ha ido a buscar trabajo ella decidió ser comerciante de ropa porque así pasaba más tiempo con sus dos hijos de 6 y 4 años. Vende ropa desde hace años para poder ayudar con los gastos de su casa. Vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas). 

Realiza su trabajo sola desde muy temprano, aunque no tienen muchos ingresos ella sigue trabajan ya que es madre soltera y quiere darle una buen vida a sus hijos, vende blusas, camisas, pantalones. No tiene horario fijo porque vende la ropa recorriendo las calles de tierra. Una de las dificultades que tiene son las caminatas que tiene que dar para poder llegar a las casas ya que la zona donde vive hay lomas muy empinadas. 

Ella quiere el préstamo para poder comprar ropa y con las ganancias asegurar la situación económica de su hijo. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa ya que ahora es de caña y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
Sonnia, 22, by the lack of opportunity at various places went looking for work.  She decided to become a clothing trader because she could spend more time with her two children, ages 6 and 4.  She has been selling clothes for years to help with household expenses.  She lives in the Fortín de Guayaquil (a semi-suburban area with dirt roads and hills).

She does her work alone very early,  Even though they don't have much income, she continues working since she is a single mother.and wants to give her children a good life.  She sells blouses, shirts, and pants.  She doesn't have a fixed schedule because she sells clothes on the street.  One of the difficulties that she has are the walks to reach the houses because that area has very steep hills.

She is requesting a loan to be able to buy clothes so that the earnings will ensure economic stability for her child.  In the future, she wants to finish building a house that is currently made of cane and she wants her children to finish their studies successfully.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ramon Mauricio

texts.es:
Don Ramón, de 64 años de edad, atiende el sector agropecuario, reside en Jocoro departamento de Morazán donde vive con su familia, él tiene ganado de repasto y la siembra de granos básicos, maíz y maicillo. Del ganado obtiene la leche que una parte es vendida y otra parte la utiliza en la preparación de queso, el maicillo lo cultiva para consumo de los animales y el maíz para la familia.
Por el momento necesita un préstamo para la compra de concentrado para el ganado y para pago de mozos para sacar la cosecha de maíz y maicillo. Con este préstamo podrá realizar estos gastos ya que no cuenta por el momento con dinero para realizarlo.
Para don Ramón lo más importante dentro de sus planes es su hogar y ver la manera de seguir con su trabajo en la agricultura para generar ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Don Ramón is 64 years old and works in the agricultural sector.  He lives with his family in Jocoro, in the department of Morazán.  He has pasture cattle and also plants basic grains like corn and sorghum.  He sells some of the milk from his cows and uses the rest to make cheese.  He cultivates sorghum to feed his animals and corn for his family.

At the moment, he needs a loan to buy concentrated feed for his cattle and in order to pay porters to transport his corn and sorghum harvest.  He will only be able to cover these costs with the loan, as he doesn't have the money at this moment otherwise.

For Don Ramón, the most important parts of his plan are his home and continuing his agricultural work in order to generate income for his family.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed for his cattle

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria C. Alvares vive en la comunidad de Tlayecac, Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México, ella tiene 37 años de edad, ella estudio hasta el 3er. Año de secundaria tiene su certificado, ella es casada tiene 2 hijas Perla de 8 años de edad está estudiando la primaria e Ingrid de 5 años de edad está en preescolar, ella tiene su taller de costura y solicitó su préstamo para mantenimiento de las maquinas y para comprar, hilos, ahujas, aceite, ella ofrece a sus clientes pantalones, short, chazarilla, playeras, chamarras, además de los pedidos que le hagan los clientes, ya que ella trabaja como maquiladora. Ella inicio con su negocio hace 3 años, trabajaba con una señora de empleada cosiendo y decidió tener su propio negocio,  por medio de préstamos compró sus maquinas industriales: 2 rectas industriales y después con las ganancias compró la otra maquina recta y la otra maquina over.
Su negocio está en la casa de su mamá, ella vive a la vuelta llega caminando al taller, este negocio es importante para ella porque tiene ingresos para la alimentación de la familia y los gastos de su casa, su cliente es una persona  de Yautepec surte a diferentes estados. A ella le da gran satisfacción cuando cobra y tiene dinero, también le gusta trabajar en la maquina over  y está orgullosa de tener trabajo y tener sus propias maquinas industriales  y la saca de apuros cuando su esposo se enferma ella puede solventar los gastos. Las ganancias de su negocio las utiliza para la alimentación, para los gastos familiares, para pagar el préstamo y para seguir invirtiendo. 
El negocio si le ha ayudado en los gastos, en las colegiaturas de sus hijas y en muchas cosas, ella desea mejorar su vivienda repellara, echarle piso y comprar una sala, sus sueños son tener un cuarto especial para su taller porque el que está ocupando es de su mamá, ella está feliz con el préstamo que le proporcionan porque le va a ayudar a surtir su negocio, las mejorías que desea para sus hijas son que sigan estudiando y este préstamo le va a ayudar para comprar sus útiles y para pagar los gastos de la escuela. Ella quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad muchas gracias por apoyar a gente de pocos recursos y que no le suban a los interés.”  Tlayecac es un pueblo muy bonito porque es tranquilo todo está cerca para comprar, siembran sorgo, maíz, cebolla.
texts.en:
Mrs. Victoria C. Alvares lives in the community of Tlayecac, Ayala in the state of Morelos in Mexico. She is 37 years old, she graduated from high school and she is married. She has two daughters: Perla is 8 years old and goes to elementary school; Ingrid is 5 years old and goes to pre-school. She has a sewing workshop and requested a loan to maintain the machines and to buy threads, needles, and oil. To her customers, she offers pants, shorts, shirts, t-shirts, and jackets; she also takes volume orders from her customers. She started her business 3 years ago; she worked sewing with another lady as an employee and then she decided to have her own business. With loans, she bought 2 industrial machines and with the profits she bought two more machines.

Her business is located at her Mother’s house; she lives just around the corner and she walks to her workshop. This business is important to her because it provides income for food and household expenses. She has a customer from Yautepec that supplies to other states. She derives great satisfaction when she collects payments and has money. She likes to work with the sewing machines and is proud to have a job, to have her own industrial machines, and to have ready-resources to support expenses when her husband gets sick. She uses the profits from the business for food, household expenses, loan payments, and to re-invest.

The Business has helped her with expenses, school payments for her daughters and many other things. She wishes to stucco her house, add flooring, and buy furniture. Her dream is to have a special room for her workshop since she is currently at her Mom’s house. She is happy with the provided loan because it will help her stock up her business. She would like for her daughters to continue going to school; this loan will help her to buy school supplies and pay school expenses. She wants to give thanks to Kiva and Fundación Realidad for supporting people with limited resources and for the low interest rates. Tlayecac is a pretty town because it is tranquil and with convenient shopping; they grow sorghum, corn and onions.

loans.use: Buy threads, needles, and oil for machine maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Install home protection

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol, de 34 años, es una mujer muy amable y sencilla, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Silvestre de 44 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Desde muy pequeña Marisol ha trabajado junto a sus padres en el cultivo de la tierra, con los años ha logrado comprarse sus propias chacras y ahora es una de las principales productoras de café, cacao y hojas de coca de la provincia de La Mar - Ayacucho, lugar hasta donde llegan sus compradores para obtener sus cultivos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y lo hace con mucho cariño, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que es muy difícil encontrar camiones que quieran llevar los pesados sacos de cultivo. Con el paso del tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, con las cuales pueda incrementar su producción. Este es el décimo sexto crédito con MFP, está muy segura de poder pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas, ya que siempre ha sido muy puntual. En su banco comunal es una social muy alegre y solidaria. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para mejorar la productividad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Marisol, 34, is a very kind and simple woman.  She lives in her own home with her husband Silvestre, 44, and their 3 beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life . From an early age Marisol has worked alongside her parents in agriculture.  Over time she has managed to buy her own farm and is now one of the largest producers of coffee, cocoa and coca leaves in La Mar - Ayacucho province.  Her buyers travel from a distance to obtain her crops.   What she likes about her job is looking after the crops, which she does with great care.  She has spent 20 years doing this work and thinks that the hardest part is transporting her products to the city of San Francisco, because it it is very difficult to find trucks that are willing to carry the heavy sacks of crops. 

Over time, she wants to buy new land with which she can increase her production. This is her sixteenth credit with MFP, she makes sure to pay all her installments on time, and has always been very punctual.  She is a very cheerful member of her community bank and shows great solidarity. With the 1200 New Soles she is requesting, she will buy more manure and fertilizers to improve her crop productivity.

loans.use: Buying manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: La señora Teresa O.  Martínez vive en la comunidad de Tlayecac, Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México, ella tiene 32 años de edad y estudio la preparatoria tiene su certificado, ella es casada pero no tiene hijos, ella tiene su negocio de Decoración con globos para las fiestas y solicitó su préstamo para comprar globos y bases para arreglos, su negocio se llama "Decoraciones O.", sus clientas son las señoras, señores, muchachas y muchachos, ella les ofrece a sus clientes arreglos para fiestas de globos, ella inicio su negocio hace 8 años fue a un curso de decoración de salones con globos, como iba a las fiesta  le gustaban los arreglos del salón con globos y así es como inicio, le gustan las manualidades, comenzó a comprar las base poco a poco y empezó a ofrecer sus arreglos a las personas, ella tiene 2 negocio trabaja en un restaurante de lunes a viernes y en un local de Cuautla venden arreglos para fiestas, su negocio es importante porque le rinde ganancias, le da gusto ver que quedan bonitas las fiestas, se siente orgullosa cuando le dicen que quedo bien el salón, las personas servidas por su negocio son las quinceañera, fiesta de niños, bodas, ella atiende de 2 a 3 eventos por semana, su  negocio es popular por que la gente ya conoce su trabajo, las ganancias del negocio las utiliza una parte para los gasto de ella y otra parte para comprar mercancía, ella está feliz con este préstamo que le proporcionan porque quiere comprar más bases y las piensa comprar con el préstamo que le proporciona Kiva y Fundación Realidad, a ella le ayudan es su negocio sus hermanas a inflar globos y armar los adornos en las bases. A ella le gusta Tlayecac porque es muy tranquilo, las mejorías que desea hacer a su vivienda es poner bardo a donde vive por que tiene paso libre, sus sueños son rentar un local en Cuautla para poner su negocio y tener más clientes y crecer en su negocio. La señora Teresa quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les agradezco su apoyo y que nos ayudan a impulsar los negocios de los grupos”
texts.en:
Señora Teresa O. M. lives in the community of Tlayecac, Ayala, in Morelos state in Mexico.  She is 32 years old and has her high school certificate.  She is married but has no children. She has a decoration business providing balloons for parties and requested the loan to buy balloons and bases for decoration arrangements. Her business is called "Decoration O.".  Her clients are men and women, boys and girls.  She provides her customers with balloons arrangements for parties.  She started her business 8 years ago with a course on decorating with balloons, as she had gone to a party where she liked the balloon arrangements and that was how it began.  She like crafts, and started buying the bases little by little and began offering her arrangements to people.

She has two lines of work - she works in a restaurant Monday to Friday and in a place in Cuautla selling her party arrangements.  Her business is important because it yields a profit, she enjoys seeing the beautiful parties and is proud when people tell her that the room looks good.  Her customers' events are quinceañeras (coming-of-age parties for 15 year old girls), kids' parties and weddings.  She attends 2 to 3 events per week.  Her business is popular because people already know her work.  Her business profits are used partly to cover living expenses and partly to buy merchandise.  

She is happy about this loan because she wants to buy additional bases and plans to buy these with the loan from Kiva and Fundación Realidad.  Her sisters help her with her business by blowing up the balloons and putting together the decorations on the bases. She likes Tlayecac because it is very quiet.  The improvements that she would like to make to her home is to put in place a wall, as where she lives is an open space .  Her dreams are to rent a space in Cuautla for her business, to have more clients and to grow her business. Señora Teresa wants to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad "thank you for your support and for helping us drive the businesses of the groups"

loans.use: Buying a tank of gas, wholesale balloons, string for the balloons, bases for ballon arrangements and other items.

loans.name: Jose Humberto

texts.es:
José Humberto de 26 años de edad, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, donde vive con su familia, se dedica a la crianza de ganado desde hace dos años, lo cual aprendió de sus padres, él comercializa ganado en el tiangue de Corinto los días miércoles.
El quiere comprar una vaca en este momento pero no cuenta con fondos para realizar la compra por lo que solicita un préstamo y poder realizar la compra, con esta ayuda realizara una buena compra y continuara en el crecimiento de ganado.
Crecer como ganadero es su sueño, establecer un buen número de ganado para comercializar y progresar junto a su familia hacia un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
José Humberto is 26 years old. He resides in the Corinto region of Morazán, where his family also lives. He has been raising cattle for the past two years, which he learned how to do from his parents. He sells cattle at the small market in Corinto on Wednesdays.
He wants to buy a cow at this time, but he doesn't have the funds to make the purchase. He is asking for a loan to be able to make the purchase. With this help, he will be able to make a good purchase and will continue in the growth of his livestock.
Growing as a rancher is his dream, establishing a good number of cattle to sell and progressing together with his family toward a better future.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: El señor José Ángel S. construyo su vivienda con ahorros para brindar a su familia un mejor patrimonio, solo que aun le siguen faltando algunos detalles a su casa para que quede totalmente terminada. El solicita el apoyo para poner piso firme en la cocina para que el polvo no se levante cuando su esposa este cocinado y los alimentos que preparen vayan en mejores condiciones de salud.
texts.en:
Mr. José Ángel S. used his savings to build his house in order to provide his family with a better asset.  However, he still needs to complete a few details on the house so that it will be completely finished.

He is asking for the support to install permanent flooring in the kitchen to keep dust from rising while his wife’s cooking and so that the food she prepares will be in better conditions of hygiene.

loans.use: To install permanent flooring.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutas”  ubicado en el distrito Puno y provincia de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 02 hijos.
La señora estudió educación secundaria.

Viene trabajando  con  el  Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 09 años.  Con  su primer  crédito de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, invirtió en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de animales.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizará para comprar animales, ropas de vestir como polleras chompas, sombreros, zapatos y también lanas para tejer chullos y colchas.

Su visión en el negocio es tener una tienda de ropas (cholitas).
	
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la organización, puntualidad y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Vilma belongs to the "Las Kantutas" [Kantuta Flowers] Village Bank in the district and province of Puno.  She's 42, married, and has two children.  She has a secondary school education.

She's been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for nine years.  She invested her first loan, for 300 soles, in her business.  She earns her living selling animals.

Vilma is seeking a loan for 3000 soles, which she'll use to buy animals, and clothing like skirts, sweaters, hats, shoes, and also wool to make caps  and bedspreads.  

Her vision for the business is to have a clothing store (traditional Peruvian clothing).

What Vilma likes best about her village bank is the organization, punctuality, and responsibility.

loans.use: Vilma will buy animals, and clothing including skirts, sweaters, hats, shoes, as well as wool to make caps and dolls.

loans.name: Ma Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Ma del Socorro Rosa Rodríguez es una mujer que trabaja en una comedor para el bienestar y salud de la comunidad, el gobierno puso comedores en el cual ella ofrece sus servicios recibiendo su salario. Ahora ella requiere el apoyo para comprar el cableado de su casa y sea instalado, el que tiene ya esta muy deteriorado; para poder conectar algún aparato electrónico tiene que conectar varios cables  lo puede perjudicar una descarga eléctrica.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ma. del Socorro Rosa Rodríguez is a woman who works at a community kitchen.  The government set up eateries.  She works in one of them and earns a salary doing so.

She needs the loan to buy and install electrical wiring in her house.  What she has now is much deteriorated and in order to plug in an electrical device she has to connect several cables and this could lead to an electrical discharge.

loans.use: To rewire her house.

loans.name: Nemesio

texts.es: Nemesio, de 54 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Rosalía de 45 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. El arduo trabajo que Nemesio realiza en sus chacras, le ha traído como resultado una buena producción, ya que sus plantaciones de café, cacao y hojas de coca, han sido cosechadas abundantemente y con muy buena calidad.  Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que siente que sus esfuerzos están dando frutos, lleva 35 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus sembríos de las plaga de insectos que pueden afectar su productividad. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el décimo cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que poner todo de su parte y trabajar muy duro para pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y esta dispuesto a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono e insecticidas, para mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
Nemesio, 54, is a very kind and hard working man living in his own house with his wife, Rosalía, 45, and their three beloved children for whom he wants to provide a better future.

The hard work Nemesio does in his fields has resulted in a good production since his coffee, cocoa bean and coca leaf crops have produced abundant, good quality harvests.

What he enjoys the most about his work is harvesting because he feels that his efforts are bearing fruit.  He has been a farmer for 35 years and considers the most difficult part of the work keeping his plants safe from insect infestations that can affect crop yields.  In time he hopes to buy more land to increase production.

This is his 14th loan with MFP.  He knows that he has to do his part and work very hard to repay on time and is willing to do so.  He is a very responsible member of the communal bank which makes him highly respected.

He will use the requested 1200 new soles to buy manure and insecticide to improve production.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure and insecticides.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: El señor Carlos M. es un hombre muy trabajador que gracias al esfuerzo de varios años, adquirió su vivienda de interés social. Ahora el requiere de un préstamo para colocar en el patio de enfrente un portal metálico, para tener protegida su casa de los delincuentes. Pues teme que todo su esfuerzo quede en manos de personas con malas intenciones que solo viven para perjudicar el bienestar de las personas.
texts.en: Carlos M. is a hardworking man who, thanks to an effort over several years, has gotten a subsidized house.  Now he needs a loan to put a metal gate in front of his patio to protect his home from criminals; he's afraid that all his efforts are in the hands of ill-intentioned people who live only to the detriment of the well-being of other people.

loans.use: A metal gate.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.es:
La señora Azucena Hernández C. vivr en la comunidad de Tlayecac, Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México, Ella tiene 19 años de edad, estudio hasta la preparatoria tiene su certificado, ella es casada tiene 1 hijo se llama Bernardo Israel y tiene 1 año de edad. Ella y su esposo tienen un taller de hojalatería y ella solicitó su préstamo para aumentar el negocio, van a comprar pintura, tinner, aceite, primer, lijas, estopa. Los productos que ofrecen son pintura de autos, arreglo golpes, etc., además de eso también venden miel, jalea real, piloncillo. Su negocio se llama "taller de hojalatería las mieles", su negocio lo inicio hace 5 años el negocio de la miel y hace 4 años el taller de hojalatería, el negocio es de familia, sus papás le enseñaron a trabajar el negocio de la miel y la jalea real, su negocio es una herencia de sus papás. 
Para ella y su familia es muy importante su negocio porque tiene ingresos y es su fuente de trabajo, la parte favorita de trabajar su negocio es vender miel y arreglar las canastas las decora le pone encaje, ella está orgullosa porque le enseñan a trabajar más para superarse, en tiempo de vacaciones en el mes de abril y diciembre es cuando más se vende sus clientes son los turista, ya que su negocio está a la orilla de la carretera y los turistas se detienen a comprar los productos de la miel, los desafíos que enfrenta el negocio son el clima, ya que en tiempos de lluvias no se puede sacar la mercancía porque se moja.  Las ganancias las utiliza para volver a invertir. Su negocio le ha ayudado a que ya no sea empleada, sino que tenga su propio negocio y así puede cuidar a su hijo, sus sueños son tener su casa propia por que vive con sus papás, tener un taller de costura propio y tener una economía estable y este préstamo le va a ayudar a agranda y crecer en su negocio, ella quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundacion Realidad “gracias por darnos la oportunidad de crecer en los negocios.” Tlayecac es un lugar muy tranquilo de clima caluroso.
texts.en:
Azucena Hernández C. lives in the community of Tlayecac, Ayala in the state of Morelos, Mexico.  She is 19 years old, and has a high school degree.  She is married and has a son named Bernardo Israel who is 1 years old.  She and her husband have an auto body and requests a loan to increase her business.  She will buy paint, thinner, oil, primer, sandpaper.  She offers services of auto painting, fixing dents, etc.  In addition, she also sells honey, royal jelly (dietary supplement made from bees) and brown sugar.  Her business is called "The Honey Auto Body Shop."  She started this business 5 years ago, and she started selling honey in her body shop 4 years ago.  Her business is a family business; her parents taught her the honey  and royal jelly business, and she inherited the business from them.  

Her favorite part of the work is selling honey and decorating the containers with lace that she puts on them.  She is proud because she was taught to work hard to succeed.  She sells the most during the vacation periods of April and December. Her customers are tourists, since her business is at the side of a highway and the tourists stop to buy the honey products.  The challenge she faces with her business is the climate, since during the rainy season she cannot get the merchandise because it gets wet. She will use her earnings to invest in the business.  Her business has helped her, because she is not employed, but has her own business and in this way is able to support her son.  She dreams of having her own home because she lives with her parents, and she dreams of having her own dressmaking workshop so that she could have stable finances.  This loan will help her to enlarge and grow her business.  She wants to say to Kiva and to the Fundacion Realidad "thanks for giving us the opportunity to grow our businesses."  Tlayecac is a very tranquil place with a warm climate.

loans.use: to buy paint, thinner, oil, and sandpaper for her autobody shop

loans.name: Carlos Roberto

texts.es:
el sr. Carlos Roberto P. tiene 36 años de edad, vive en Santa Ana de Yusguare y se dedica a la venta de helados, paletas, conos.
esta zona es muy caliente y este tipo de producto se vende muy bien, mas que todo a los niños que les gusta mucho comer helados.
Carlos es padre de 2 hijos los cuales los tiene estudiando, junto con su esposa trabajan duro para salir adelante, su meta es darles buenos estudios a sus hijos para que sean buenos profesionales y hombres de bien.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de helados, conos, paletas.
texts.en: Carlos Roberto P. is 36 years old and lives in Santa Ana de Yusguare. He makes a living selling ice cream, popsicles and ice cream cones. This is a very hot area and this type of product sells very well, especially to children, who really enjoy eating ice cream. Carlos has two children who are in school. He and his wife both work hard to keep making headway. His goal is to provide his children with a good eduction so they become professional and productive members of society. He plans to use the loan to purchase ice cream, cones and popsicles.

loans.use: Purchase cones, ice cream, napkins, cups, popsicles

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
El Sr. Pablo V. es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, tiene 25 años, es soltero, actualmente  vive con sus padres y tiene 2 hermanos mayores.
 Su padre es albañil y su madre ama de casa.
 El Sr. Pablo aprendió la profesión de zapatero con un profesional que le estrechó la mano. Pues, encontró esa mano amiga un día de eso cuando salió a  buscar trabajo, fue así que empezó y aprendió a ser un profesional; Juntó un pequeño capital con el ingreso que obtenía y logró montar su negocio en la casa de sus padres. Cuenta  con 2 empleados, ahora le hace falta una maquina de costura para producir a mayor escala, razón por el cual solicitó el crédito.
El necesita incrementar sus ingresos para que algún día tenga su casa propia.
texts.en:
Pablo V. is from the city of Carapeguá.  He's twenty-five, single, and currently lives with his parents.  He has two older brothers.  His father is a bricklayer and his mother is a homemaker.

Pablo learned to be a cobbler from a professional who reached out to him.  He met the helping hand hand one day when he went out looking for work.  That's how he got started and learned to be a professional.  With a little capital from his earnings, he succeeded in opening his business in his parents' home.  He has two employees, but at present he lacks a sewing machine to produce on a greater scale, which is why is is seeking a loan.

Pablo needs to increase his income so he may one day have his own house.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Sayda Silvia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “OLLANTAY II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sayda Silvia; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza, ella vende en forma independiente llevando a diferentes lugares como instituciones, ella vende perfumes, lápiz labiales, polvos y esmaltes, la socia quiere tener una tienda donde vender los cosméticos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de belleza al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This associate is a member of the OLLANTAY II communal bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Sayda Silvia is 39 years old, married, and has three children.  She sells beauty products by taking them to different points of sale, such as offices.  She sells perfumes, lipsticks, powders, and nail polish.  Some day she would like to have her own store where she can sell her products.  She is asking for this loan in order to buy beauty products in quantity.

She is grateful for this loan and is committed to making all of her payments.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
Felicia Lourdes P. M., 46 años D. edad, 2 hijos y presidenta del grupo: "Virgen del Rosario".
L. Señora Felicia todavìa tiene a su cargo a uno D. sus hijos que esta aùn en edad escolar; èl mayor D. sus hijos ya tiene familia y trabaja independientemente.
Felicia junto con su conviviente Piter R. Porras empezaron con este negocio hace 26 años. El negocio que ellos emprendieron los llevo hasta las punas D. Huancayo donD. crece L. Maca. Felicia compraba este producto para revender en los mercados locales; posteriormente les surgiò L. idea D. hacer harina D. maca, ya que D. este modo pueden ganar un mejor precio. 
El proceso D. L. Harina D. Maca: Es secar el producto bajo el fuerte sol, volteando L. Maca D. rato en rato, luego lo muelen en molinos artesanales a mano; D. allì obtienen como resultado L. harina D. Maca.
Felicia tiene muchas ganas D. superaciòn, tal es asì que, ahora piensa realizar el mismo proceso y hacer harina D. zanahoria.
El prèstamo adquirido serà para comprar Maca para deshitratar.
texts.en: Felicia Lourdes P. M., 46 years old, has two children and is the president of this group, "Virgen del Rosario."  She cares for one of her children, who is still in school.  The eldest of her children already has a family and works independently.  Felicia lives with her partner, Piter R. Porras.  They began this business over 26 years ago and operates it all the way to the Andean plateaus where the maca root grows.  Felicia bought this product in order to resell them at local markets.  Beforehand, the idea of making maca root flour was suggested because the product would sell at a higher price.  The process of making maca root flour is to dry the product under the sun, turning the maca from time to time.  Afterwards, they are crushed by hand using an artisan grinder; the result of which is maca root flour.  She has a great desire to overcome obstacles, as such she is now thinking of using the same process to make carrot flour.  She plans to use the loan that she is requesting to purchase maca root to dehydrate.

loans.use: Purchase maca root to be dehydrated.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael, de 26 años, es un joven muy responsable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Maribel de 25 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo que realiza Rafael es el cultivo de cacao, café y hojas de coca, esta actividad le ha dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse, es por eso que todos los días trabaja arduamente en sus sembríos. Él ha visto por conveniente llevar sus productos hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que según manifiesta, es ahí donde mejores ganancias obtiene. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos de las plaga de insectos que pueden amenazar su productividad de sus frutos, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que el camino es muy largo y agotador. Con el tiempo, espera que sus cultivos mejoren y con su venta pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, se siente en la obligación de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querido. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en: Rafael, of 26 years old, is a responsible and hard-working young man.  He lives in his own house with his wife, Maribel, of 25 years old and their four dear children, to whom he wishes to provide a better quality of life.  Rafael works in the cultivation of cacao, coffee, and coco leaves.  This activity has provided him with the necessary income to maintain him and his family, which is why he works so hard every day on his harvests.  He even takes his products all the way to the city of San Francisco, where according to him, he earns the most money for his products.  What he loves most about his work is keeping pests away from his crops that might threaten the productivity of his labour.  He has spent 2 years doing this type of work and considers the most difficult part of it to the transportation of his products, since the road is very long and exhausting.  Over time, he hopes that his cultivations will improve and that the sale of them will increase his income.  This is his fourth credit with MFP.  He feels obligated to make all of his payments punctually, since he does not want to cause problems with the members of his communal bank, where he is greatly cherished.  With the 2,000 soles that he is applying for, he plans to use it to purchase more fertiliser for his crops.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertiliser.

loans.name: Severiano

texts.es:
El Sr. Severiano C. tiene 33 años de edad, es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, soltero aún no tiene hijos.


   Se dedica como tejedor desde su infancia, pues, la profesión aprendió de su querida madre.
