   Severiano comenta que los productos que realiza es de muy buena aceptación ya que lo realiza con mucho esmero y dedicación.

       Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y a kiva por el apoyo crediticio que le brinda y promete cumplir con puntualidad con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Mr. Severiano C. is 33 and from the city of Carapegua. He is single and has no children. He has worked as a weaver since his childhood, a profession that he learned from his beloved mother. Severiano says that the products that he makes have had great success since he makes them with much care and dedication. He is grateful to the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the support offered through this loan and he promises to repay his quotas punctually.

loans.use: the purchase of threads and dyes for thread

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy, de 49 años, vive en su casa propia construida de material noble, al lado de su esposo William de 56 años y de su hija que vive con  su familia en el mismo lugar. Desde hace 15 años esta emprendedora dama instaló en una pieza de su vivienda un pequeño taller de producción de estructuras metálicas, en sociedad con los miembros de su familia. De esta manera prestan todo tipo de servicio metalúrgico, como por ejemplo la  fabricación de puertas, ventanas, armarios, entre otros, pero todo hecho en material de metal. Y esta muy satisfecha pues las ganancias son regulares, pues no tiene competencia cercana; además realizan trabajos a domicilio, junto con su esposo y yerno. Como es un negocio familiar las ganancias se las dividen; y ella ya tiene varios planes para el futuro como el de ampliar las instalaciones de su taller, también  quiere comprar nueva maquinaria. Es el 13avo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en su negocio en busca del progreso. Nancy tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de materiales en metal que necesita, pues tiene un gran pedido y quiere terminarlo, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Nancy, 49, lives in her own house, that’s built out of substantial materials, with her husband, William, 56, and their daughter and her daughter’s family who live together with them.

For the last 15 years this enterprising woman has had a small metal workshop installed in one of the rooms in her house.  In partnership with some members of her family she makes metallic structures.  In this way they provide all sorts of metallurgic services.  For example: they manufacture doors, windows and armoires, among others.  

She is very satisfied because profits are regular because she doesn’t have any competition nearby.   Besides, she also does jobs to order at customers’ homes with her husband and son-in-law.  Because it’s a family business, profits are shared.  She already has several plans for the future like enlarging the workshop’s installations; she also wants to buy new machinery.

This is her 13th loan with MFP and she promises to repay on time because she does not want to disappoint the people who made this contribution possible that will allow her to stay in business seeking progress.

Nancy plans to use the requested loan to buy metal supplies she needs because she has a large pending order she wants to complete.  She hopes to improve her profits this way.

loans.use: To buy metal supplies.

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es:
El señor Sixto tiene 49 años de edad, se dedica en la venta de colchas (venta en forma ambulante) en la zona de Capiatá y Alto Paraná; tiene clientela formada y quiere solicitar el crédito para aumentar su stock de mercaderías mediante la compra de colchas, sabanas, toallas y otros.
 Esta temporada de fin de año es una buena oportunidad para colocar sus mercaderías y así incrementar sus tarjetas de cobranza.
 El cliente opera con Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 1999 y cuenta con buen historial de crédito. Tiene casa propia, necesita aumentar sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sixto is 49 years old. His work is selling bedspreads (which he sells as a mobile vendor) in the area of Capiatá and Alto Paraná. He has a steady customer base and would like to request the loan to increase his stock of merchandise, through the purchase of bedspreads, sheets, towels and other items. 

This season at the end of the year is a good opportunity to place his merchandise and thus increase his receivables. This client has worked with the Paraguaya Foundation since 1999 and has an excellent credit history. He has his own home, and he needs to increase his income in order to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: Buying bedspreads, sheets, towels and other merchandise

loans.name: Roberth

texts.es: Roberth, de 23 años,  vive en la casa de su hermana en compañía de ella y de sus sobrinos; juntos se esfuerzan a diario para salir adelante en busca del progreso. Este emprendedor joven es técnico en reparación de teléfonos; y en la actualidad trabaja en una empresa reconocida a nivel mundial. Su labor la desempeña de lunes a sábado y recorre las calles de la ciudad en una unidad de transporte visitando a los clientes, que tienen algún problema con su línea de teléfono,  de la empresa. Le gusta mucho su labor pues es bastante rentable, y con las ganancias hace algunos años instaló en la casa de su hermana un negocio de alquiler de cabinas de Internet, además en ese lugar también alquila videojuegos, este negocio lo atiende su novia, pero él es dueño e inversionista. Como siempre tiene  proyectos en mente, para el futuro tiene pensado comprar un auto para brindarlo en alquiler y de esta manera  espera continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar adelante. Roberth tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de 3 computadoras, de segundo uso, para implementar mejor su negocio de alquiler de cabinas de Internet y  espera mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Roberth, of 23 years old, lives at her sister's house with her and his nieces and nephews.  They work together on a daily basis to move themselves ahead.  This young entrepreneur currently works as a technician repairing telephones for a world-renown company.  He works Monday through Saturday, travelling around the city and visiting clients that have some type of problem with his company's telephone lines.  He likes his work very much because it is quite profitable and a few years ago, he was able to use his income and install, in his sister's house, an Internet cafe business.  In addition, video games can also be rented there.  His girlfriend operates this business, but he is the owner and investor.  Since he always has projects in mind, his future plans are to purchase an automobile in the future to rent out and as such, continue to work and expand his business.  This is his third credit with MFP and he promises to make punctual payments since he does not want to upset the people that are making this opportunity possible.  Roberth has planned to invest the requested loan in the purchase of 3 second hand computers with which to better equip his Internet cafe business and increase his earnings.

loans.use: Purchase 3 second hand computers in order to contribute to his Internet business.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús S. Ramírez quiere construir un cuarto en la planta alta de su vivienda ya que es de interés social y es muy pequeña para la familia que esta constituida de 5 personas, los cuales quieren cada uno su propio espacio. Jesús y su hijo trabajan en maquiladora para poder sostener los gastos de la familia.
texts.en: Jesús S. Ramírez would like to construct a fourth floor onto his house.  The house is very small for his family, which is made up of 5 people, all of whom want their own space.  Jesus and his son work at a factory in order to be able to sustain his family's living costs.

loans.use: Construct another floor in their house. Construir en planta alta

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Armandina

texts.es: La señora Armandina R. G. es madre de dos pequeños a los cuales quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida, en los cambios de estación la casa de no se ambienta al clima; es por ello que quiere comprar un minisplit para mantener la temperatura ambiental ya que en esta región no es un lujo tener este aparato si no es una necesidad es por ello que se apoya en esta institución pensando en el bienestar de la familia.
texts.en: Señora Armandina R. G. is a mother of two small children, to whom she wants to offer the best quality of life.  When seasons change, the house does not adapt to the climate well so she wants to purchase a thermostat to maintain the temperature of her house since in her area it is not a luxury but a necessity to have this item.  As a result, she is supportive of this institution with her family's well being in mind.

loans.use: Purchase a thermostat for her house.

loans.name: Anita

texts.es: Anita M. Méndez es una señora muy emprendedora que a pesar de la crisis económica sigue adelante para ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Anita se dedica a la venta de elotes y chicharrones desde hace un año negocio que quiere ir incrementando para esto quiere comprar una plancha para preparar hamburguesas y venderlas aun buen precio.
texts.en:
Anita M. Méndez is an enterprising woman who, despite the economic crisis, continues forward to offer her children a better quality of life.

Anita has been selling corn on the cob and chicharrones for the past year, a business she wants to enlarge.  To do so, she wants to buy a grill to make hamburgers and sell them at a good price.

loans.use: To buy a grill to make hamburgers.

loans.name: Daniel Jonathan

texts.es: Daniel Jonathan Gámez A. es padre de dos pequeños por quienes el sale adelante para ofrecerles un patrimonio y una mejor calidad de vida. El señor Daniel requiere de su apoyo para comprar material de construcción para realizar varias mejoras a su casa como lo es poner un portal en la parte de enfrente para darle una mejor vista a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Daniel Jonathan Gámez A. is the father of two young ones for whom he wants to provide a good future and better quality of life.

He needs help to buy building materials and supplies to make several home improvements, like an entryway on the front of the house so that the house will have a better appearance.

loans.use: To build an entryway.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es: La señora Marta S. Álvarez es de la comunidad de Tlayecac, Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México, ella tiene 58 años de edad, estudio hasta el 3er. Año de primaria, ella es casada y tiene 7 hijos Salustio tiene 42 años, Antonia tiene 40 años, Lucio tiene 38 años, Fidel tiene 36 años, Víctor tiene 34 años, María Enriqueta tiene 32 años, Victoria tiene 30 años todos trabajan. La señora Marta tiene su servicio de computadoras se llama Ciber Queta  y su taller de costura y solicito su préstamo para el mantenimiento de las  maquinas y va a comprar hilos, ahujas, aceite, tijeras, también una parte para la casa para la alimentación, ella ofrece a sus clientes la venta de dulces y servicio de computadoras , este negocio lo inicio hace 7 años y es de su hijo pero ella lo atiende, la costura lo aprendió primero Planchando y después aprendió a coser, elaboraba mandiles y los salía a vender, ella tiene en su taller tiene 3 maquinas industriales cuando comenzó el maquilero le prestó una maquina ya después maquilando fue ahorrando se compro 1 maquina y después las otras 2, su negocio está en su casa, para ella su negocio es importante porque obtiene dinero y la parte favorita de su negocio es coser y le da gran satisfacción la costura, ella recuerda muy orgullosa cuanto tuvo su primer maquina ya con esta máquina amplia su trabajo, sus clientes son diferentes personas por que sale a vender sus productos, su negocio es popular mas la conocen por las computadora o el Ciber y arreglos de cierres y está planeando ampliarlo comprar más tela para tener mercancía para trabajar y lo piensa lograr ahorrando o con el préstamo. Su negocio enfrenta la competencia de mas personas que se dedican a lo mismo, las ganancias del negocio las utiliza para la alimentación, ella está bien contenta con este préstamo que le proporcionan porque le va ayudar a su negocio para invertirlo en mercancía y tener para trabajar y sus sueños y esperanzas son seguir trabajando y este negocio le va a ayudar a compartir lo que gana con sus hijos. Tlayecac es un lugar bonito, ya tiene muchos años viviendo en este pueblo que es muy tranquilo. La Señora Marta quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “muchas gracias por el préstamo y que sigan ayudando a las personas que lo necesitan para el bien de ellos y de sus familias con estas ayudas los negocios siguen trabajando”.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marta S. Álvarez, 58, is from the community of Tlayecac, Ayala in the state of Morelos, México.  She studied up to the third grade of elementary school.  She’s married and has 7 children: Salustio, 42, Antonia, 40, Lucio, 38, Fidel, 36, Víctor, 34, María Enriqueta, 32 and Victoria, 30.  All of them work.

Marta has a computer service business called Ciber Queta and she also has a sewing workshop.  She requested the loan to service the machines and to buy thread, needles, oil and scissors.  She also needs part of it for food for the household.  She sells candy and computer services to her customers.

She started the business 7 years ago and it’s her son’s but she tends to it.  With respect to the sewing: she first learned ironing and then sewing.  She used to make aprons to sell.  She has three industrial sewing machines in her workshop.  At first, she used a borrowed machine that she got from the “maquilero” (person who assembles clothing for third parties).  Later on, as she did more and more clothing assembly jobs, she saved up and bought a sewing machine and then another two.  Her business is in her house.

Her business is important to her because she earns income.  Her favorite part of the business is sewing and sewing gives her much satisfaction.  She remembers proudly when she got her first machine that allowed her to expand her business.  Her customers are different people because she goes out to sell her items.  Her business is popular and she’s also well known thanks to the computers, or the Cyber, and zipper repairs.  She is planning to expand buying more fabric to have merchandise to work with.  She plans to accomplish this either with savings or with the loan.

Her business faces competition from other people who do the same thing.  She uses profits from the business for food.  She is very happy with the loan she’s getting because it will help her in business buying merchandise and providing working capital.  Her dreams and aspirations are to stay in business and to be able to share what the business produces with her children. Tlayecac is a very beautiful place.  She has been living in this town for many years.  It is very peaceful.

Marta wants to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad:  “Thank you very much for the loan and continue to help people who need it for their own and their families’ wellbeing.  With this help the businesses continue working.”

loans.use: To service the machines and to buy thread, needles, oil and scissors.

loans.name: G.s. En Nombre De Jesus Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está conformado por Margarita Esperanza y Johana Maria. Sus actividades económicas son las mismas por lo que siempre están buscando la forma de mejorar sus negocios. Margarita se dedica a la venta de quesillos y ropa, hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio la necesidad de sufragar los gastos de su hogar es lo que ha hecho que ellas se unan para realizar este financiamiento que es para la compra de materia prima necesaria. Sueñan con aumentar su negocio para obtener más ganancias.
texts.en: The group is comprised of members Margarita Esperanza and Johana Maria.  Their economic activities are the same, and they are always looking for ways to improve their businesses.  Margarita has been selling cheeses and clothing for more than three years.  The need to cover home expenses motivated them to join forces in requesting a loan.  The loan is for purchasing raw materials.  Margarita and Johana dream of growing their business in order to improve profits.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama "Mujeres Unidas" porque nos platican que en temporada de la cosecha van todas las mujeres unidas a sus parcelas a cortar sus limones. Esta ubicado en la comunidad de Paso Rincón, San Juan bautista Tuxtepec en el estado de Oaxaca. El grupo esta conformado por 6 integrantes que se conocen por ser habitantes del mismo pueblo y cortan su limón en grupo. Este es su segundo préstamo con Fundación Realidad. La representante del grupo se llama Leonarda P. F. tiene la edad de 66 años ella solo estudio hasta el primer año de primaria y tubo una hija a la cual llama rosa, su hija ya es casada. Doña "Leo" como la llaman en su comunidad tiene un pequeño molino de maíz(en el cual van a moler todas las mujeres del pueblo su maíz para hacer sus tortillas) y una pequeña parcela en la que siembra limón y ella necesita el préstamo para comprar algunos fertilizantes y abonos para su sembradío,también algunos costales de maíz para vender en su molino, doña "Leo" se despierta todos los días a las 5:00 AM para abrir su molino y molerle su maíz a sus clientas su molino se ubica en su hogar, ella espera en un futuro comprarse un molino nuevo ya que el que tiene en ocasiones falla. La señora Leonarda es una señora muy alegre y con muchas ganas de trabajar. La señora Angelina P. O. también es integrante del grupo Mujeres Unidas. Ella tiene 67 años. Ella solo estudio hasta el tercer año de primaria. Doña Angelina solo vive con su nieto de 10 años, el estudia el quinto año de primaria. Ella se dedica a la siembra, cultivo y venta del limón y necesita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y abonos para su sembradío, doña Gela (como la llaman sus amigas) nos platica que en diciembre es cuando mas ganancia le deja el limón debido a que por el frió el limón se escasea, su parcela se encuentra a 200 metros de su casa. Ella desea que en un futuro su nieto pueda ir a la universidad y sea un gran ingeniero. Las otras 4 integrantes se llaman: Rosa Elvira M. P., Nelly Marisol M. A., Rosa R. P. se dedican al cultivo de limón ellas desean el préstamo para invertirlo en fertilizantes y abonos y Denis Carvajal M. que vende perfumes por catalogo de casa en casa necesita el préstamo para comprar sus perfumes.
texts.en:
This group is called “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women).  They tell us that this is because during harvest time all the women go to their fields to pick lemons together.  It is located in the community of Paso Rincón, San Juan Bautista Tuxtepec, in the state of Oaxaca.  It has 6 members who know each other because they all live in the same town and pick lemons together.  This is their 2nd loan with Fundación Realidad.  

The group representative is Leonarda P. F., 66.  She only finished first grade.  She has a daughter, Rosa, who is already married.  Doña “Leo,” as she’s known in her community has a small corn mill that all the women in her community come to use to grind corn to make tortillas and a small plot of land that she grows lemons on.  She needs the loan to buy fertilizers and manure for her crops.  She also needs a few sacks of corn to sell at the mill.

Doña “Leo” wakes up every day at 5am to open the mill and grind corn for her customers.  The mill is located in her house.  She hopes in the future to buy a new mill because the one she has breaks down sometimes.  Leonarda is a very cheerful woman who very much wants to work.

Mrs. Angelina P. O., 67, is another member of the Mujeres Unidas group.  She only got to third grade.  Angelina lives just with her 10 year old grandson who is in fifth grade.  She is a lemon farmer and needs the loan to buy fertilizers and manure for her crops.

Doña “Gela,” as she’s called by her friends, tells us that December is the month when profits from the lemons are highest because lemons are scarce then due to the cold.  Her farm plot is 200 meters from her house.  She hopes that her grandson will be able to go to the university in the future to become a great engineer.

The other four members are: Rosa Elvira M. P., Nelly Marisol M. A., Rosa Ramírez P. who are all lemon farmers and need the loan to buy fertilizers and manure and Denis Carvajal Martínez who sells perfume via catalogue door to door and needs the loan to buy perfumes.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and manure for lemon crops, to buy corn and to buy perfumes to sell via catalogue.

location.town: Paso Rincon, San Juan Bautista Tuxtepec, Oaxaca

loans.name: Lucia Ramona

texts.es: Lucia Ramona tiene 71 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 12 años que tiene este negocio. Ella dio inicio a este medio de vida con pocos productos la mayoría de sus clientes que son personas que viven cerca siempre llegan a buscar lo que ella ofrece es una mujer muy emprendedora y luchadora demuestra que puede salir adelante. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, detergentes, pan, grano básicos y gaseosas pues se acerca una buena temporada navideña y quiere comprar suficiente productos.
texts.en: Lucia Ramona is 71 years old.  She has been selling general merchandise for more than 12 years.  She began this way of life with few products.  The majority of her clients live nearby; they always come to see what she is selling.  She is very enterprising with a fighting spirit and demonstrates that she knows how to thrive.  The loan is for buying candy, soft drinks, detergents, breads, grains and soda so that she will have sufficient merchandise on hand for the lucrative holiday season.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Doña Teresa es de una comunidad que se llama "Llano las rosas", municipio de San Jose del rincon, doña Teresa tiene 55 años de edas, y cumplio 38 años de casada viviendo con su esposo, tubo 7 hijos, 6 de sus hijos ya son casados y tienen una vida aparte, la mas chica de sus hijas tiene 24 años, es soltera y vive con ellos pero no depende de doña Teresa porqué trabaja y cubre sus propios gastos, tambíen cuando puede le ayuda a doña Teresa con algo en su casa puede ser para la comida o otra cosa que se nesecite. Doña Teresa tiene casa propia y un negocio que es una tienda de abarrotes.
El prestamo que solicita lo piensa invertir en su negocio de la mejor manera; lo primero que quiere hacer es comprar un molino para nixtamal, y después comprar mercancía como; huevo, chiles en lata, refrescos, galletas, sabritas, golosinas, en fin todo el producto que hace falta y vende una tienda de abarrotes, tambíen quire comprar unos pollos y guajolotes para criar, en todo esto quire invertir el prestamo que le van a dar.

Para doña Teresa es dificil cuando le llegan los gastos de la luz y del agua, porqué a veces le llegan caros y no tiene como pagar, en ocaciones le ayuda su hija pero no es siempre, cuando no recibe ayuda tiene ocupar dinero de su tienda para pagar y para volver a invertir ya no tiene, si doña Teresa no paga es peor porqué le cortan la luz, para volver a poner la luz sale mucho más caro. Lo mismo sucede con el agua.

Una meta de doña Teresa es comprar una becerra lechera, de está manera ya no compra la leche y ella misma la pude ordeñar, porqué la leche se la venden muy cara y no le alcanza para los 3 que viven en su casa.

Para doña Teresa es muy importante ahorar las ganancias para la vejez, ella piensa que años mas tarde no va a ver nadie quien vea por ellos y les den el dinero que nesecitan para cualquier enfermedad, por eso quiere hacer sus ahorros pronto.
texts.en:
Doña Teresa is from a community called "Llano las rosas", or the Plain of the Roses, in the town of San Jose del Rincon. She is 55 years old, and has been married to her husband for 38 years. She has 7 children, 6 of whom are now married and living independently. Her youngest daughter is 24 years old and single, and still lives with them. However, she works, so she is no longer dependent on Teresa and her husband for her expenses, and she also helps Doña Teresa when she can with whatever is needed, such as food or other necessities in the home. Doña Teresa owns the house, and she also has a  grocery store.

The loan she is seeking will be invested in her business in the best way possible: the first thing she wants to do is to buy a cornmeal milling machine, and then buy merchandise such as eggs, canned chiles, cookies, chips, and sweets - everything she needs that a grocery store should sell. She also wants to buy some chickens and turkeys to raise, and she needs the loan to do all of this.

It is difficult for Doña Teresa when the electricity and water bills come in, because sometimes they can be so expensive that she doesn't know how she will pay. On occasions her daughter helps her out, but not always, and when she can't Doña Teresa has to use money from the store, which she then can't re-invest. However, if she didn't pay it would be worse, because they would cut the electricity and then having it reconnected would be much more expensive. The same thing happens with the water. 

One of Doña Teresa's goals is to buy a young milk cow, and thus no longer have to buy milk. Milk is very expensive to buy and there is never enough for the three of them in the house. 

For Doña Teresa it is very important to save her earnings for her old age. She thinks that in years to come there may be no-one to look after her and her husband and give them the money they need to treat any ailment that might befall them. For that reason she wants to save her money.

loans.use: Doña Teresa is going to use the loan to buy merchandise for a grocery store. The products she sells and needs at present are: eggs, soup, canned chiles, fruit and vegetables, soft drinks, napkins, toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Alejo

texts.es:
Don Alejo vive en la comunidad de "Llano las rosas", municipio de San José del rincon, tiene 57 años de edad y es un hombre casado cumplio 38 años de casado, tiene casa propia y solo una hija vive en su casa, su hija ya trabaja y le ayuda con algunos gastos en su casa, de dependientes solo esta su esposa, aunque la esposa de don Alejo tambien ayuda porqué ella vé que ahora es mas dificil la economía, es por eso que ella atiende una tienda de abarrotes que puso en su casa. 
Don Alejo ya no puede buscar trabajo por que ya es una persona mayor y no consigue en ningun lado, él fue albañil, y siempre trabajó la siembre en su propio terreno, todavia trabaja su terreno en tiempo de siembra y cosecha, pero conseguir un trabajo ya no, es por eso que en estos momentos don Alejo solamente se dedica a criar animales para venderlos.

Don Alejo cría borregos y con el prestamo quiere comprar corderitos y unos becerros todo para criar, por el momento don Alejo no va ver ganancias alcontrario hay que mantenerlos por un tiempo, pero lo que le ayuda es que cosecho y tiene la pastura para mantenerlos.

Don Alejo quiere que en unos meses los animales que vaya a comprar den crias y su situación economica pueda mejorar mucho, con las ganancias don Alejo las quiere ahorar puesto que piensa en su vejez y en la situación economica que pueda estar, de ese modo pueda sacar dinero para la comida y las medicinas que puedan nesecitar él o su esposa.
texts.en:
Alejo lives in the “Llano Las Rosas” community, San José del Rincón municipality.  He is 57 years old and has been married 38 years.  He owns his house and just has one daughter still living with him.  She works and helps out with some of the household expenses.  His wife is his only dependent although she too helps out because, seeing how difficult the situation is, she tends to a store installed in the house.

Because of his age, Alejo can no longer look for work; he can’t find employment anywhere.  He used to be a bricklayer and always worked his fields.   He still works in his fields during planting and harvesting but getting a job isn’t a reality anymore.  Therefore, Alejo only raises animals to sell now. Currently he raises lambs and will use the loan to buy baby lambs and a few calves to raise.

For the moment, Alejo won’t realize any profits.  On the contrary, he’ll have to feed them for a time.  But what helps is that he has harvested and has pasturage to feed them.

Alejo says that he hopes the animals he will buy will produce offspring in a few months so that his economic situation will improve greatly.  Alejo wants to use his profits to save up because at his age and with the economic situation that might develop he will be able to have money available for food and medicines he or his wife might need.

loans.use: To buy lambs and calves to raise and then sell.

loans.name: Ma Del Carmén

texts.es:
Doña Carmén vive en la comunidad de "Los lobos II sección", está comunidad pertenece al Municipio de San José del Rincón, de la cabecera del municipio, a la comunidad de doña Carmén se hace como 15 minutos en taxi, si es en camion es mas tardado, doña Carmen es una mujer casada, ya son 18 años los que cumplio viviendo con su esposo, tiene 2 hijas que dependen de ella, una hija de 13 años y una de 15 años, las dos mujeres estudian la secundaria en su comunidad, pero tiene que darles para el pasaje de ida y el de vuelta, el esposo de doña Carmén trabaja como albañil en la construcción que se le requira, a veces no hay trabajo para el señor, puesto que su actividad laboral es hasta que se termine la construcción despues de ahí hay que volver a esperar otro trabajo, tanto doña Carmén como su esposo ambos terminaron la primaria e iniciaron la secundaria pero no la acabaron, en estos momentos el esposo de doña Carmém trabaja, y doña Carmén, se dedica atender su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y carnes frias, esté negocio está funcionándo va para dos años que lo inicio y poco a poco se va haciendo de clientes
Doña Carmén quire comprar mercancia que le hace falte para que no se vea el negocio vacío y no lo deje vaciar, por eso solicitó el prestamo, con el dinero que va a recibir va a comprar carnes frias como; jamón de pavo, chuleta ahumada, salchichas, varios tipos de queso, cremas y longaniza, por el otro lado tambien alcanzar a comprar a los proveedores de la tienda, como sabritas, refrescos, galletas y pan.
Doña Carmén comenta que lo dificil fue inicar el negocio y la gente la conozca de ahi en fuera no se queja doña Carmém de su negocio y menos en está temporada de Navidad y Año nuevo porqué es muy buena para ella. 
Una meta de doña Carmén es ampliar el negocio y separar el local en dos negocios para que en cada uno lo llena y sean más cosas las que pueda vender.
texts.en:
Carmén lives in the “Los Lobos II Sección” community which is part of the San José del Rincón municipality.  Carmén’s community is 15 minutes by taxi from the municipal seat; the trip by bus takes longer.  

She is married and has been living with her husband for 18 years.  She has two dependent daughters, a 15 year old and a 13 years old.  Both go to the local secondary school but she has to give them money to pay round trip transportation costs.  Her husband works as a bricklayer at construction jobs where he might be needed.  Sometimes there is no work for him because his work only lasts until the construction project is finished and then he has to wait for another job to come up.  Both she and her husband finished elementary school and started secondary school but did not complete it.  Her husband is currently working and Carmén tends to her grocery and cold cuts business.  The business has been in operation almost two years and has gradually been acquiring regular customers.

Carmén wants to buy merchandise she needs so that the shop won’t look empty and she doesn’t let it become empty.  That’s why she asked for the loan.  She will use the money she’ll get to buy cold cuts like: turkey ham, smoked pork chop, sausages, several types of cheese, creams and longaniza.  On the other hand, she also hopes to have enough to buy from store suppliers such things as: Sabritas (brand of snacks), soft drinks, cookies and bread.

Carmén commented how difficult it was to start the business and get to be known by the people there.  However, from then on, Carmén has no complaints regarding the business even less so during the Christmas and New Year season which is very good for her.

One of her goals is to expand the business and split it into two separate businesses so that each one will be full and she will have more things to sell.

loans.use: To buy stock items and groceries for her butcher shop.

loans.name: Jose Dionisio

texts.es:
Jose de 55 años, ha trabajado durante muchos años con esfuerzo para poder mantener a sus dos hijos haciendo ladrillos. 
Viviendo en una zona en Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento había muchas flores orquídeas) aprendió con ayuda de su abuelo y padre cuando él era joven. 

Decidió hacer ladrillos no solo para mantener a sus hijos sino para seguir con el legado que le dejo su abuelo y padre. En l actualidad trabaja desde las 05h30am hasta las 16h30pm todos los días. Los ladrillos los elabora con panelon, jaloncillo y herramientas. 

Para seguir con el negocio familiar el quiere comprar con el préstamo herramientas y materiales para hacer ladrillos. En el futuro quiere expandir el negocio y ser distribuidor al por mayor de ladrillos.
texts.en:
Jose, 55, has worked for many years making bricks to support his two children. Living in an area in Orchids of Guayaquil (an urban area, named after the abundance of orchids found there), Jose learned brick-making with the help of his grandfather and father when he was young.

He decided to make bricks not only to support his children but to continue the legacy left by his grandfather and father. At present he works from 5:30am until 4:30pm every day. The bricks are made with materials and tools.

To sustain the family business, he wants to use loan proceeds to buy more tools and materials for making bricks.  In the future he wants to expand his business and become a wholesale brick distributor.

loans.use: Tools and materials.

loans.name: Marlene Elizabeth

texts.es:
la joven Marlene P. tiene 30 años de edad, vive en el caserio el Obraje Namasigue Choluteca y se dedica a la venta de celulares, recargas, tarjetas de saldo y sim cards.
Marlene es una mujer dedicada a su negocio y es soltera, vive con su mama que tambien le ayuda a vender en su casa cuando ella sale a vender a diferentes lugares cercanos de su hogar.
Marlene vive en una zona muy productiva y muchas personas compran celulares por la facilidad que obtiene un numero de telefono rapido y sin mucho tramite.
sus tiempos libres los dedica a visitar a sus demas familiares.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de celulares, sim cards, tarjetas de pre pago y recargas.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con sus gastos personales y ayudarle a su madre con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
The young Marlene P. is thirty and lives in the village of Obraje Namasigue Choluteca.  She earns her living selling cell phones, recharge minutes, prepaid cards and SIM cards.

She is a woman who is devoted to her business.  She's single and lives with her mother, who helps out by doing sales from home while Marlene is out vending in areas nearby.

Marlene lives in a very profitable area.  A lot of people buy cell phones because it's easy to obtain a phone number quickly and without going through much of a process.

Marlene uses her free time to visit relatives.  She plans to use her loan to buy phone cards, SIM cards, prepaid cards, and recharge minutes.  She needs the income to cover her personal expenses and to help her mother out with household expenses.

loans.use:
compra de celulares, sim cards, tarjetas de pre pago, recargas.
To buy cell phones, SIM cards, prepaid cards, and recharge minutes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.es:
La señora Felisa A. es una persona D. escasos recursos,  ha estudiado hasta 7º D. primaria, ella y su esposo el Sr. Francisco se ganan la vida costurando almohadas.   Tienen 3 hijos menores D. edad los cuales necesitan vestimenta, alimentación y materiales para acudir a la escuela.

La señora Felisa y su esposo el Sr. Francisco se apersonaron a nuestras oficinas con la necesidad D. un crédito para comprar más material para la confección D. las almohadas, ya que se aproxima la navidad y hay cierto crecimiento D. las ventas, ella necesita $us. 1200.- para poder comprar su material y así poder vender la cantidad suficiente D. almohadas y darles a sus hijos una feliz navidad.
texts.en:
Mrs Felisa A. is a person of few economic means who studied up to the 7th year of primary school.  She and her husband Francisco earn a living sewing pillowcases.  They have three dependent children who need clothes, food and materials for school.

Felisa and her husband Francisco came to our offices in person as they needed a loan to buy more material for making pillowcases.  Christmas is approaching and their sales increase during this period.  Felisa needs $1,200 US dollars so that she can buy material and thereby be able to sell enough pillowcases and give her children a happy Christmas.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha Lorena se dedica a la venta de comida. Inicio su negocio para tener un ingreso económico estable. Tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a cargo. Tiene ya 21 años con su venta de comida. Trabaja con su esposo y un empleado que le ayudan a servir la comida para sus clientes. Ella atiende desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche la variedad del platillos que ofrece es muy variada. Con el préstamo quiere comprar grano básicos, verduras, platos, leña,  En el futuro quiere remodelar el local para tener una mejo apariencia al público.
texts.en: Martha Lorena sells food.  She started her business so that she would have a stable income.  She has two dependent children in her care and has been in this business for 21 years.  She works with her husband and an employee who help her to serve food to her customers.  She works from 7.00am to 10.00pm and prepares a wide range of dishes.  She will use her loan to buy basic grains, vegetables, dishes and firewood.  In the future, she would like to remodel her premises so that it looks smarter for her customers.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor Manuel tiene 43 años, su actividad económica es la venta de bloques. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio. Inicio porque sus padres anteriormente se hacían cargo del negocio lo aprendió porque necesitaba obtener la manera de generar ingresos a si hogar, con el paso del tiempo es que ha logrado salir adelante. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de cemento, piedrín, arena.
texts.en: Víctor Manuel is 43 years old.  He sells blocks and has been in this business for more than 10 years.  He started because his parents used to be in the business.  He learned the trade because he needed to be able to make more income for his household.  Over time, he has managed to get ahead.  He will use this loan to buy cement, gravel and sand.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Enrique Florentino

texts.es:
Enrique de 49 años, viviendo en una zona en Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento había muchas flores orquídeas) aprendió de su abuelo y padre cuando él era joven hacer ladrillos. Decidió hacer ladrillos no solo para mantener a su hijo sino para seguir con el legado que le dejo su abuelo y padre. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde las 05h30am hasta las 17h00pm todos los días elaborando ladrillos con panelon, jaloncillo y herramientas artesanales.  Para seguir con su negocio él quiere comprar con el préstamo herramientas para su negocio. Tiene pensado en un futuro expandir su negocio y arreglar su casa para darle un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Enrique, age 49, lives in Orquídeas de Guayaquil (an urban neighbourhood, named for the many types of orchids that grew there when the area was first discovered). He learned to make bricks when he was young, taught by his father and grandfather. He decided to go into brick-making not just as a means to support his own son, but also to carry on the legacy of his father and grandfather.  

At present he works from 5.30 am until 5pm every day, making bricks with "panelon" and "jaloncillo" clays, and special tools. To continue with his business, he wants to use the loan to buy tools. He has thoughts of expanding the business in future, and improving his house to give his family a better future.

loans.use: Tools

loans.name: Álvaro Carrillo Group

texts.es:
El nombre que se le da al siguiente grupo es “Álvaro Carrillo”, es en honor a la calle donde se encuentra ubicado el grupo, también en honor al personaje ilustre de este gran compositor mexicano, originario de la costa chica de Pinotepa Nacional, el grupo esta integrado por un numero de 12 personas, en su totalidad son mujeres, la mujer que representa a este grupo es Antonia Florencia López Martínez, todas las integrantes tienen actividades diferentes con las cuales apoyan a sus familias.
Haremos mención de una integrante del grupo llamada Rosa Elia Jiménez C. de 31 años de edad, ella es madre soltera y tiene a un niño de 4 años de edad llamado Jared quien estudia la educación preescolar (kinder), Rosa Elia se dedica  ala venta de dulces y golosinas de manera ambulante en diferentes puntos de la ciudad, tales como el  parque central, en las afueras de las escuelas públicas y en diferentes puntos de mayor concurrencia, Rosa no tiene estudios apenas si concluyo el cuarto año de primaria, ella es miembro de una familia muy humilde, y viven en un pequeña casa de materiales de laminas de cartón, madera y otros diferentes al concreto, tiene 4 hermanas y su padre se dedica a la elaboración y venta de nieves de sabores, su madre tiene 60 años de edad y también vende dulces. Una de las situaciones mas difíciles  a la que actualmente se enfrentó Rosa es  a la perdida total de su mercancía, ella nos cuenta hace unos días se metieron a robar en su casa y se llevaron toda la mercancía que ella y su familia tenían como inversión de mucho trabajo, al igual que algunas cosas que tenían como patrimonio, dejándolos en la total ruina ella con lagrimas nos narraba su desesperante situación y su tristeza e impotencia no las podía ocultar ante los demás.
Rosa Elia  se integró un grupo de crédito por la gran necesidad de empezar desde cero su negocio ya que su inversión de toda la vida se la arrebataron en unos cuantos minutos, ella va a comprar sus productos que tradicionalmente vende que son paletas de caramelo macizo de diferentes sabores, paletas de cajeta, goma de mascar, frituras de harina de maíz, pulpas de tamarindo, paletas de tamarindo, dulces de menta, palanquetas de cacahuate, cacahuates tostados, maíz para palomitas, salsa de chile para jícamas y gelatinas.
Rosa tiene la gran esperanza de reponerse muy pronto a la perdida de de su patrimonio al igual que recuperar la inversión de la familia, ella desea tener una casa digna donde vivir y que su negocio no tenga que pasar por lo mismo otra vez, ella sueña con ver a su hijo salir adelante y ser una persona de bien y de trabajo , le gustaría darle mas estudios a su niño en un futuro y que pueda hacer crecer su negocio, o incluso empezar otro mas, lo mas anhelado es que su familia salga adelante que no tengan carencias como las de hoy y que sus padres puedan descansar sin la necesidad de salir a la calle a trabajar.
Las integran al grupo “Álvaro Carrillo”  son mujeres sencillas, que su único deseo es  salir adelante cambiar su calidad de vida, ellas creen en los sueños, en las ilusiones de tener un mundo mejor donde no haya tanta pobreza y desigualdad.
Rosa Elia llorando de alegría a la vez de tristeza nos regala una sonrisa sin ocultar su pena, su sonrisa es el mejor agradecimiento que nos puede brindar, le agradece enteramente a fundación realidad y a los que apoyan a kiva por ser tan generosos.
 Estos son los nombres de las mujeres que integran al grupo “Álvaro Carrillo” y su actividad  de cada una de ellas.  

Feliza Antonia  Miguel. – Venta de quesos
Antonia Florencia López Martínez.- Venta de perfumes
Epifania S. Peláez.- tienda de ropa
Griselda Guadalupe González Hernández.- Venta de agua purificada
Alicia B. H..- Venta de refrescos
Pula Zacarías R..- Carpintería
Catalina C. López.- Estética
Martha patricia Barragán R..- Taller de serigrafía
Antonia C. Sánchez.- Venta de dulces
Rosa Elia Jiménez C..- Venta de dulces
Minerva C. R..- Venta de antojitos	
Juana Marisol Jiménez R..- Venta de perfume
texts.en:
The name of the following group, “Álvaro Carrillo”, is in honor of the street where the group is located and also in honor of the illustrious Mexican composer, originally from the coast of Pinotepa Nacional.  The group is composed of 12 people, all women. The woman who leads this group is Antonia Florencia López Martínez.  All of the women have different activities with which they support their families.

We will tell the story of one member of the group, named Rosa Elia Jiménez C.. 31 years old, she is a single mother and has a 4-year-old son named Jared who is in kindergarten.  Rosa Elia dedicates herself to the sale of candy as a street vendor in different parts of the city, such as the central park, outside of public schools and at various intersections.  Rosa did not have formal schooling after having completed 4th grade, she comes from a humble family and lives in a small house made of laminated cardboard, wood, and concrete.  She has 4 sisters and her father is engaged in making and selling flavored ice, while her mother of 60 years also sells sweets.

One of the most difficult situations facing Rosa is the total loss of her inventory: she tells us a few days ago her house was robbed and they took all of her merchandise that she and her family worked so hard for, as well as some of their other investments, leaving them totally ruined.  She described her desperate situation with tears of sadness and frustration that she could not hide.

Rosa Elia joined a credit group out of the extreme necessity to restart her business from scratch after her life savings were stolen in a few minutes.  She will use the loan to purchase the products that she has traditionally sold: hard candy in different flavors, popsicles, caramels, candy made from cajeta syrup, chewing gum, cornmeal fritters, tamarind pulp and candies, mints, peanut brittle, roasted peanuts, popcorn, chile sauce for jicama, and jellies.

Rosa has great hope that she will bounce back very soon and that she will also be able to recuperate her family losses.  She wants to have a dignified house and not to have her business go through that again.  She dreams of seeing her son succeed one day and become a good person who works at a good job.  She would like to give him more schooling in the future and grow the business, or even create another one.  The most important thing for her family going forward is that they do not have gaps in income as today, and that her parents will be able to retire without having to work in the streets.

The members of the “Álvaro Carrillo” group are simple women, whose only desire is to improve their quality of life; they believe in their dreams, in the vision of a better world where there is not so much poverty and insecurity.

Rosa Elia, crying in happiness and sadness at the same time, smiles at us without hiding her pain.  Her smile is the best form gratitude we can provide, thank you to Fundacion Realidad and to those who support Kiva for being so generous.

These are the names of the woman who make up the “Álvaro Carrillo” group and each of their businesses:

Feliza Antonia Miguel – Cheese sales
Antonia Florencia López Martínez – Perfume sales
Epifania S. Peláez – Clothing store
Griselda Guadalupe González Hernández – Purified water sales
Alicia B. H. – Refreshments sales
Pula Zacarías R. – Carpenter
Catalina C. López – Cosmetics
Martha Patricia Barragán R. – Silkscreen workshop
Antonia C. Sánchez – Sweets sales
Rosa Elia Jiménez C. – Sweets sales
Minerva C. R. – Snacks sales	
Juana Marisol Jiménez R. – Perfume sales

loans.use: She will use the loan to purchase the products that she has traditionally sold: hard candy in different flavors, popsicles, caramels, candy made from cajeta syrup, chewing gum, cornmeal fritters, tamarind pulp and candies, mints, peanut brittle, roasted peanuts, popcorn, chile sauce for jicama, and jellies.

loans.name: Ebenezer 1, 2 Group

texts.en:
Aracelis is one of the members of the Ebenezer 1 & 2 Group, located in the city of Hato Mayor, a primarily agricultural region. It is one of the most rural cities in the Dominican Republic, where there are often drinking-water and electricity shortages. The population of this area is comprised of Dominicans and Haitian immigrants. Her primary activity is to sell household products.

Aracelis is the mother of three children, who live with her and their father. She tells us that her biggest challenge has been to study. Her favorite activity is to take care of her children.

Aracelis is very excited to receive her first loan through Esperanza International. She has had her business for six months, which she started with a small amount of savings she had and with her initiative to generate income and be useful. She plans to invest this new loan into purchasing various types of household products like dish-washing liquid, soap, detergent, etc. Her dream is to become like a professional with her business.

loans.use: To buy dish-washing liquid, soap, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Olegario

texts.es:
El señor Olegario G. H. ha nacido el 6 de marzo de 1971, es de la comunidad de Sankayani Bajo de la Provincia de Tiraque del Departamento de Cochabamba.

El señor Olegario se dedica a la agricultura, vive en el sector más elevada de la Provincia, la producción que realiza es estacional que produce una vez al año,  siembra papa, haba, oca y cereales. Los trabajos lo realizan toda la familia en algunos casos con ayuda de sus vecinos de lugar como aine, mink’a según sus costumbres de lugar.

Las condiciones en las que viven son muy modestas, tienen una casa de barro con techos de paja que están construidas sin ninguna planificación de la vivienda  las corrales de sus animales están alrededor de la casa, ahi viven toda la familia con sus hijos y su esposa.
El crédito que solicito es para comprar terreno agrícola, ya que no tiene suficiente terreno para sembrar más grande, y no abastece en ese sentido el señor va ampliar su producción para mejorar las condiciones de vive en su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Olegario G. H. was born on 6 March 1971. He is from the community of Sankayani Bajo in Tiraque Province in the Department of Cochabamba.

Señor Olegario is a farmer. He lives in the highest sector of the province. His production is seasonal, producing one crop a year. He plants potatoes, faba beans, oca (an edible root) and cereals. His entire family works, sometimes with help from neighbors like the aine and mink’a (indigenous groups in the area), according to the customs of the region.

The conditions in which they live are very modest. They have a mud house with a straw roof that is constructed without any planning for a dwelling. The enclosure for their animals surrounds the house. The entire family lives there.

The loan that Señor Olegario has applied for is to purchase agricultural land since he doesn’t have enough land to plant more. In this way he is going to enlarge his production in order to improve living conditions for his family.

loans.use: Purchase of agricultiural land.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes tiene 37 años, ella se caracteriza por ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes. Su actividad es una pulpería que inicio hace más de 10 años, ella ha demostrado que puede salir adelante y ayudar a mejorar sus ingresos. Es por eso que se encuentra muy motivada con este medio de vida, ya que ha sido con el paso del tiempo que ha logrado adquirir la experiencia necesaria. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, granos básicos entre otros. Sueña con mejorar su pulpería y proporcionarle a su familia los ingresos básicos.
texts.en: Mercedes is 37 years old.  She is known for offering good service to her customers.  Her business is a small grocery store that she set up more than 10 years ago.  She has shown that she can get ahead and improve her income.  This is why she is very motivated by this way of life since, over time, she has managed to acquire the necessary experience.  She is requesting this loan to buy candies, soft drinks, bread, basic grains, etc.  She dreams of improving her grocery store and providing her family with a basic income.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor es una joven de 18 años, es el hijo menor de 4 hermanos, acaba de volver de la republica de la argentina donde estaba 3 años trabajando en una empresa de costura, pertenece a una familia de escasos recursos económicos razón por la cual no ha llegado a estudiar ni siquiera hasta el bachillerato solo ha llegado a estudiar hasta la 3 grado.

Víctor vive en la comunidad de la maica central  con la madre en una habitación que todavía no ha terminado de construirse.

Víctor en la actualidad se dedica a la producción de la leche cruda como su madre y sus hermanos, con los ahorros de su trabajo en Argentina se compró 3 cabezas de ganado lechero también trabaja de albañil con su tío que es contratista mientras la madre le cuida el ganado pero todas la mañas muy temprano va a recoger forraje para todo el día.

El préstamo será destinado para la compra de otra cabeza de ganado lechero, para que de esta manera pueda incrementar la producción de la leche.
Entre sus sueños y metas es construir su propia casa, en un terreo que su madre le heredara y lo más importante, crecer en su actividad de producir leche.
texts.en:
Víctor is a young man of 18.  He is the youngest of four siblings and has just returned from Argentina where he worked for a dressmaking company for 3 years.  He belongs to a family of few economic means which means that he hasn't managed to study, even for his high school diploma.  He only studied up to third grade.

Víctor lives with his mother in Maica Central community.  He lives in a room which is still not yet fully built.

Víctor currently works producing raw milk like his mother and siblings.  With the savings he made from his work in Argentina, he bought 3 heads of dairy cattle.  He also works as a construction worker with his uncle, who is a contractor, while his mother looks after the cattle.  However, every morning Víctor goes out very early to collect fodder for the day.

Víctor will use his loan to buy another head of dairy cattle so that he can increase his milk production.  His dreams and goals are to build his own house on a plot of land that his mother will give him as an inheritance and, most importantly, grow in his milk-producing business.

loans.use: To buy a head of dairy cattle to increase his operating capital

loans.name: El Gran Esfuerzo 3, 5 Group

texts.en:
Yanet P. is one of the members of the El gran esfuerzo ("the great effort") 3 & 5 Group located in the city of Hato Mayor, a primarily agricultural region. It is one of the most rural cities in the Dominican Republic where there are often drinking water and electricity shortages. The population of this area is comprised of Dominicans and Haitian immigrants. She operates a little underwear store.

Yanet is a single mom of one child and she lives with her parents. She tells us that her biggest challenge is to have her own house. Her favorite activity is tending to her business and work.

Yanet is very excited to receive her fourth loan through Esperanza Internacional, after having successfully repaid her previous loan. This was a step toward making her business grow. She has had her business for about two years. She started with a small amount of savings she had. She plans to invest this new loan into purchasing various types of underwear. She plans to use her profits to invest in her business and save to build her house and buy a car as soon as her business improves. Her dream is to have a house and to live quietly in it with her family.

loans.use: To buy more underwear to sell

loans.name: Union Progreso Group

texts.es: Cecilia es nueva socia D. la alcancía comunal “Unión y Progreso.” Tiene 27 años D. edad, es conviviente, tiene dos hijos D. 2 y 5 años. Ella venD. hamburguesas, alitas, salchipapas en Chosica desD. hace 4 años, ya que solo trabaja por las tardes en este negocio ella decidió solicitar el préstamo a EDAPROSPO y utilizar este capital para comprar ropa y zapatillas para niños y venderlo durante el día aprovechando la campaña navidad, en un futuro no muy lejano le gustaria  dedicarse más a la venta D. ropa para niños. En la fotografía se pueD. apreciar a las socias muy contentas en compañía D. sus niños.
texts.en: Cecilia is a new member of the 'Unión y Progreso' community bank.  She is 27 years old and lives with her partner.  She has two children aged 2 and 5.  Cecilia has been selling hamburgers, chicken wings and 'salchipapas'  (a fast food maD. from thinly-sliced, pan-fried sausage or hot dog, french fries and condiments) in Chosica for 4 years.  As she only works afternoons in this business, she decided to request a loan from EDAPROSPO and use the capital to buy children's clothes and shoes which she could sell during the day, taking advantage of the Christmas season.  In the not-so-distant future she would like to devote more of her time to selling children's clothes.  In the photo you can tell that the bank's members are very happy in their children's company.

loans.use: To buy and sell children's clothes and shoes

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SOLITARIO SE LLAMA SAN JOSE PORQUE ES EL SANTO PATRONO D. L. COMUNIDAD. ESTA UBICADO EN L. COMUNIDAD D. NUEVO BUENAVISTA QUE PERTENECE AL MUNICIPIO D. SAN MIGUEL SOYALTEPEC EN EL ESTADO D. OAXACA. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR  7 INTEGRANTES QUE SE CONOCEN PORQUE VIVEN EN L. MISMA COMUNIDAD Y SON VECINOS. ESTE ES SU 4° PRÉSTAMO CON FUNDACIÓN REALIDAD.

EL REPRESENTANTE DEL GRUPO SE LLAMA RUTILO V. L. TIENE 38 AÑOS, ESTUDIO HASTA EL 6 AÑO D. PRIMARIA ES CASADO Y TIENEN 5 HIJOS: 4 SON MUJERES Y 1 HOMBRE. 
Rutilo tiene UN TAQUERIA EN SU CASA A L. CUAL LLAMO "EL RINRIN" PORQUE ASI LLAMA A SU HIJO EL MAS PEQUEÑO. EL NECESITA un CREDITO PARA COMPRAR CARNE, ACEITE, TORTILLAS, TOMATES, CHILES, PLATOS Y bolsas DESECHABLES. SUS VECIONOS NOS COMENTAN QUE SON LOS MEJORES TACOS  D. L. COMUNIDAD. DON RUTILO ESPERA EN UN FUTURO TENER SU PROPIO LOCAL PARA QUE SU NEGOCIO crezca Y ASI BRINDARLE UN MEJOR SERVICIO A SUS CLIENTES, CON SUS GANACIAS ESPERA DARLES ESTUDIOS A SUS HIJOS Y UNA MEJOR CALIDAD D. VIDA.

L. SEÑORA FIDENCIA L. S. TAMBIEN ES INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPOP SAN JOSE, ELL. NO ESTUDIO ES CASADA Y TIENE 4 HIJOS LOS CUALES YA ESTAN CASADOS. ELL. SE DEDICA A CRIAR CERDOS PARA POSTERIORMENTE VENDERLOS TAMBIEN TIENE UN PEQUEÑO MOLINO D. MAIZ ELL. REALIZA SUS ACTIVIDADES DESD. SU HOGAR, SU préstamo LO INVERTIRA EN L. COMPRA D. MAIZ, ALGUNAS piezas PARA SU MOLINO Y ALIMENTO PARA SUS CERDOS. DOÑA FID. COMO L. LLAMAN SUS VECINOS ESPERA EN UN FUTURO COMPRAR UN MOLINO NUEVO PORQUE EL QUE YA TIENE ES MUY VIEJO.

LOS OTROS 5 INTEGRANTES SE LLAMAN BIBIANA H. A., SUSANA A. D. L. L. VENDEN ABARROTES(van a comprar FRIJOL, MAIZ, ARROZ, ACEITE, DULCES Y REFRESCOS ), CESAREA J. B. VEND. REFRESCOS, GILLERMINA B. R. Y CRISTINA V. L. CRIAN CERDOS PARA VENDERLOS POSTERIORMENTE.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is called San José because San José is the patron saint of the group's community.  The group is located in Nuevo Buenavista community which is in the town of San Miguel Soyaltepec, in the State of Oaxaca.  The group has 7 members who all know each other because they are neighbors.  This is their fourth loan with Fundación Realidad.

The group's representative is called Rutilo V. L..  He is 38 years old and studied up to the sixth year of elementary school.  He is married and has 5 children: 4 daughters and 1 son.  Rutilo has a taco restaurant in his home which is called 'El Rinrin' because that is the name of his youngest child.  He needs a loan to buy meat, oil, tortillas, tomatoes, chilis, dishes and disposable bags.  His neighbors tell us that his are the best tacos in the community.  Rutilo hopes that in the future he will have his own premises so that his business can grow and he can proviD. his customers with a better service.  He hopes to use his profits to proviD. his children with an education and a better quality of life.

Mrs Fidencia L. S. is also a member of the San José group.  She didn't study.  She is married and has four children who are already married.  She raises pigs which she then sells.  She also has a small corn mill.  She carries out her businesses from her home.  She will invest her loan in buying corn, some pieces for her mill and feed for her pigs.  Doña FiD., as her neighbors know her, hopes in the future to buy a new mill because the one she has now is very old.

The other 5 members of the group are called Bibiana H. A. and Susana A. D. L. L. who sell groceries (they will buy beans, corn, rice, oil, sweets and soft drinks), Cesarea J. B. who sells soft drinks, and Gillermina B. R. and Cristina V. L. who raise and sell pigs.

loans.use: For buying, raising and selling pigs, for selling groceries and for selling Mexican food (tacos)

location.town: NUEVO BUENAVISTA, SAN MIGUEL SOYALTEPEC, OAXACA

loans.name: Valerio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “TERESA DE JESUS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Valerio; el tiene 42 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de trabajo del ministerio de cultura, el socio trabaja desde el 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, el socio quiere seguir adelante. El  socio solicita el préstamo para el uso personal y mantenimiento de su casa.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the "TERESA DE JESUS" communal bank, located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

Valerio is 42 years old and single. As well as his daily activities he works in the ministry of culture from 8am to 5pm. He wants to progress and is requesting a loan for personal use and for the upkeep of his home. 

He is happy to receive a loan and is committed to repaying it.

loans.use: The partner is requesting a loan for personal use and the upkeep of his home.

loans.name: Vecinas Unidas 3, 7, 8 Group

texts.en:
Lucia is the coordinator of her group, Vecinas Unidas  (Unites neighbors) 3, 7, 8. She says that her most difficult challenge is to study at the university. In the meantime, she continues to enjoy working.

Lucia is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She is starting her business with this loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying silver rings, necklaces, bracelets and other silver jewelry. She will use the profits to invest in her business and save because she wants to make her dreams come true. She wants to study business administration, planning to rule her own business. That is why she is taking this loan and will focus on working hard and moving her business forward. With the help of God, she will.

Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's other Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients. Her group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsuL. with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: To buy silver rings, necklaces, bracelets and others

loans.name: Daniel Serapio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “TERESA DE JESUS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Daniel Serapio; el tiene 60 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de trabajo del ministerio de cultura y por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere seguir mejorando. El  socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su casa.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the "TERESA DE JESUS" communal bank, located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

Daniel Serapio is 60 years old and single with 3 children. As well as his daily activities he works at the ministry of culture and supports his children through his work. He wants to improve his living conditions and is requesting a loan for the upkeep of his home. 

He is very happy with the loan and is committed to repaying it as agreed.

loans.use: The partner requests the loan for the upkeep of his home.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en la casa de su hermana. Hace más de 10 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, productos que son vendidos diariamente a sus clientes. Su trabajo o realiza durante las mañanas, recorriendo las calles de su zona para visitar a sus clientes, quienes la esperan para recibir la mercadería o en todo caso para adelantar el pago del cosmético que lo compró a crédito. Asimismo vende también lencería, prenda que al igual de los cosméticos tiene mucha demanda. Para ella es muy importante tener un control adecuado de sus ventas ya que esto le permitirá saber cuanto está ganado, es así como ha logrado establecerse en este negocio, y por tal motivo espera tener más capital de trabajo. Es el crédito numero 8 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del crédito que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más cosméticos al por mayor y aprovechar la campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Carmen is 38 years old.  She lives with her husband and two children in her sister's house.  She has been selling cosmetics for more than 10 years and she sells them to her customers daily.  She does her work in the mornings, walking the streets of her neighborhood, visiting her customers who wait for her so that they can receive their merchandise or make their payments for the cosmetics that they have bought on credit.  Carmen also sells underwear which, like cosmetics, are in high demand.  For her it is very important to have adequate control of her sales since this will allow her to know how much she is making.  This is how she managed to establish herself in this business and for this reason, she hopes to gain more working capital.

This is Carmen's 8th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She also likes being a member of her community bank because all the members are people she knows.  They are all responsible and very supportive of one another.  Carmen thanks everybody who will help fund her loan since it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will invest her loan in buying more cosmetics wholesale and take advantage of the Christmas season.

loans.use: To stock up with beauty products since there is a lot of demand during the Christmas season

loans.name: Barahunda Group

texts.es:
Esta Unidad de Desarrollo sus integrantes lo han llamado “Barahunda” porque es el nombre de su comunidad y por el significado de la palabra que es: “fiesta, bullicio, ruido o confusión” ya que este grupo se caracteriza por ser muy alegre y unido. Este grupo está ubicado en la comunidad de Barahunda a 1 hora de la ciudad de Tierra Blanca en el estado de VeraC., está conformado por 13 personas y es su 3° préstamo con Fundación Realidad.

La representante del grupo se llama Maricela T. Ramírez tiene 40 años estudio hasta el sexto grado de primaria y es madre soltera de 3 hijos de los cuales 2 son niñas y uno es niño. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio en su hogar llamado "Novedades Isabel" en el que vende ropa de dama y caballero, zapatos y bisutería (pulseras, anillos y collares elaborados con materiales de adorno). Ella necesita su préstamo para comprar más ropa y surtir su negocio, para poder obtener más ganancias y hacer que negocio crezca poco a poco. Ella espera en un futuro agrandar su local y darles estudios a sus hijos. La señora Maricela se encuentra muy agradecida con FRAC por haber llevado este programa hasta su comunidad el cual les permite tener una mejor calidad de vida. La señora Josefa C. B. también es integrante del grupo Barahunda tiene 33 años, estudio hasta el tercer año de secundaria, es madre soltera de dos hijos un niño de 13 años y una niña de 12 años los cuales estudian. Ella tiene en su casa un pequeño deposito de refrescos, también vende antojitos mexicanos (empanadas, gorditas, tostadas, tacos, tortas y pollos asados). “Doña Chepa” como la llaman sus compañeros invertirá el préstamo en la compra mercancía (tortillas, maíz, queso, mayonesa, lechuga, tomates, cebollas, pollos, chiles y frijol) para la preparación de sus antojitos. Ella espera con sus ganancias pagar a tiempo su préstamo y seguir invirtiendo para poder darles más estudios a sus hijos
Los otros 11 integrantes son:

Maria de Lourdes G. C.- venta de catálogo de de perfumes, talcos pinturas, para su venta
Mónica Delfín C.- venta de perfumería
José Antonio Ramírez R.-venta de ropa de dama y caballero, pollo
Elia M. L.-venta de muebles 
Alicia Sánchez C.-venta de productos naturistas 
Rosa Ramírez R.-venta por cata lago de cosméticos
Víctor Luis C. C.-venta de pescado 
Etanislao R. S.-venta de ganado 
Iraís E. Hernández-venta de zapatos para dama
Rebeca Hernández S.-venta de calzado para dama y caballero
Adolfina P. C.- venta de oro
texts.en:
The members of this development unit gave it the name "Barahunda" because it is the name of their community and because the meaning of the word is "party, bustle, noise or confusion" and this group is characterized by being very happy and united.  This group is located in the town of Barahunda, an hour away from the city of Tierra Blanca in the state of VeraC..  It is comprised of 13 people and this is their third loan from Fundación Realidad.

The leader of the group is Maricela T. Ramírez, 40 years old, who was in primary school until sixth grade and is a single mother of 3 children, 2 of which are girls and one is a boy.  She has a small business of her own called "New Isabel" where she sells men's and women's clothing, shoes, and jewelry (bracelets, rings, and necklaces adorned with decorative materials).  She needs her loan in order to purchase more clothing and fill her shop so that she is able to earn more money and grow her business little by little.  She hopes to increase the size of her shop in the future and enable her children to continue their studies.  Ms. Maricela is grateful to FRAC for bringing this program that allows for having a higher quality of life to the community.

Ms. Josefa C. B. is another member of the Barahunda group, 33 years old, who studied until the third year of high school.  She is a single mother of two, one 13-year-old boy and one 12-year-old girl who are both in school.  She has a small inventory of soft drinks in her house and also sells Mexican food (empanadas, gorditas, tostadas, tacos, cakes, and grilled chicken).  “Doña Chepa”, as her friends call her, will invest the loan in ingredients (tortillas, corn, cheese, mayonnaise, lettuce, tomatoes, onions, chicken, peppers and beans) for the preparation of her snacks. She expects to repay her loan on time and continue investing in order to enable further education for her children.

The other 11 members are:

Maria de Lourdes G. C.- catalog sales of perfumes and makeup
Mónica Delfín C.- perfume shop sales
José Antonio Ramírez R.- men's and women's clothing, chicken
Elia M. L.- furniture sales 
Alicia Sánchez C.- sales of natural products 
Rosa Ramírez R.- cosmetics through catalog
Víctor Luis C. C.- fish sales 
Etanislao R. S.- livestock sales 
Iraís E. Hernández- sales of women's shoes
Rebeca Hernández S.- sales of footwear for men and women
Adolfina P. C.- gold sales

loans.use: to purchase perfume, clothing, shoes, fishing nets, and food for sale

loans.name: Doris Yolanda

texts.es:
Doris es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutas”  ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Puno, tiene 50 años de edad, de estado civil  soltera y tiene  02 hijos. Realizó estudios de educación superior incompleta.

Esta  trabajando con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 09 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio, ella se dedica a la  venta de artículos artesanales.

Solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  invertirá  para comprar lanas para sus tejidos (chompas, guantes, medias), también nos cuenta que hará un pedido de miel de abeja para comercializar este producto.  Esta actividad la realiza sola.

Su visión a futuro es tener un puesto o tienda para venta de artesanías.
	
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el apoyo entre las socias.
texts.en:
Doris is a member of the 'Las Kantutas' community bank which is located in the district and province of Puno.  She is 50 years old, single and has two children.  She didn't finish her higher education.

Doris has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 9 years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her business selling handicrafts.

Doris is requesting a new loan for 3,000 Peruvian soles which she will invest in buying yarn for the knitted items she makes (sweaters, gloves and tights).  She tells us that she will also make an order for honey that she will sell.  She carries out her business alone.

Doris' vision for the future is to have a stall or a store where she can sell her handicrafts.  What she most likes about her community bank is the way all the members support each other.

loans.use: To invest in buying yarn for her knitting (sweaters, gloves, tights).  She will also order some honey to sell.

loans.name: Maria Adilia

texts.es:
María es una mujer dedicada al trabajo, para apoyar a sus hijos, hoy en día ya casados la mayoría.
El trabajo que hace es de costura oficio que aprendió en su juventud, que ha sido hoy en día para apoyar  a su familia. Su esposo labora como albañil y ambos se apoyan para lograr cubrir los gastos.
Ella no solo,  hace costura ajena, si no que hace ropa para vender y ayudarse más, elabora mas ropa para niñas que es la que se mueve más en sus ventas.
Atreves del financiamiento ha logrado aumentar la producción en la costura ya que trabajaba con poco capital, ahora esta comprando más estilos, colores, y variedad de tela. Lo que para ella es de gran beneficio poder elevar su nivel de ventas.
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara: tela de satinada, tela de seda, dacron,encajes,hilos de diferente colores para hacer su costura.
texts.en:
María is a woman who is devoted to her work through which she supports her children, most of whom are now married.  María works as a dressmaker, a trade that she learned in her youth and which has helped her to support her family.  Her husband works as a builder and both of them work together so that in order to cover their expenses.  María does sewing for other people and she makes clothes to sell.  She mostly makes girls' clothes as they sell the best.

Through loans, María has managed to increase her production as she used to have little capital with which to work.  Now she is buying more styles, colors and a wider variety of fabric.  This is useful for her and enables her to increase her level of sales.

María will use this new loan to buy satin, silk, polyester, lace and different colored threads to make her clothes.

loans.use: To buy satin, polyester, silk, lace and different colored threads for making her clothes
